title: Customer Support Specialist
description:
Location: Singapore

As the monetary system decays under debt, inflation and irresponsible governance, our mission at BullionStar is to return Gold & Silver to its rightful place as money. Having established our presence as the leading bullion dealer in Singapore with an edge in technology, we have now expanded to the United States and New Zealand as part of our international growth plans.

If a fast-paced, high growth, dynamic and multi-cultural environment excites you, join us on our journey.

Interested in the bullion industry? Love being around Gold & Silver all day? We are hiring an individual for a Customer Support Specialist role. This role will build a solid foundation for a career in the precious metals industry, allowing you to learn the ins and outs of the bullion industry first-hand from precious metals experts and acquire a hands-on working experience within the operations of a bullion dealer.

About BullionStar

BullionStar is the leading bullion dealer in Singapore. With BullionStar, customers are offered a modern platform for trading and holding physical bullion. The online platform is complemented with a newly renovated and expanded bullion shop, showroom and vault in Singapore. BullionStar has an excellent reputation with a review rating of 4.9 on Google Reviews based on more than 1,000 genuine customer reviews.
• We lead in technology - We are the most modern bullion dealer in the world employing proprietary cutting-edge technology into our age-old industry.
• Excellent learning opportunity - With us you will work with a range of different projects and tasks being mentored by our precious metals experts.
• We pay above average salaries and offer you a competitive benefits package.

Roles & Responsibilities:
• Provide outstanding customer service by efficiently managing inquiries and support through phone and email communication channels.
• Professionally handle high volume of inquiries from clients and customers.
• Take ownership of achieving individual KPIs and contributing to overall team performance goals.
• Assist in driving, developing and improving BullionStar’s customer care program.
• Continuously identify work process improvements.
• Communicate effectively to other members of the team and the team lead when help is needed.
• Uphold a high level of integrity by ensuring customer information remains strictly confidential at all times.
• Perform office-based administrative duties whenever required.

Who Should Apply?

Please apply if you possess all of the below skills and characteristics:
• Meticulous: Demonstrates strong attention to detail in handling customer inquiries, data accuracy, and administrative responsibilities.
• Versatile: You are required to switch between speaking with customers, to hands-on operational work, to desk-bound administrative work throughout the day.
• Great Communicator: You need to be proficient in verbal and written English to communicate effectively with our customers. Fluency in additional languages and/or dialects is a plus. As part of an integrated and international team, you are furthermore encouraged to communicate openly and directly across all levels of the organization.

Qualifications
• Diploma in any field

Location & Work hours

The job location is BullionStar's bullion shop, showroom and vault at 45 New Bridge Road. This bustling location is located in between Chinatown and Clarke Quay with the Clarke Quay MRT located just across the road making commuting easy.

5-day work week, 1 Saturday inclusive.

Salary and Benefits

The salary is dependent on your capability, experience and skills. The typical starting salary is from SGD 2,700 to SGD 4,000 per month for a driven candidate, plus up to 3 months' bonus. In addition, BullionStar provides an Annual Wage Supplement (AWS) equivalent to 1 month salary. BullionStar furthermore offers reimbursement of medical bills and access to an employee health and fitness benefit program.

title: Solutions Customer Service Assistant
description:
Location: Singapore, Singapore

Thales is a global technology leader trusted by governments, institutions, and enterprises to tackle their most demanding challenges. From quantum applications and artificial intelligence to cybersecurity and 6G innovation, our solutions empower critical decisions rooted in human intelligence. Operating at the forefront of aerospace and space, cybersecurity and digital identity, we’re driven by a mission to build a future we can all trust.

In Singapore, Thales has been a trusted partner since 1973, originally focused on aerospace activities in the Asia-Pacific region. With 2,000 employees across three local sites, we deliver cutting-edge solutions across aerospace (including air traffic management), defence and security, and digital identity and cybersecurity sectors. Together, we’re shaping the future by enabling customers to make pivotal decisions that safeguard communities and power progress.

title: Associate - Customer Support  31O25
description:
Job Description:

As an Associate - Customer Support, you will play a crucial role in delivering outstanding service to our clients by addressing inquiries and resolving potential issues they may encounter. This position is tailored for individuals with a passion for communication and a drive to problem-solve, aiming to enhance overall customer satisfaction and loyalty. Your responsibilities will include engaging with customers across multiple channels, ensuring their experience with our products and services is both positive and productive. You'll need to demonstrate empathy, patience, and technical competency, acting as a primary point of contact for troubleshooting and escalating situations to higher-level support when necessary.

Responsibilities
• Respond promptly and courteously to customer inquiries through various communication channels.
• Investigate and resolve customer complaints to ensure their satisfaction and retention.
• Escalate unresolved issues to higher-tier support or relevant department as needed.
• Maintain a detailed log of customer interactions and transactions in the database.
• Provide accurate and comprehensive information about products and services to customers.
• Identify customer needs and offer personalized solutions to improve their experience.
• Collaborate with team members to facilitate satisfactory resolutions for customer issues.
• Participate in training sessions to stay updated with product knowledge and new technologies.
• Monitor customer feedback to continuously improve support processes and service delivery.
• Assist in creating and updating support documentation and FAQs for customer self-help.
• Communicate with internal teams to troubleshoot and resolve complex customer issues.
• Deliver exceptional customer service aligned with the company’s values and objectives.

Requirements
• Bachelor’s degree or equivalent experience in customer service or related field.
• Excellent verbal and written communication skills in English.
• Strong problem-solving skills with the ability to work independently and efficiently.
• Proficiency in using customer service software, databases, and tools is preferred.
• Ability to stay calm and composed under pressure in a fast-paced environment.
• Proven track record of delivering exceptional customer service experiences.
• Flexible with working hours, including possible evenings, weekends, and holidays.

title: Customer Support Specialist
location: Al Ain - Abu Dhabi - United Arab Emirates
description:
Role purpose:

To assist customers in their banking requirements by delivering high quality service while projecting ADIB's professional image in all interpersonal dealings.

Key accountabilities of the role:

These are the main responsibilities of this role:

Responsibilities:
• Maintaining a high level of service attitude towards customers.
• Executing, distribution, recording of customer instructions from various channels e.g. incoming mail, fax etc.

• General administrative work which may include preparation of memos, customer letters, filing etc.

Specialist skills / technical knowledge required for this role:

• Knowledge of cross sales.
• Computer skills.

Note: This position is for UAE nationals only.

title: UX/UI & Graphic Designer – Blockchain Projects
description:
Job Title: UX/UI & Graphic Designer – Blockchain Projects

Location: Remote/On-site (Indore)
Company: Quest Global Technologies

Job Overview:

Quest Global Technologies is seeking a creative and versatile UX/UI & Graphic Designer with experience in designing engaging user interfaces and experiences for blockchain websites and applications. The ideal candidate should have strong proficiency in Figma, Adobe Photoshop, Adobe Illustrator, After Effects, video editing, motion graphics, and 3D design. This role requires a keen eye for detail and the ability to translate complex technical concepts into visually engaging and user-centric designs.

Key Responsibilities:
• Design modern, user-friendly UX/UI for blockchain websites, dashboards, and applications using Figma.
• Create intuitive user experiences and interactive prototypes that align with product goals.
• Develop high-quality illustrations, icons, and branding assets using Adobe Illustrator and Photoshop.
• Produce promotional and explainer videos, including animation, motion graphics, and 3D visuals.
• Design and edit GIFs and visual assets for social media, websites, and product interfaces.
• Create 3D models, visuals, and animations for immersive UX/UI experiences.
• Collaborate with development and marketing teams to ensure design consistency and usability.
• Create wireframes, prototypes, and design mockups for new features and products.
• Understand user flows, blockchain UX principles, and design for both desktop and mobile interfaces.
• Ensure brand and UX/UI consistency across all visual assets.

Required Skills and Qualifications:
• Bachelor’s degree in Graphic Design, UX/UI Design, Visual Arts, or a related field.
• 2–4 years of experience as a UX/UI or Graphic Designer, preferably in tech or blockchain industries.
• Proficiency in Figma, Adobe Creative Suite (Illustrator, Photoshop, After Effects, Premiere Pro), and 3D design software (Blender, Cinema 4D, or equivalent).
• Experience designing for web and mobile platforms with a focus on usability and accessibility.
• Strong knowledge of motion graphics, animations, 3D videos, and video editing.
• Understanding of blockchain-related UX/UI elements and terminology.
• Creative thinker with strong communication and collaboration skills.

Preferred Skills:
• Experience working on NFT, DeFi, or Web3 UX/UI design projects.
• Familiarity with Lottie animations, SVG exports, and responsive design practices.
• Understanding of basic front-end development tools (HTML/CSS knowledge is a plus).

Benefits:
• Competitive salary and performance incentives.
• Flexible work environment – Remote/On-site options.
• Work on exciting and innovative blockchain UX/UI projects.
• Creative freedom and opportunities for skill advancement.

Apply Now: Interested candidates can send their portfolios and resumes to hr@questglt.org with the subject line: "UX/UI & Graphic Designer – Blockchain Projects".
Contact no. - +91-XXXXXXXXXX

title: graphic designer,uxui designer/video editing
description:
Job Summary: We are seeking a highly versatile and creative uxui , graphics and video editor to champion the visual identity and user experience across all our digital platforms and marketing channels. This hybrid role requires a strong generalist who can seamlessly transition between strategic user experience design, polished graphic asset creation, and compelling video production. You will be instrumental in translating brand strategy into engaging, effective visual and interactive experiences.

Freelancers and agencies need not apply.

Key Responsibilities

1. UX/UI & Digital Product Design (User Experience)
• Design and Prototype: Translate product requirements and user research into intuitive user flows, wireframes, and prototypes for our website and mobile application.
• User Advocacy: Conduct basic usability testing and leverage data to make informed design decisions that enhance user satisfaction and conversion rates.
• Design System: Maintain and evolve a consistent UI design system and style guide, ensuring visual and functional consistency across all digital interfaces.

2. Graphic Design & Branding (Visual Identity)
• Marketing Assets: Design high-impact digital and print marketing materials, including social media ads, website banners, email campaigns, presentations, and print collateral.
• Brand Consistency: Ensure all visual output strictly adheres to and elevates the company's brand identity and aesthetic standards.
• Asset Management: Prepare final artwork files for production and manage the centralized library of visual assets.

3. Video Editing & Motion Graphics (Dynamic Content)
• Video Production: Edit, assemble, and finalize raw video footage into engaging, polished videos for marketing campaigns, tutorials, social media, and internal communications.
• Post-Production: Execute professional-level color grading, audio mixing, and sound design.
• Motion Graphics: Create and integrate motion graphics, titles, and visual effects to enhance video storytelling and branding.

Required Skills & Qualifications
• Proven experience (X+ years) in a professional design role with a portfolio that clearly demonstrates expertise across UX/UI, Graphic Design, and Video Editing.
• Software Mastery: Expert proficiency in the following industry-standard tools:
• UX/UI: Figma or Sketch/Adobe XD (for prototyping and wireframing).
• Graphic Design: Adobe Creative Suite (Photoshop, Illustrator, InDesign).
• Video Editing: Adobe Premiere Pro and Adobe After Effects.
• Strong understanding of design principles (typography, color theory, visual hierarchy) and user-centered design (UCD) methodology.
• Excellent storytelling skills, both visual and sequential, to create compelling marketing and user-facing content.
• Ability to manage multiple projects simultaneously, prioritize tasks, and meet strict deadlines.
• Strong communication skills to articulate design decisions and collaborate effectively with cross-functional teams (marketing, product, engineering).

Preferred Qualifications
• Bachelor’s degree in Graphic Design, Digital Media, or a related field.
• Experience in a fast-paced startup or agency environment.

Pay: ₹10,000.00 - ₹30,000.00 per month

Benefits:
• Paid sick time
• Paid time off
• Work from home

title: UX Designer, Core Strategic Experience
description:
(Please note that portfolios are required to be in consideration for this role.)

The Morgan Stanley Wealth Management UX team builds digital experiences that help our clients manage their finances and monitor their investments easily on the Morgan Stanley and E*TRADE from Morgan Stanley platforms. Our growing team of designers and researchers bring an entrepreneurial spirit to a leading global financial firm. We employ design thinking methods and user-centered approaches to solve real business problems. If you can bring clarity to complexity, design holistically in an immense product ecosystem, and have gone the extra mile to create delight, we want you!

We're looking for a UX Designer to help with Morgan Stanley's family of products to enhance the user experience and drive customer engagement. You'll be in involved in efforts to build, iterate, and improve upon our tools - reduce clicks, automate selections, and rethink and integrate new, complex workflows in an intuitive manner.

What You’ll Do In The Role
• Working closely with the UX lead, help execute the product vision by being involved in every step of the end-to-end product design process
• Understand the underlying needs and motivation of our clients to ensure we achieve business goals and provide value to our clients
• Craft intuitive and elegant experiences that empower our clients to make confident financial decisions
• Work closely with our research team to synthesize qualitative and quantitative data and make value-driven design decisions that translate into clear, simple UIs
• Create and present a variety of design deliverables (sketches, wireframes, user flows and prototypes) in a way that engenders confidence in you and your solutions with the team and the greater organization
• Form holistic solutions that integrate seamlessly into our wealth management product ecosystem
• Design and deliver responsive/adaptive solutions that are optimized for web and mobile interfaces and partner with engineers to translate designs into successful products
• Work closely with the larger Wealth Management UX team to share design best practices, align on patterns, and promote a design-centric culture at the firm
• Advocate for all user abilities by thoroughly testing design deliverables to meet WCAG ADA compliance Relevant experience and mindset
• You have an outstanding portfolio that demonstrates how you have created experiences that solved business and user needs
• You've spent 2-5 years as a UX designer who was a key contributor to the success of products that have launched
• You have a bachelor's degree in design or related field preferably, master's degree a plus
• You have excellent skills in Figma
• You have experience designing intuitive interfaces that enhance user experience and drive customer engagement
• You can leverage research, wireframes and prototypes to effectively validate and enhance your design concepts to achieve the best possible solutions for your users
• You thrive in a collaborative, explorative environment and you value being on a diverse team to brainstorm and get feedback from within a large organization
• You practice active listening and contribute in group situations, like brainstorms, audits, critiques, and whiteboard sessions
• You get excited by complex projects with high levels of ambiguity and are resilient in the face of obstacles

What You’ll Bring To The Role
• You have an outstanding portfolio that demonstrates how you have created experiences that solved business and user needs
• You've spent 2-5 years as a UX designer who was a key contributor to the success of products that have launched
• You have a bachelor's degree in design or related field preferably, master's degree a plus
• You have excellent skills in Figma
• You have experience designing intuitive interfaces that enhance user experience and drive customer engagement
• You can leverage research, wireframes and prototypes to effectively validate and enhance your design concepts to achieve the best possible solutions for your users
• You thrive in a collaborative, explorative environment and you value being on a diverse team to brainstorm and get feedback from within a large organization
• You practice active listening and contribute in group situations, like brainstorms, audits, critiques, and whiteboard sessions
• You get excited by complex projects with high levels of ambiguity and are resilient in the face of obstacles

What You Can Expect From Morgan Stanley

We are committed to maintaining the first-class service and high standard of excellence that have defined Morgan Stanley for over 89 years. Our values - putting clients first, doing the right thing, leading with exceptional ideas, committing to diversity and inclusion, and giving back - aren’t just beliefs, they guide the decisions we make every day to do what's best for our clients, communities and more than 80,000 employees in 1,200 offices across 42 countries. At Morgan Stanley, you’ll find an opportunity to work alongside the best and the brightest, in an environment where you are supported and empowered. Our teams are relentless collaborators and creative thinkers, fueled by their diverse backgrounds and experiences. We are proud to support our employees and their families at every point along their work-life journey, offering some of the most attractive and comprehensive employee benefits and perks in the industry. There’s also ample opportunity to move about the business for those who show passion and grit in their work.

To learn more about our offices across the globe, please copy and paste https://www.morganstanley.com/about-us/global-offices into your browser.

Certified Persons Regulatory Requirements

If this role is deemed a Certified role and may require the role holder to hold mandatory regulatory qualifications or the minimum qualifications to meet internal company benchmarks.

Flexible work statement

Interested in flexible working opportunities? Morgan Stanley empowers employees to have greater freedom of choice through flexible working arrangements. Speak to our recruitment team to find out more.

Morgan Stanley is an equal opportunities employer. We work to provide a supportive and inclusive environment where all individuals can maximize their full potential. Our skilled and creative workforce is comprised of individuals drawn from a broad cross section of the global communities in which we operate and who reflect a variety of backgrounds, talents, perspectives, and experiences. Our strong commitment to a culture of inclusion is evident through our constant focus on recruiting, developing, and advancing individuals based on their skills and talents.

description:

WM Platforms consists of nine sub-teams including: Field Experience & Platforms, Digital Client Experience & Platforms, Workplace Platforms, Automation & Workflow Solutions, Digital Trading & Investing, UX Design & Research, Strategy & Execution. Are you an experienced Human Resources manager looking for a new and exciting opportunity to make an impact? Join The Job4U Job, a leading provider of online part-time jobs, and be part of a dynamic team that redefining the future of work.

Talent Acquisition: Lead the end-to-end recruitment process, from sourcing to onboarding, ensuring we attract the right candidates for our diverse job offerings.

Proven experience as an HR Manager or similar role.

Familiarity with employment laws and regulations.
Problem-solving and conflict resolution abilities.
A passion for fostering a diverse and inclusive workplace.

Flexible Work Environment: We believe in work-life balance and offer flexible working arrangements.
Professional Growth: The Job4U Job is committed to the growth and development of its employees. You will have access to various training programs and opportunities.
Innovative Culture: We encourage new ideas and initiatives, making it an ideal place for creative professionals.
Competitive Compensation: Enjoy a competitive salary and benefits package.
If you are a dynamic HR professional who is passionate about shaping the workforce of the future, we would love to hear from you. Join The Job4U Job and be part of an organization that revolutionizing part-time employment.

Apply now to embark on an exciting journey with us. Your expertise will be instrumental in helping individuals kickstart their careers and achieve their professional aspirations.

title: Junior - Intermediate UI/UX Designer
description:
About Bitkernel

Bitkernel Technology Inc. is redefining how the world experiences digital video. With a proven track record of innovation, we’re on a mission to revolutionize streaming technology and build complete content ecosystems. Headquartered in Austin, Texas, with a growing office in Vancouver, B.C., we’re building our future in North America.

Powered by our groundbreaking platform, Goose, we’re creating a next-generation self-serve SaaS solution that enables content creators, broadcasters, and media companies to launch and scale OTT streaming services across Android, iOS, Web, and SmartTV platforms.

Why Join Bitkernel?

At Bitkernel, you’ll experience the energy of a startup with the stability of an established product—and the opportunity to make a global impact. You’ll help shape major technical innovations, collaborate with visionary leaders, and solve complex, global-scale challenges backed by long-term R&D investment.

We thrive on empathy, innovation, and continuous learning. Our team is made up of curious, strategic thinkers who combine deep technical expertise with emotional intelligence and a collaborative spirit across cultures and disciplines.

Join us to build, innovate, and grow as we redefine how the world experiences digital video.

Bitkernel DNA (is it in you?)

Startup Hustle: You thrive in fast-paced, ambiguous environments with a hands-on, problem-solving attitude.

Boundary-Breaking Vision: You challenge conventions to pioneer innovative, world-class user interfaces.

AI-Enhanced Innovation: You harness AI to supercharge development workflows and push the boundaries of what’s possible.

About The Role

We’re looking for an Junior - Intermediate UX/UI Designer to join our growing product team and help craft seamless, user-centered experiences across web and mobile platforms. You’ll work closely with senior designers, Product Manager, and developers to translate ideas into polished, intuitive interfaces.

What You'll Do:
• Support the design of user flows, wireframes, and prototypes for responsive web and mobile experiences.
• Contribute to maintaining and expanding the Figma design system, including components and documentation.
• Collaborate with Senior Designers, Product Managers, and Developers to deliver intuitive, user-centered designs.
• Translate feedback into design improvements and iterate quickly based on user and stakeholder input.
• Assist in preparing developer-ready designs and ensuring design consistency across platforms.
• Participate in design reviews and help maintain accessibility and UX best practices.
• Stay current with design trends, tools, and usability standards.

What We Require For This Role:
• 2–5 years of experience in UX/UI design or a strong portfolio showcasing relevant projects
• Proficiency with Figma (auto layout, components, prototyping)
• Basic understanding of design systems and visual design principles.
• Strong attention to detail, visual sense, and problem-solving mindset
• Collaborative and open to feedback, with clear communication skills

Bonus Points For Candidates Who Have:
• Basic understanding of HTML, CSS, and JavaScript is a plus
• Spanish, Mandarin or other second language proficiency
• Experience in streaming video or media platform space is a strong plus
• Top-Tier Education: You hold a Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Engineering, or a related field from a 4-yr accredited institution globally ranked in the top 500 universities.

Perks & Benefits
• Career Development Opportunities: Access to learning resources, mentorship, and professional growth.
• Collaborative Team Environment: Engage in team-building activities and thrive in a creative, supportive workplace.
• Great Work Environment: Work from our modern office, with flexibility to work from home on Fridays.
• Comprehensive Benefits: Extensive health & benefits plan, LTD & Life Insurance.
• Global Opportunities: Join a company with international reach and potential for future travel and team-building abroad.
• Pay Equity: We base pay on your experience, location, and internal equity to make sure everyone is compensated fairly and consistently.

How to Apply

Please send your resume and portfolio showcasing your design process and final work. We love seeing how you think and create!

The Pay Range For This Role Is

60,000 - 85,000 CAD per year(Vancouver)

We're building the biggest digital board game platform on the internet. Last year, our players spent 2,466 years playing 45 million games on our Settlers of Catan alternative. Anticipate user interactions and solve design challenges effectively, leveraging your expertise without relying on extensive testing or interviews
Use tools like Figma and other cutting-edge design platforms to ideate, create, and refine designs

5+ years of experience as a UI/UX Designer, preferably on game platforms.

• Ability to leverage data insights to drive design

• Comfortable with remote and asynchronous working environments
• Excellent written and verbal communication skills in English

Expertise in animations and micro-interactions
Experience leading design sprints
Familiarity with Discord and GitHub for project collaboration.
Knowledge of CSS frameworks and libraries
We strongly adhere to these values in our team - if these resonate, then you’ll love working here!
We're self-driven players who deliver without needing supervision. In our remote environment, written communication is key. Competitive salary paid in USD
Fully remote work
Flexible hours - Work on your own time, we’re async
Unlimited vacation

title: Freelance UX Designer
description:
UX Designer is needed in Ontario, Canada.

Client: OpTalent | Recruitment

Location: Ontario, Canada

Contract: undefined
Job Description

Our manufacturing client is looking for a UX/UI Designer who combines creativity with data insight - someone who can design intuitive, engaging digital experiences while owning our web analytics setup (GA4, GTM, and reporting). This role is ideal for someone who loves both designing beautiful, user-friendly web experiences and diving deep into performance data to drive continuous improvement.
Responsibilities:
• Execute and manage all web design requests from new landing pages to full section redesigns.
• Design and deliver user-centered interfaces through wireframes, mockups, and prototypes using tools like Figma or Photoshop.
• Conduct regular website audits (quarterly and yearly) to ensure content, imagery, and UX elements are current, relevant, and optimized in collaboration with the Website Manager.
• Research and bring insights from competitors, adjacent industries, and web design trends to improve usability and functionality.
• Manage, configure, and own GA4 and GTM ensuring accurate tracking, reporting, and troubleshooting of website data.
• Deploy and maintain tags, triggers, and variables in Google Tag Manager for custom events and user interactions.
• Track and analyze web performance reports to identify issues, test improvements, and find opportunities for optimization.
• Provide regular web analytics reports and insights to strategy leads and other stakeholders.
• Collaborate with developers, marketing, and content teams to align design and data strategies.
• Run A/B tests and use analytics to inform design enhancements that improve engagement and conversions.
Requirements

Qualifications:
• Minimum 5 years of proven experience as a UX/UI Designer with a strong portfolio of web projects.
• Proven experience as a UX/UI Designer with a strong portfolio of web projects.
• Hands-on experience with Google Analytics 4 (GA4) and Google Tag Manager (GTM), including setup, event tracking, and troubleshooting.
• Strong understanding of UX principles, responsive design, and accessibility standards.
• Skilled in design tools like Figma, Photoshop, etc.
• Experience with A/B testing and conversion rate optimization.
• Bonus: working knowledge of HTML, CSS, and JavaScript.
Additional Information

Compensation:
• Competitive salary, with an additional bonus opportunity.
• 3 weeks paid vacation, plus December holiday closure.
• Escalating employer-match pension contributions after one year of service.
• Generous corporate profit sharing program.
• Comprehensive benefits package including Health, Dental, and Life Insurance coverage.
• Employee discount on products.
Posted in 18 hours

title: UI/UX Graphic Designer
description:
BIS Safety Software is a fast-paced, high-growth organization providing leading software for the safety industry. We are expanding our team and seeking a full-time creative UI/UX Graphic Designer to join our team.

Your next opportunity is just a play button away! Join our UI/UX Design Team at BIS Safety Software!

About this role

We're on the lookout for a junior UI/UX/Graphic Designer to join our dynamic team! This role offers a unique blend of UI/UX design with a sprinkle of marketing. If you're passionate about creating captivating user experiences and eager to make your mark in a collaborative environment, this opportunity is for you!

This is an in-person role based out of our Sherwood Park, AB office.

What You Bring to the Table:
• A meticulous eye for detail, fueled by your passion for UI/UX design.
• A willingness to adapt and embrace constructive feedback, always seeking ways to improve.
• Thrives in an autonomous environment, enjoys problem-solving and has an eye for aesthetic design and customer appeal.
• Sharing your ideas in meetings to drive collaborative progress and foster a culture of open communication.
• Excels at handling repetitive tasks with precision and efficiency, ensuring quality every step of the way.
• Possess exceptional interpersonal and oral communication skills.
• Have a solution-based approach to challenges.
• Thrive in dynamic, fast-paced work environments.
• Are highly organized and proactive, and able to manage and prioritize projects effectively.
• Self-motivated with a drive to excel, even without constant supervision.
• A positive attitude and a knack for brainstorming innovative creative ideas.
• Your integrity, compassion, and humility shine through in everything you do.
Here's What You'll Be Doing:
• Actively participate in the creation of wireframes, mock-ups, and prototypes, bringing UX/UI design concepts to life.
• Translate design concepts into functional prototypes
• Work collaboratively with a large team of software developers to ensure accurate design execution, providing guidance throughout the development process.
• Maintain design cohesion and consistency across our platform, ensuring a seamless user experience.
• Support marketing and branding efforts by creating design assets as needed.
• Seek feedback from senior designers and actively participate in design critiques and discussions.
• Take ownership of assigned tasks and demonstrate a willingness to learn and grow professionally.
• Optimize designs for performance, accessibility, and scalability.
• Stay updated on industry trends and emerging technologies in UI/UX design.
Qualifications:
• Previous experience or education in UI/UX Graphic Design, with a portfolio showcasing your skills.
• Strong knowledge of Figma
• Experience in Adobe Creative Suite (Photoshop, Illustrator, InDesign) would be considered a bonus.

$50,000 - $55,000 a year
Salary ranges are based on experience, reflecting the unique skillset each individual brings to the role.

Posting ID: #T202503-27CGD

Why join us

At BIS, we pride ourselves in being very entrepreneurial in nature. Our office is an open environment that lends itself to collaboration and organic learning. We integrate new ideas and best practices quickly when they further the development of our software and company. This flexibility is a key part of our culture and a reflection of our insightful and collaborative team.

Another key part of our culture is our purposeful avoidance of titles. We don’t use job titles as they don’t reflect the value we place on humility. And we lead with our heart, treating all our customers and team members with integrity and compassion.

We are looking for like-minded individuals who are interested in growing with us.

In addition, we also offer the following:

Comprehensive benefits package

Health spending account

Growth opportunities

Flexible working hours

On-the-job training

Work-life balance

Free on-site parking

Team Recognition Points

Social committee

Fun, open and collaborative environment

Be More Than an Employee

BIS is a company where you can not only grow your career but also share in the success you help create. Our Employee Stock Ownership Plan (ESOP) allows you to own a piece of the business and build equity in the company’s future.

We'd love to hear from you

If this describes you, please submit a creative application that is sure to grab our attention. Submit your résumé and cover letter in confidence through this posting.

Visit our Careers Page to learn more.

We sincerely thank all applicants for their interest, however, only applicants selected for interviews will be contacted.

title: Associate UX/UI, Graphic Designer
description:
We’re looking for an experienced visual designer to design and develop visually compelling and beautiful creative assets. You will work closely with product managers and developers to create and bring ideas to life to help drive new business.

Your mission as a Hyperspace Ventures graphic designer is to develop and deliver innovative, intuitive, compelling visuals to create a world-class customer experience and build a powerful, profitable brand. You strive to constantly raise the bar on the customer experience. You are responsible for employing user-centric design to address visual excellence. You maintain and develop standards and act responsibly in their execution of these standards, as well strive to continuously innovate and improve. You interact with the relevant business, development, project/program management groups, other designers, and executives to succeed. While driving for expertise in the design field and customer experience, you possess the business acumen to understand the impact of their work within a wider scope.

You are responsible for the vision and execution of graphics and/or visual standards across multiple businesses. This position requires you to think big about how we tell a customer’s story across multiple B2B segments, and then put the vision into action with clearly defined programs. With careful attention to the brand and graphic standards you will drive visual strategy and build strong creative assets reaching customers across multiple segments and business verticals. Other projects you’ll lead include the creation of style guides and updated branding as well as event content and booth graphics (including color palettes, illustrations, and other graphic elements).

If you are passionate about creating innovative, elegant, customer-focused visual experiences and collaborating with a team of passionate marketers, product managers and engineers, we want to talk to you.

1. Work with clients and product managers to understand scope of work requests, key goals, messages, calls to action, etc. so designs reflect these objectives

2. Implement design concepts by compiling PSD files that focus on arrangement, size, type size and style, and related aesthetic concepts.

3. Create images that identify a product or convey a message.

4. Develop graphics for product illustrations, logos, and websites.

5. Select colors, images, text style, and layout.

1. BS/BA in a related field.

2. Proven graphic designing experience.

3. Possession of creative flair, versatility, conceptual/visual ability and originality.

4. Demonstrable graphic design skills with a strong portfolio.

5. Ability to interact, communicate and present ideas.

6. Up to date with industry leading software and technologies (In Design, Illustrator, Dreamweaver, Photoshop etc).

7. Highly proficient in all design aspects.

title: UI / UX Designer
description:
Paradoxum Games is looking for a new UI/UX designer to help us develop our game user interfaces further! As a UI/UX designer, you'll work directly with our art team, and our gameplay engineer team to both design and implement brand new user interfaces that will be viewed by millions of our players!

You're a good fit if you:
• Required: are familiar with project organizational strategies (SCRUM, Agile, etc)
• Required: you must be familiar with industry design (Figma, Photoshop, Illustrator, ect..)
• Required: have excellent written / verbal communication skills in English
• Have experience working with the Roblox game engine
• can design thoughtful & beautiful interfaces, without compromising on usability
• Have a strong work ethic and taking initiative with minimal guidance

You'll be doing:
• Design and implement user interfaces for our projects, including creating wireframes and prototypes in collaboration with game designers, artists, and producers.
• Implement responsive and reactive user interfaces that work seamlessly across all screen sizes.
• Thoroughly test and deploy interfaces to millions of players, ensuring minimal bugs.
• Collaborate with cross-disciplinary peers, managing complex initiatives from start to finish, assessing risks, setting goals, and ensuring timely delivery.
• Conduct research and evaluate user feedback to optimize user interface design.
• Optimize graphic assets to enhance the game interface.
• Brainstorm, design, and pitch user interface ideas to the team.
• Communicate with creative talent to fulfill artistic needs for user interfaces.
• Stay up-to-date with the latest UI trends, techniques, and technologies to keep designs cutting-edge.
• Perform system testing and report bugs to maintain quality and functionality.

Bonus points:
• Have experience working in a self-managed or remote environment
• Have existing Roblox experiences that you have designed and programmed
• Have an understanding of the Roblox platform and player motivations
• Have existing code snippets of your current work, either on GitHub or provided as files
• Have a visual portfolio of your existing work, including video examples of animated user interfaces / components
• Have artistic experience for making your own user interface icons, textures, etc

The listed salary range is an estimate. Actual offers may fall within or exceed this range, depending on factors such as professional background, training, work experience, location, business needs, and market demand.

Please note that this job is only currently available to people that are based in the US! While we'd love to hire from outside the US, currently we're not able to at this time.

title: UX/UI Designer and Graphics Designer for Landing Pages. Website, App and Static Creatives
description:

Our brand operates in the trading and finance space, so we need someone who can create high-converting visuals that look premium, professional, and trustworthy.

You’ll be responsible for designing:

- A good eye for layout, typography, and color harmony (we use dark & gold or dark & purple tones)

- Understanding of social media design trends, especially in finance, trading, or tech

- Experience creating clean, conversion-focused visuals for paid ads and landing pages

- Able to work independently with clear briefs and deliver polished designs fast

💡 Bonus Points:

To Apply, include:

- A short introduction

- Portfolio of previous social media/carousel / UX design work

- Your typical turnaround time

- Your tool of choice (Canva, Figma, Photoshop, etc.)

title: Associate UI/UX Designer
description:
Who We Are

Konrad Group is a next generation digital consultancy. We are dedicated to solving complex business problems for our global clients with creative and forward-thinking solutions. Our employees enjoy a culture built on innovation and a commitment to creating best-in-class digital products in use by hundreds of millions of consumers around the world. We hire exceptionally smart, analytical, and hard working people who are lifelong learners.

About The Role

As an Associate Experience Designer (UI/UX) you will be involved in our design thinking process and the creation of innovative mobile, tablet and web products. You will bridge the gap between design, business, and technology to ship world-class digital experiences for leading companies and global brands.

What You'll Do
• Work with design leads to create compelling interactive experiences
• Perform user research and develop information architecture, user goals, journey maps, and design wireframes and visual interfaces
• Collaborate with developers to ensure pixel perfect execution across all project deliverables
• Work with strategy consultants to gain insights into clients' business and project objectives
• Learn the end-to-end process of project delivery and the associated design tools involved

Qualifications
• Firm grasp of design fundamentals demonstrated by a strong portfolio of digital projects
• Meticulous attention to detail and a keen eye for typography and visual hierarchy
• Clear and effective communication skills in articulating design concepts and rationales
• Proficient in Figma and an eagerness to learn new tools
• Positive attitude with a desire to grow within a collaborative, inspiring teamwork environment

Perks and Benefits
• Mentorship Program
• Comprehensive Health & Wellness Benefits Package
• Retirement Planning
• Parental Leave Program
• Flexible Working Hours
• Work from Home Flexibility
• Service Recognition Programs
• Socials, Outings & Retreats
• Culture of Learning & Development

Bonus Points

Have you taken any courses at BrainStation? A lot of our design and development best practices and processes are taught during our courses - make sure to highlight this experience in your cover letter if you have!

Konrad Group is committed to maintaining a diverse work environment and is proud to be an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants, regardless of race, color, religion, gender, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, national origin, genetics, disability, age, or veteran status will receive consideration for employment. If you have any accessibility requirements or concerns regarding the hiring process or employment with us, please notify us so we can provide suitable accommodation.

The estimated compensation for this position is $70,000 to $80,000. This is an estimate and a compensation offer will vary based on applicant's education, experience, skills, abilities and alignment with market data.

While we sincerely appreciate all applications, only those candidates selected for an interview will be contacted.

title: JR UX Product Designer (100% remote)
description:
Join Tether and Shape the Future of Digital Finance

At Tether, we’re not just building products, we’re pioneering a global financial revolution. Our cutting-edge solutions empower businesses—from exchanges and wallets to payment processors and ATMs—to seamlessly integrate reserve-backed tokens across blockchains. By harnessing the power of blockchain technology, Tether enables you to store, send, and receive digital tokens instantly, securely, and globally, all at a fraction of the cost. Transparency is the bedrock of everything we do, ensuring trust in every transaction.

Innovate with Tether

Tether Finance: Our innovative product suite features the world’s most trusted stablecoin, USDT, relied upon by hundreds of millions worldwide, alongside pioneering digital asset tokenization services.

But that’s just the beginning:

Tether Power: Driving sustainable growth, our energy solutions optimize excess power for Bitcoin mining using eco-friendly practices in state-of-the-art, geo-diverse facilities.

Tether Data: Fueling breakthroughs in AI and peer-to-peer technology, we reduce infrastructure costs and enhance global communications with cutting-edge solutions like KEET, our flagship app that redefines secure and private data sharing.

Tether Education: Democratizing access to top-tier digital learning, we empower individuals to thrive in the digital and gig economies, driving global growth and opportunity.

Tether Evolution: At the intersection of technology and human potential, we are pushing the boundaries of what is possible, crafting a future where innovation and human capabilities merge in powerful, unprecedented ways.

Why Join Us?

Our team is a global talent powerhouse, working remotely from every corner of the world. If you’re passionate about making a mark in the P2P tech space, this is your opportunity to collaborate with some of the brightest minds, pushing boundaries and setting new standards. We’ve grown fast, stayed lean, and secured our place as a leader in the industry.

If you have excellent English communication skills, UI and UX hands-on experience and are ready to contribute to the most innovative platform on the planet, Tether is the place for you.

Are you ready to be part of the future?

About the job

As a Junior Product Designer at Tether, you’ll play a role in supporting the design and evolution of Keet, a P2P, privacy-first communication app developed by the Holepunch team.

Working closely with the Product Design Lead, you’ll help craft clean, intuitive product experiences across desktop and mobile. You’ll contribute to everything from wireframes and user flows to final interface design, prototyping and research. You’ll be helping bring the vision of a secure, decentralised messaging platform to life.

This is a unique opportunity to learn fast, take ownership, and collaborate in a high-performance, fast moving environment.

Responsibilities
• Design user-friendly, accessible interfaces and flows for Keet across mobile and desktop.
• Create wireframes, low and high fidelity prototypes, and final UI screens in Figma.
• Collaborate closely with the Product Designer lead to execute and iterate on new features.
• Prepare design and assets for developers to support smooth handoffs.
• Contribute to user research and usability testing efforts.
• Participate in design critiques, planning sessions and async reviews.
• Occasionally assist in creating marketing or visual assets to support Keet’s branding.
• Deliver high quality work in a fast-paced, remote environment.
• 1-3+ years of experience in product, UX, or UI design.
• Obsession to turn the Keet Chat app into the best user experience
• Proficiency in Figma
• Strong eye and understanding of layout, hierarchy, interaction and usability principles.
• Solid portfolio showcasing digital product work, personal concepts and problem-solving skills.
• Eagerness to learn and take initiative on tasks with guidance.
• Comfortable collaborating with developers and cross-functional teams.
• Fluent English communication skills.
• Bonus: Experience or interest in Web3, messaging platforms, or privacy-first products, or graphic design.

Important information for candidates
Recruitment scams have become increasingly common. To protect yourself, please keep the following in mind when applying for roles:
• Apply only through our official channels. We do not use third-party platforms or agencies for recruitment unless clearly stated. All open roles are listed on our official careers page: https://tether.recruitee.com/
• Verify the recruiter’s identity. All our recruiters have verified LinkedIn profiles. If you’re unsure, you can confirm their identity by checking their profile or contacting us through our website.
• Be cautious of unusual communication methods. We do not conduct interviews over WhatsApp, Telegram, or SMS. All communication is done through official company emails and platforms.
• Double-check email addresses. All communication from us will come from emails ending in @tether.to or @tether.io
• We will never request payment or financial details. If someone asks for personal financial information or payment at any point during the hiring process, it is a scam. Please report it immediately.

When in doubt, feel free to reach out through our official website.

title: SENIOR UX & UI DESIGNER
location: Rome, Metropolitan City of Rome Capital, Italy

title: User Interface Designer
description:
📍 Job Overview

Job Title: User Interface Designer
Company: Rasulson Consulting
Location: Stockholm, Sweden
Job Type: FULL_TIME
Category: User Experience (UX) / User Interface (UI) Design
Date Posted: 2025-10-24
Experience Level: 2-5 Years
Remote Status: On-site

🚀 Role Summary
• Design intuitive, user-centered digital solutions that enhance user experience and drive engagement.
• Conduct comprehensive user research, including interviews and usability testing, to gather actionable insights for design iteration.
• Translate complex business and user needs into clear wireframes, interactive prototypes, and compelling design concepts.
• Contribute to and leverage an established design system to ensure consistency and efficiency across all digital platforms.
• Collaborate effectively within agile, cross-functional teams to deliver high-quality digital products.

📝 Enhancement Note: This role is specifically for a UX Designer, focusing on the user experience aspect of design. While the title is "User Interface Designer," the responsibilities and requirements heavily emphasize user research, usability testing, and translating needs into wireframes and prototypes, which are core UX functions. The company, Rasulson Consulting, operates as a staffing and recruitment firm, meaning this role is likely a client-facing contract position within an IT sector company.

📈 Primary Responsibilities
• Conduct user research, including user interviews and usability testing sessions, to deeply understand user behaviors, needs, and pain points.
• Translate research findings and stakeholder requirements into detailed wireframes, interactive prototypes, and high-fidelity mockups using Figma.
• Actively participate in and contribute to the evolution of an established design system, ensuring adherence to brand guidelines and design consistency.
• Collaborate closely with product owners, developers, and other designers in an agile development environment to iterate on designs based on feedback and technical constraints.
• Facilitate and participate in design reviews, providing constructive feedback and contributing to continuous process improvement initiatives.
• Clearly articulate and present design solutions, user research findings, and strategic rationale to both technical and non-technical stakeholders.
• Ensure a seamless and consistent user experience across all digital platforms by maintaining a holistic view of the user journey.

📝 Enhancement Note: The responsibilities clearly indicate a hands-on UX design role. The emphasis on "translating business and user needs into wireframes, prototypes, and design concepts" and "working within and contributing to an established design system" highlights the need for both strategic thinking and detailed execution. The agile context implies a fast-paced, iterative design process.

🎓 Skills & Qualifications

Education: While no specific degree is mandated, a Bachelor's degree in Design, Human-Computer Interaction (HCI), Psychology, or a related field is often beneficial for understanding user-centered design principles. Equivalent practical experience will also be considered.
Experience: Minimum of 3 years of professional experience specifically as a UX Designer, with a strong portfolio showcasing end-to-end design projects and problem-solving capabilities.

Required Skills:
• User Research: Proven ability to plan, conduct, and analyze user research methodologies (e.g., interviews, surveys, persona development).
• Usability Testing: Experience in designing and executing usability tests, interpreting results, and deriving actionable insights for design improvements.
• Wireframing & Prototyping: Proficiency in creating low-fidelity wireframes and high-fidelity interactive prototypes to visualize user flows and interaction designs.
• Figma Proficiency: Expert-level command of Figma for design, prototyping, and collaboration, including proficiency with its advanced features and components.
• Design System Contribution: Experience working with and contributing to established design systems, understanding component libraries and style guides.
• Agile Methodologies: Familiarity with agile development processes and experience working within scrum or kanban teams.
• Cross-Functional Collaboration: Demonstrated ability to work effectively with product managers, engineers, and other stakeholders in a team-oriented environment.
• Communication Skills: Excellent verbal and written communication skills, with the ability to present complex ideas clearly and persuasively.
• Language Proficiency: Fluency in both Swedish and English, essential for effective communication within the Stockholm-based teams and with international stakeholders.

Preferred Skills:
• UI Design Principles: A strong understanding of UI design principles, visual hierarchy, and aesthetic best practices.
• Information Architecture: Experience in structuring and organizing digital content for optimal user navigation and findability.
• User Journey Mapping: Ability to create detailed user journey maps to visualize user experiences and identify key touchpoints.
• Accessibility Standards: Knowledge of WCAG (Web Content Accessibility Guidelines) and experience designing for accessibility.
• Design Thinking Facilitation: Experience facilitating design thinking workshops or brainstorming sessions.

📝 Enhancement Note: The requirement for 3+ years of experience and proficiency in Figma are critical. The emphasis on both Swedish and English communication points to a diverse or international team, or client base. The "contribution to an established design system" suggests the company has mature design processes.

📊 Process & Systems Portfolio Requirements

Portfolio Essentials:
• Case Studies: Showcase 2-3 detailed case studies that illustrate your UX design process from problem definition to final solution. Each case study should highlight your role, the challenges faced, your methodology, and the measurable impact of your design decisions.
• Figma Expertise: Clearly demonstrate your proficiency in Figma through examples of complex prototypes, component libraries, or design system contributions.
• User-Centered Process: Evidence of your user research and usability testing methodologies, including how you gathered insights and incorporated them into the design.
• Problem-Solving: Examples of how you translated complex business objectives and user needs into elegant and effective design solutions.
• Collaboration & Iteration: Showcase instances where you collaborated with cross-functional teams and iterated on designs based on feedback.

Process Documentation:
• Workflow Design: Examples of documented user flows, information architecture diagrams, or wireframe documentation that clearly outline design logic.
• Design System Usage: If possible, demonstrate how you've utilized or contributed to a design system to ensure consistency and efficiency in your work.
• Research Synthesis: Include examples of how you synthesize user research findings into actionable design recommendations or reports.

📝 Enhancement Note: For a UX design role, a strong, well-documented portfolio is paramount. The emphasis on Figma and design systems indicates that practical, tool-specific skills are highly valued. The ability to articulate process and show measurable impact is key.

💵 Compensation & Benefits

Salary Range: Based on industry benchmarks for UX Designers with 3-5 years of experience in Stockholm, Sweden, the estimated annual salary range is SEK 450,000 - 650,000. This range accounts for the cost of living in Stockholm and the specialized skillset required for this role.

Benefits: As this is likely a contract role through Rasulson Consulting, specific benefits will depend on the end client and the contract terms. However, common benefits for IT consultants in Sweden may include:
• Competitive Salary: As outlined in the estimated range.
• Pension Contributions: Standard pension schemes as per Swedish labor laws.
• Holiday Pay: Accrued holiday pay.
• Professional Development Support: Potential for access to training, workshops, or certifications relevant to UX/UI design, facilitated by Rasulson Consulting.
• Personalized Guidance: Ongoing career support and feedback from Rasulson Consulting's recruitment specialists.
• Networking Opportunities: Access to Rasulson Consulting's network of IT companies and professionals.

Working Hours: The standard full-time work week is typically 40 hours per week, with potential for some flexibility depending on the client's specific operational needs and project deadlines. The role is listed as "On-site," implying a standard office-based schedule.

📝 Enhancement Note: Salary is estimated based on market data for Stockholm. Benefits are generalized for contract roles in Sweden and through recruitment agencies. The "Until 2026-03-31" duration suggests a fixed-term contract.

🎯 Team & Company Context

🏢 Company Culture

Industry: IT Staffing & Recruitment, specializing in the technology sector. Rasulson Consulting partners with technology companies and startups. The end-client's industry is not specified, but it is within the IT sector, likely involving digital product development.
Company Size: Rasulson Consulting is a specialized firm, likely small to medium-sized, focusing on niche IT recruitment. The end-client company size is unknown but could range from startups to established technology firms.
Founded: Rasulson Consulting aims to offer career opportunities for professionals looking to grow within digital development and IT. Their focus is on matching consultants with assignments.

Team Structure:
• Rasulson Consulting Team: A team of recruitment specialists with strong technical expertise and an extensive network.
• End-Client Team: You will be integrated into an agile, cross-functional team at one of Rasulson Consulting's client companies. This team will likely include product owners, developers, QA testers, and potentially other designers.
• Reporting: You will report to a Design Lead or Product Manager at the client company, with ongoing support and career guidance from your contact at Rasulson Consulting.

Methodology:
• Agile Development: The end-client likely operates using agile methodologies, requiring iterative design, close collaboration, and adaptability.
• User-Centered Design: A strong emphasis on understanding and incorporating user feedback into the design process.
• Design System Driven: Reliance on a pre-existing design system for consistency and efficiency.

Company Website: https://jobb.rasulson.com

📝 Enhancement Note: Understanding that Rasulson Consulting is a recruitment firm is crucial. This means the candidate will be working on-site for a client, not directly for Rasulson Consulting, though Rasulson will provide support. The culture will be predominantly dictated by the client company.

📈 Career & Growth Analysis

Operations Career Level: This role is positioned as a mid-level UX Designer, requiring a minimum of 3 years of experience. It offers an opportunity to deepen expertise in user research, prototyping, and design system utilization within various IT environments.
Reporting Structure: You will report to a lead designer or product manager at the client company, working within an agile team. Rasulson Consulting will also provide career guidance and support.
Operations Impact: As a UX Designer, your impact will be directly tied to improving the usability, intuitiveness, and overall user satisfaction of digital products. This directly influences user adoption, retention, and ultimately, the success of the product and business objectives.

Growth Opportunities:
• Skill Specialization: Opportunity to become an expert in Figma and contribute significantly to the client's design system, potentially leading to more specialized design roles.
• Cross-Industry Exposure: Working with different clients through Rasulson Consulting can provide exposure to diverse IT sectors and product types, broadening your experience.
• Design Leadership Potential: Successful performance and demonstrated leadership in design reviews and collaboration could open doors to senior UX/UI roles or design lead positions in the future.
• Continuous Learning: Rasulson Consulting emphasizes ongoing feedback and opportunities for professional development, supporting learning through workshops or courses.

📝 Enhancement Note: The growth potential is significant, especially given the contract nature which allows exposure to multiple projects and companies. The emphasis on contributing to a design system points to opportunities for deeper technical skill development.

🌐 Work Environment

Office Type: On-site at a client's office in Stockholm. The specific office environment will vary depending on the client company, but it is expected to be a professional technology-focused workplace.
Office Location(s): Stockholm, Sweden. Specific office address will be provided upon engagement.

Workspace Context:
• Collaborative Environment: Expect to work closely with product owners, developers, and other team members in an agile setting, fostering a collaborative and communicative atmosphere.
• Tools & Technology: Access to industry-standard design tools, particularly Figma, and potentially other collaboration or project management software used by the client.
• Team Interaction: Regular team meetings, stand-ups, design reviews, and brainstorming sessions will be integral to the daily workflow.

Work Schedule: Standard full-time hours (approximately 40 hours per week), with an on-site presence required. The specific schedule may have some flexibility, but will likely align with the client's operational hours and agile sprint cycles.

📝 Enhancement Note: The on-site requirement means candidates must be able to commute to Stockholm. The work environment will be dictated by the client, but the agile and collaborative nature is a strong indicator.

📄 Application & Portfolio Review Process

Interview Process:
• Initial Screening: A review of your application and portfolio by Rasulson Consulting to assess your qualifications and fit for the role.
• Portfolio Presentation & Interview: A session with the client's hiring team (likely including design leads and product managers) where you will present your portfolio, discuss your UX process, and answer questions about your experience.
• Technical/Practical Assessment: Potentially a design exercise or a deeper dive into specific Figma skills and user research methodologies.
• Final Interview: May involve a broader discussion about team fit, company culture, and how you contribute to an agile environment.

Portfolio Review Tips:
• Curate Selectively: Choose 2-3 of your strongest case studies that best represent your UX process, problem-solving skills, and impact. Tailor your selection to highlight experience with Figma and design systems.
• Tell a Story: For each case study, clearly articulate the problem, your approach, your specific contributions, the tools and methodologies used (especially Figma), and the outcomes or lessons learned. Use visuals effectively.
• Highlight Figma Skills: Be prepared to walk through your Figma files, demonstrate your component usage, prototyping capabilities, and any contributions to design systems.
• Quantify Impact: Where possible, use metrics or qualitative feedback to demonstrate the success of your designs. Focus on user-centric outcomes.
• Demonstrate Process: Clearly show how you move from research to ideation, wireframing, prototyping, and testing. Emphasize your user-centered approach.

Challenge Preparation:
• Understand the Client: If possible, research the client company and their products to understand their user base and industry context.
• Brush up on UX Fundamentals: Review core UX principles, research methodologies, and usability testing best practices.
• Figma Practice: Ensure you are comfortable with all aspects of Figma, including collaboration features, prototyping, and component management.
• Agile Context: Be ready to discuss how you collaborate effectively within an agile team and adapt to iterative development cycles.

📝 Enhancement Note: The portfolio is the most critical component for UX roles. Candidates should be prepared to deeply discuss their work and demonstrate practical skills in Figma. The interview process will likely involve direct interaction with the client's team.

🛠 Tools & Technology Stack

Primary Tools:
• Figma: Essential for wireframing, prototyping, UI design, and collaboration. Expected to be used extensively.
• User Research Tools: Potentially tools like UserTesting.com, Lookback, Maze, or internal tools for conducting and analyzing user research and usability tests.
• Collaboration Platforms: Tools such as Slack, Microsoft Teams, or similar for team communication.
• Project Management Software: Likely Jira, Asana, Trello, or similar, for managing tasks within an agile workflow.

Analytics & Reporting:
• Analytics Platforms: Familiarity with tools like Google Analytics, Amplitude, or Mixpanel, to understand user behavior post-launch and inform design decisions.
• Reporting Tools: Ability to interpret data from analytics platforms and present findings relevant to UX performance.

CRM & Automation:
• While not a primary focus for this UX role, awareness of how CRM systems (like Salesforce) or marketing automation tools might influence user journeys on digital platforms can be beneficial.

📝 Enhancement Note: Figma is explicitly mentioned and is a critical requirement. Familiarity with user research platforms and agile project management tools is also highly relevant.

👥 Team Culture & Values

Operations Values:
• User-Centricity: A deep commitment to understanding and advocating for the user's needs and experience.
• Collaboration: A strong emphasis on teamwork, open communication, and shared ownership of design outcomes.
• Iteration & Improvement: A culture that embraces feedback, learns from mistakes, and continuously seeks to refine designs and processes.
• Data-Driven Decision Making: Utilizing user research and analytics to inform design choices and measure impact.
• Efficiency & Consistency: Adherence to design systems and agile processes to deliver high-quality solutions efficiently.

Collaboration Style:
• Cross-Functional Integration: Working seamlessly with product managers, developers, and QA to ensure designs are feasible, effective, and meet business goals.
• Open Feedback Loops: Actively participating in design reviews, providing and receiving constructive criticism to elevate the quality of work.
• Knowledge Sharing: Willingness to share insights, best practices, and learnings with team members to foster collective growth.

📝 Enhancement Note: The culture will primarily be defined by the client company. However, the emphasis on user-centricity, collaboration, and agile methodologies is typical for modern tech companies and design teams.

⚡ Challenges & Growth Opportunities

Challenges:
• Balancing User Needs with Business Goals: Effectively advocating for the user while ensuring designs align with business objectives and technical constraints.
• Navigating Client-Specific Processes: Adapting to the unique workflows, tools, and stakeholder dynamics of a new client environment.
• Design System Evolution: Contributing to or working within a design system that may still be maturing or undergoing significant changes.
• Remote vs. On-site Dynamics: While the role is on-site, understanding how to best collaborate with potentially distributed teams or stakeholders.

Learning & Development Opportunities:
• Deepen Figma Expertise: Master advanced features, explore plugins, and contribute to design system architecture.
• Expand Research Toolkit: Gain experience with a wider range of user research techniques and tools.
• Exposure to Diverse Products: Work on different types of digital products and tackle varied user challenges across multiple client projects.
• Mentorship: Benefit from guidance from senior designers or product leads at the client company, as well as support from Rasulson Consulting.

📝 Enhancement Note: The primary challenge will be adapting to new client environments and their specific design processes. Growth opportunities are strong due to exposure to varied projects.

💡 Interview Preparation

Strategy Questions:
• "Describe a time you used user research to significantly change a design direction. What was the outcome?" (Focus on your process, the insights, and the measurable impact.)
• "How do you approach translating complex user needs into intuitive wireframes and prototypes using Figma?" (Demonstrate your Figma workflow and problem-solving approach.)
• "Walk us through your process for contributing to or working with a design system. What are the key considerations?" (Highlight your understanding of consistency, reusability, and collaboration.)
• "How do you handle disagreements with product managers or developers regarding design decisions?" (Emphasize your communication, collaboration, and data-driven approach.)

Company & Culture Questions:
• "What interests you about working with Rasulson Consulting and potentially on client projects?" (Showcase your understanding of their model and your career goals.)
• "How do you stay updated on the latest UX/UI design trends and Figma best practices?" (Demonstrate your commitment to continuous learning.)
• "Describe your ideal team environment for collaborative design work." (Align your response with agile and user-centered principles.)

Portfolio Presentation Strategy:
• Structure: For each case study, follow a clear narrative: Problem -> Your Role/Process -> Solution -> Outcome/Impact.
• Visuals: Use high-quality mockups, wireframes, and prototype snippets. Show, don't just tell.
• Figma Demo: Be prepared to share your screen and open your Figma files to showcase your design process, component usage, and prototyping skills.
• Conciseness: Be mindful of time. Focus on the most impactful aspects of your projects.
• Engagement: Ask clarifying questions and engage with the interviewers, showing your collaborative spirit.

📝 Enhancement Note: Candidates should be prepared to deeply discuss their portfolio, demonstrate Figma proficiency live, and articulate their user-centered design process within an agile context.

📌 Application Steps

To apply for this User Interface Designer position:
• Submit your application through the provided link on https://jobb.rasulson.com.
• Portfolio Preparation: Ensure your portfolio is up-to-date, easily accessible (link in resume/application), and clearly showcases your UX design process, Figma expertise, and relevant case studies. Prioritize quality over quantity.
• Resume Optimization: Tailor your resume to highlight your 3+ years of UX design experience, proficiency in Figma, user research, usability testing, and experience in agile environments. Use keywords from the job description.
• Interview Practice: Rehearse presenting your portfolio, articulating your design decisions, and answering common UX interview questions. Practice explaining your process and impact clearly and concisely.
• Client Research (if possible): If the client company is revealed during the process, research their products and services to better understand their user base and potential design challenges.

⚠️ Important Notice: This enhanced job description includes AI-generated insights and operations industry-standard assumptions. All details should be verified directly with Rasulson Consulting or the hiring client before making application decisions. The role is a contract position with an end-client.

title: UI/UX Designer
description:
Overview:

MachineGames is looking for another experienced UI/UX Designer to join our team!

In this role you report to our Lead UI Artist and you will work closely with the Art Director and our game designers to conceptualize, mock-up and apply UI design across many different systems in our games. You will be heavily involved in evaluating and improving usability across the designs chosen for our titles.

MachineGames is located in central Uppsala, Sweden which is a small and vibrant city 40 minutes north of the capital of Sweden, Stockholm. It has a historical heritage reaching back to pre-medieval times.

Our studio has a legacy of being down to earth and free from big egos, our everyday work as well as our long-term goals are driven by our values:
• We value Team performance over individual performance
• We practice an open door policy
• We deliver what we promise
• We give constructive and actionable feedback
• We practice ownership and accountability
• We learn from our mistakes.

This is a permanent position starting as soon as possible. The role is onsite at either our HQ in Uppsala or our satellite office in Sundsvall, Sweden, with a possibility for a hybrid work solution.

We will support your relocation and/or application for a work permit if you have a non-EU passport and/or are not currently residing in Sweden.

Responsibilities:
• Collaborate with game designers to create wireframes and interactive prototypes.
• Create assets and implement UI in an efficient and maintainable way.
• Responsible for improving UX and accessibility.
• Graphic design, logos, and iconography.
• Motion graphics.

Qualifications:
• Experienced at least one full production cycle in a AAA game environment
• Strong artistic knowledge in iconography, graphic design and HUD visuals.
• Examples of current and past work demonstrating a strong understanding of usability and composition.
• Passionate about YX and accessibility.
• Experience with Motion graphics.
• Demonstration of significant UI contribution to a shipped videogame title.
• Self-motivated and able to give and receive feedback.
• Excellent team player with a strong work ethic and a cooperative attitude.
• Fluent in English both written and verbal form.
• CV and Cover Letter in English.
• Portfolio supporting prior experience in a UI/UX role or similar.

Preferred Skills:
• Familiarity with Machinegames, characters, brands, and universes.
• Passion for games and gaming.

Applicant Privacy Notice:

Applicant Privacy Notice

MachineGames is located in central Uppsala, Sweden which is a small and vibrant city 40 minutes north of the capital of Sweden, Stockholm. It has a historical heritage reaching back to pre-medieval times.
