• We give constructive and actionable feedback
• We practice ownership and accountability
• We learn from our mistakes.

This is a permanent position starting as soon as possible. The role is onsite at either our HQ in Uppsala or our satellite office in Sundsvall, Sweden, with a possibility for a hybrid work solution.

We will support your relocation and/or application for a work permit if you have a non-EU passport and/or are not currently residing in Sweden.

Responsibilities
• Collaborate with game designers to create wireframes and interactive prototypes.
• Create assets and implement UI in an efficient and maintainable way.
• Responsible for improving UX and accessibility.
• Graphic design, logos, and iconography.
• Motion graphics.

Qualifications
• Experienced at least one full production cycle in a AAA game environment
• Strong artistic knowledge in iconography, graphic design and HUD visuals.
• Examples of current and past work demonstrating a strong understanding of usability and composition.
• Passionate about YX and accessibility.
• Experience with Motion graphics.
• Demonstration of significant UI contribution to a shipped videogame title.
• Self-motivated and able to give and receive feedback.
• Excellent team player with a strong work ethic and a cooperative attitude.
• Fluent in English both written and verbal form.
• CV and Cover Letter in English.
• Portfolio supporting prior experience in a UI/UX role or similar.

Preferred Skills
• Familiarity with Machinegames, characters, brands, and universes.
• Passion for games and gaming.

We embrace diversity, equity, and inclusion in everything we do – from recruiting for our studios, publishing and operations to fostering safe and respectful workplaces that encourage collaboration. Our culture is based on principles of respect, inclusion, and fair treatment and we welcome anyone into our family without regard to race, religion, gender identity, sexual orientation, or age.

Our diversity fuels our innovation and inspires us to create game worlds that bring us closer to the global community of players we serve.

title: UI Design Manager | Candy Crush Soda Saga
description:
Craft:
UX & UI

Job Description:

As UI Manager for a key product area in Candy Crush Soda Saga, you will lead a team of UI Designers in delivering beautiful, intuitive, and performant user interfaces that bring our player experiences to life. From high-fidelity mockups to in-game implementation, you’ll shape the visual expression of features that drive engagement and monetisation. Your leadership will ensure consistency, clarity, and delight across every screen, while enabling your team to craft high-quality solutions at scale.
Your Role in Our Kingdom
• Line manage and support a team of UI Designers working across systems and features within the area.
• Define and uphold the visual direction for UI in collaboration with the Creative Director and other design leads.
• Guide your team through the full UI process — from translating UX into polished mockups to implementing final assets in-game (with engineering support).
• Ensure visual design solutions meet player needs, business goals, and platform constraints.
• Champion consistency, clarity, and usability in UI across a wide range of player journeys and feature sets.
• Maintain and evolve visual design systems and reusable components in partnership with the broader design team.
• Collaborate closely with UX, Game Design, Product, and Engineering to ensure smooth handoffs and high-quality implementation.
• Coach your team to continually grow their craft, visual problem-solving, and technical skills.
• Drive best practices for UI design and workflow efficiency across tools, pipelines, and production processes.

Skills to Create Thrills
• Strong experience designing and implementing UI for mobile or live-service products, ideally in gaming or interactive entertainment.
• Proven people leadership, with a track record of developing visual designers and supporting their growth.
• Expertise in visual communication, layout, typography, motion, and responsive design principles.
• Confidence in delivering polished mockups and seeing them through to in-game implementation.
• Familiarity with Unity and/or equivalent game engines and workflows for implementing UI.
• Strong eye for detail, consistency, and player-facing quality.
• Excellent collaboration skills across creative and technical functions.

Bonus:
• Experience designing UI for monetisation, economy, or live ops systems.
• Knowledge of shaders, animation systems, or technical UI pipelines.
• Background in visual design, illustration, or motion graphics.

About King

With a mission of Making the World Playful , King is a leading interactive entertainment company with more than 20 years of history of delivering some of the world’s most iconic games in the mobile gaming industry, including the world-famous Candy Crush franchise, as well as other mobile game hits such as Farm Heroes Sag a. King games are played by more than 200 million monthly active users. King, part of Microsoft (NASDAQ: MSFT), has Kingsters in Stockholm, Malmö, London, Barcelona, Berlin, Dublin, San Francisco, New York, Los Angeles and Malta. More information can be found at King.com or by following us on LinkedIn, @lifeatking on Instagram, or @king_games on X.

title: UX/UI Designer (Entry-Level) – No Experience Needed
description:
About Company

Tietoevry creates purposeful technology that reinvents the world for good. We are a leading Nordic digital services and software company, with a local presence and global capabilities. We build on our Nordic heritage of openness, trust, and diversity, and work with our customers to develop digital futures where businesses, societies, and humankind thrive. With a strong presence in Sweden, Tietoevry is at the forefront of driving innovation across various sectors, including financial services, public sector, healthcare, manufacturing, and more. Our mission is to accelerate digital transformation, enabling organizations to become more efficient, innovative, and customer-centric. We are a company of over 24,000 experts globally, committed to creating an inclusive and inspiring workplace where every individual can grow and make a significant impact. Join us to be part of a team that shapes the future of technology and design.

Job Description

Are you passionate about user experience and user interface design? Do you have a keen eye for detail, a burning desire to create intuitive and aesthetically pleasing digital products, and a portfolio (even if academic or personal projects) that showcases your potential? Tietoevry is looking for an enthusiastic and aspiring UX/UI Designer to join our dynamic team in Stockholm. This is a unique entry-level opportunity designed for individuals with no prior professional experience, but with immense potential and a foundational understanding of design principles.

As an Entry-Level UX/UI Designer, you will work closely with seasoned designers, product managers, and developers to bring innovative digital solutions to life. This role is perfect for someone eager to learn, grow, and contribute to meaningful projects that impact thousands of users. You'll be involved in various stages of the design process, from initial research and ideation to prototyping and user testing. We believe in nurturing talent and providing a supportive environment where you can develop your skills, expand your knowledge, and build a strong foundation for a successful career in UX/UI design. If you are a creative problem-solver, a collaborative team player, and have a genuine curiosity about how users interact with technology, we encourage you to apply. We are committed to fostering diversity and inclusion, and we welcome applications from all backgrounds. Come make your mark with us and help us design the future!

Key Responsibilities
• Assist in conducting user research, including interviews, surveys, and usability testing, to understand user needs and behaviors.
• Contribute to the creation of user flows, wireframes, and prototypes to visualize design concepts.
• Participate in design sprints and workshops, collaborating with cross-functional teams.
• Help translate user research findings and business requirements into intuitive and engaging user interfaces.
• Support the refinement of visual design elements, ensuring brand consistency and aesthetic appeal.
• Learn and apply design system guidelines and best practices to ensure consistency across products.
• Present design ideas and gather feedback from team members and stakeholders.
• Stay updated on the latest UX/UI trends, tools, and technologies.
• Actively seek feedback and iterate on designs based on user testing and team input.

Required Skills
• Foundational understanding of UX/UI design principles and methodologies.
• Proficiency with design tools such as Figma, Sketch, Adobe XD, or similar.
• A portfolio demonstrating your design projects (academic, personal, or freelance are welcome).
• Strong communication and interpersonal skills, with the ability to articulate design choices.
• Eagerness to learn and adapt in a fast-paced environment.
• Fluent in English, both written and spoken.

Preferred Qualifications
• Bachelor's degree or equivalent in Interaction Design, Graphic Design, Human-Computer Interaction, or a related field (or equivalent practical experience/bootcamp completion).
• Basic understanding of front-end development (HTML, CSS, JavaScript) is a plus.
• Experience with user research techniques and methodologies.
• Familiarity with agile development processes.

Perks & Benefits
• Competitive entry-level salary and benefits package.
• Comprehensive mentorship program with experienced design professionals.
• Opportunities for professional development and continuous learning.
• A vibrant, inclusive, and collaborative work environment.
• Modern office facilities in central Stockholm.
• Access to a wide range of cutting-edge projects and technologies.
• Health and wellness programs.
• Flexible working arrangements (within an on-site model for this role).
• Social events and team-building activities.

How to Apply

Interested candidates are encouraged to submit their application by clicking the link below. Please include your resume/CV and a link to your online portfolio showcasing your design projects. We look forward to reviewing your application and discovering how your passion for design can contribute to our team at Tietoevry.

title: UX/UI Designer
description:
UX/UI Designer

Employment Type: Full Time
Location: Remote in Singapore

Role Overview

The UI/UX Designer will join our team for a long-term contract to work on an exciting branding & website design accelerator project. This person will contribute to strategy and user experience design of Pixalate’s website, revamping existing sales collateral according to brand standards and assisting with the design of external facing research reports to drive Pixalate’s marketing and sales goals.

Responsibilities
• Visualize and prototype website designs/intended solutions at multiple levels of fidelity, including high-level wireframes, conceptual designs, design presentations and detailed specifications.
• Design and templatize graphic content for sales & promotional collateral including pitch presentations and 1-pagers.
• Support Pixalate’s Ad Fraud & Compliance Research group with innovative designs of research report content; including enhanced data visualization and storytelling through graphic design, bring data to life in new formats applicable to social media, blogs, emails, etc.
• Work both independently and collaboratively with fellow UX team members, graphic designers, product managers, and software engineers who are geographically distributed across the globe.
• Ensure consistency in brand visuals and messaging across all materials.
• Manage multiple projects simultaneously while meeting deadlines.
• Receive and incorporate feedback to improve designs and videos.
• Maintain organized files and assets for easy access and future use.

Qualifications
• 5+ years or proven experience as a UI/UX designer with a strong portfolio showcasing your work.
• Experience with design tools such as FIGMA, Adobe Creative Suite (Photoshop, Illustrator and InDesign) and prototyping in HTML, JavaScript, CSS, Ajax
• Expert in design using Google Slides and Powerpoint. Experience with AI enhanced presentation software tools such as Prezi, Canva, Beautiful.ai, a plus
• Comfortable working within an iterative, dynamic feedback process; flexibility to adapt to changing priorities and project demands.
• Able to take ambiguous design problems and work with stakeholders and user research insights to craft design solutions grounded in customer needs and business goals
• Strong understanding of visual composition, color theory, typography, and branding.
• Ability to create both static and dynamic content that captures the audience's attention.
• Excellent communication and collaboration skills.
• Attention to detail and a commitment to producing high-quality work.
• Ability to work independently and manage time effectively in a remote or hybrid work environment.
• Experience with motion graphics and animation is a plus.
• Experience in mobile or web-based gaming, or in gamified platforms is a plus

Benefits
We focus on doing things differently and challenge each other to be the best we can be.
• Monthly internet reimbursement
• Casual, remote work environment
• Hybrid, flexible hours
• Opportunity for advancement
• Fun annual team events
• Being part of a high-performing team that wants to win and have fun doing it
• Extremely competitive compensation

We're particularly interested in candidates who can demonstrate both theoretical depth and practical implementation skills. Show us how your research can transform the landscape of online trust and safety.

Pixalate is an online trust and safety platform that protects businesses, consumers and children from deceptive, fraudulent and non-compliant mobile, CTV apps and websites. We're seeking a PhD-level AI Engineer to lead cutting-edge research in agentic AI systems, multimodal analysis, and advanced reasoning architectures that will directly impact millions of users worldwide.
Our software and data have been used to unearth multiple high profile criminal and illegal surveillance cases including:
• Gizmodo: An iCloud Feature Is Enabling a $65 Million Scam, New Research Says
• Adweek: A 7-Figure Ad Fraud Scheme Running on Roku Underlines Murkiness of CTV
• Washington Post: Your kids’ apps are spying on them
• Pro Publica: Porn, Piracy, Fraud: What Lurks Inside Google’s Black Box Ad Empire
• ABC7 News: The State of Children's Privacy Online
• NBC News: How many apps are tracking your children

Our team of lawyers, data scientists, engineers, economists and researchers span globally with presence in California, New York, Washington DC, London and Singapore.
Pixalate is an equal opportunity employer committed to building a diverse team. We particularly encourage applications from underrepresented groups in AI research.

title: Interactive Designer (UX/Motion)
description:
Job Overview:

At Forge - Helios Worldwide, we don’t just build digital products — we craft experiences.

We’re looking for a Senior Creative Designer to elevate our creative output across brand identity, digital campaigns, editorial design, and social media content.

This role is perfect for a multidisciplinary designer who combines strategic thinking, storytelling, and strong visual craft. You'll collaborate with UI/UX designers, developers, and strategists to shape the way brands show up — from concept to execution, across digital, print, and motion.

title: UX / UI Specialist
description:
User Experience / User Interface Specialist (UX / UI) – South East Asia

(1 Year Contract, subject to renewal)

Company Description

Our client is an US healthcare company with a broadly diversified business across consumer, pharmaceutical and medical device segments. They have an annual turnover of US$70 billion, with more than 125,000 employees across 60 countries with a heritage of more than 130 years.

Job Responsibilities:

The User Experience & User Interface (UX / UI) Specialist for South East Asia is primarily responsible to conceptualize, design and execute creatives in the form of graphics, stills and animation for eCommerce demand generation campaigns; and to define the design guidelines of the eCommerce ‘shop-in-shop’ across multiple platforms to drive consistency and a better customer online shopping experience.

You will also be developing and implementing creative campaign toolkits across South East Asia through adaptation and creation of creative assets. Additionally, you will lead regular audits on portfolio content maintenance – both internal and external – to ensure continuous improvement of user buying experience and conversion rates.

Reporting to the Manager, you will be handling the following –
• To develop eCommerce campaigns creatives & toolkits -
• Create eCommerce shopper enablement content and campaign toolkits for adaptation across markets (e.g. Southeast Asia) with full leverage of major eCommerce events (e.g. 11-11, 12-12, Black Friday), with strong focus on scalability, execution, budget and timeline management for pre, always-on and post launch activities.
• Support the acceleration of the eCommerce business through the continuous improvement, optimization and adaptation of our creative assets to improve conversion and drive new customer acquisition.
• Support the regional e-marketing calendar to sharpen enterprise-wide digital shelf and work with eCommerce team and cross-functional stakeholders to understand, develop content briefs and compelling visual content assets to improve the path to purchase.
• Manage eStore’s activation of creative assets implementation to drive consistency and adherence to brand guidelines.
• Work with the eCommerce teams to produce eCommerce regional campaign artworks and its reiterations to fit various sizing requirements across platforms and fit-for-countries.
• Monitor eCommerce and online competitor trends with regards to best practices and compelling creative initiatives for iterative improvements.
• Product Information Architect:
• To lead ongoing maintenance of the product content depository platforms.
• Manage the eCommerce product portfolio content maintenance on internal platforms with accurate and up-to-date product catalog data, which includes product specifications, imagery, labelling information, and rich marketing content for internal and external use.
• Evaluate the effectiveness of eCommerce product thumbnail and contents through regular audit, which promotes continuous improvement as per the company-initiated framework.

Qualifications, Experience and Competencies:
• Degree or Diploma holder with 1-2 years of experience as UI / UX designer or graphic designer
• eCommerce or design agency experience is an advantage
• Proficient in Adobe Creative Suite (Photoshop, Illustrator, After Effects, InDesign) or any other relevant software and technologies
• A self-starter that possesses critical visual and creative flair with a strong sense of self-initiative, typography and attention to detail
• Strong project management and analytical skills with demonstrated ability to prioritize work independently, manage multiple tasks from ideation to final production
• Demonstrate the flexibility and speed to prioritize and manage creative assets’ creation and adaptation amidst urgent timelines
• Ability to input design philosophies and technical design features and technical architecture as it relates to website development, User Experience and User

On top of a competitive base salary, the company offers excellent career and training opportunities, attractive benefits and bonus schemes. If you are keen to take your career on to the next level, click apply.

title: UX / UI Designer (Mid-Level)
description:
Overview

We’re looking for a sharp UX / UI Designer who’s comfortable navigating both user-driven design and visual interface work. You’ll play a fundamental role in designing and executing digital product experiences that help us drive leads, improve user flows, and deliver on campaign goals — from microsites and landing pages to event activations and interactive assets. You’ll collaborate closely with the Creative Tech Lead, Marketing, and Product to bring holistic digital experiences to life.

Key Responsibilities
• Conduct user research, gather requirements, and analyse user behaviour to inform design decisions.
• Develop user personas, journey maps, and user flow diagrams.
• Design wireframes, mockups, and interactive prototypes for web and mobile screens.
• Create visual / interactive UI designs for websites, microsites, apps, landing pages, and other digital products.
• Support campaign rollouts, ensuring UX best practices are used to drive conversions, leads, or KPIs.
• Assist with event activations — designing UI / interaction elements that tie into live or experiential components.
• Conduct usability testing; collect feedback and insights from users, analytics, and stakeholders; iterate accordingly.
• Work closely with developers, product managers, marketing, and creative leads to align designs with technical constraints and business goals.
• Maintain design consistency with brand guidelines and style guides.
• Present design concepts, rationale, and flows to stakeholders and incorporate feedback.

What You’ll Bring
• 2–3 years of experience in UX/UI design or a similar role (in-house, agency, or product).
• A portfolio demonstrating hands-on work in user-centred design, prototypes, UI screens, and interaction.
• Proficiency with industry-standard tools: Figma, Sketch, Adobe Creative Suite (Photoshop, Illustrator, etc.), InVision (or equivalent).
• Understanding of UX design principles, interaction design, user psychology, and accessibility best practices.
• Some familiarity with front-end basics (HTML, CSS) is a plus — even if you don’t code regularly.
• Strong communication, presentation, and interpersonal skills.
• Ability to work independently and collaboratively; proactive and resourceful.
• Excellent time-management and organisational skills, capable of handling multiple projects and meeting deadlines.
• A proactive, self-driven mindset — you take initiative, embrace challenges, and work well in a dynamic environment.
• Formal design education or equivalent hands-on experience in a creative discipline (graphic design, digital media, visual communication, etc.) is a plus.

title: Ui/ux Designer - Start Now
description:
We are searching for a brilliant Ui/ux Designer to join our high calibre team at Cashgate Information Technology L.L.C in Dubai.

Growing your career as a Full Time Ui/ux Designer is a fantastic opportunity to develop excellent skills.
If you are strong in project management, decision-making and have the right personality for the job, then apply for the position of Ui/ux Designer at Cashgate Information Technology L.L.C today!

Hiring UI/UX Designer

Location: Dubai, UAE
Note: We are looking for a candidate currently inside UAE.

Job Description:

Role: We are looking for a dynamic UI/UX designer who will be responsible for our various digital assets. You will ensure that all elements of the online user experience are optimized for improved usability, usefulness, and exceptional visual design. The successful candidate will evidence a passion for delivering adaptive and creative solutions to UI/UX design problems by staying up to date with best practices.

Key Responsibilities:
• Investigating user experience design requirements for our suite of digital assets.
• Developing and conceptualizing a comprehensive UI/UX design strategy for the brand.
• Producing high-quality UX design solutions through wireframes, visual and graphic designs, flow diagrams, storyboards, site maps, and high-fidelity prototypes.
• Designing systems and tools such as navigation menus, search boxes, tabs, and widgets for our digital assets.
• Testing UI elements such as CTAs, banners, page layouts, page designs, page flows, and target links for landing pages.
• Support marketing efforts such as social media and branding when needed.
• Providing advice and guidance on the implementation of UX research methodologies and testing activities in order to analyze and predict user behavior.
• Adhering to client’s brand guidelines.

Requirements:
• A bachelor’s degree and a minimum of 4 years UI/UX design experience for digital products or services. Mainly apps!
• A portfolio of professional UI/UX design work for both web and mobile platforms.
• A design ninja in: iOS, Android, Design Systems, and Adobe Creative Suite.
• A Figma expert!
• A team player but can work independently too.
• Excellent written and verbal communication skills. You will be asked to present your work and sell it to the Creative Manager and the board.
• Multi-tasking and time-management skills, with the ability to prioritize tasks.
• Quick turnaround with iterations and changes.
• Positive, responsive and eager to learn with a “can do” attitude.
• Working with CashGate will give you the chance to build awesome and creative products and be part of a young multi-disciplinary team of creatives. You can make your mark!
• Positive attitude and ability to work in a fast-paced, collaborative start-up environment.

title: UI & Graphic Design Specialist
description:
About the Role

We are seeking a talented and versatile UI & Graphic Design Specialist to join our marketing team.

This role is crucial for maintaining and elevating our brand's visual identity. You will be responsible for creating compelling graphic design work for a variety of materials, including proposals, templates, brochures, and company-wide rebranding initiatives. Additionally, you will collaborate with our development team to produce user-friendly and aesthetically pleasing wireframes, mock-ups, and final designs for our apps and website.

Company:

Alpin Limited is a leading sustainability consultant in the Middle East, with its global headquarters in Masdar City, Abu Dhabi the world's first sustainable city. We're on a mission to transform the built environment by providing innovative commissioning, sustainability, and climate change solutions. As a company, we are committed to thought leadership and making a tangible difference in the world. We pride ourselves on having a diverse, multicultural team of experts who are passionate about creating a more sustainable future. At Alpin, you'll be part of a dynamic, "young-at-heart" culture that values collaboration, innovation, and continuous learning.

To know more about Alpin Limited and its services and projects please visit www.alpinme.com

Reports Directly to:

Senior Marketing Executive

Key Responsibilities:

Design & Production: Develop and design a range of marketing materials, including but not limited to proposals, brochures, reports, and company templates, ensuring brand consistency and high-quality visuals.

Brand Management: Lead or contribute to company rebranding efforts, ensuring all new designs align with our brand strategy and vision.

Digital Interface Design: Work closely with the development team to create wireframes, prototypes, and user-friendly mockups for web and mobile applications.

Asset Creation: Create and maintain a library of visual assets, including icons, illustrations, and other graphic elements for digital and print use.

Collaboration: Participate in brainstorming sessions and provide creative input to support marketing campaigns and digital projects.

Required Skills & Qualifications

Bachelor s degree in graphic design, Visual Arts, or a related field.

Proven experience as a graphic designer and UI designer with a strong portfolio showcasing a range of work.

Expert proficiency in industry-standard design tools, including Adobe Creative Suite (Photoshop, Illustrator, InDesign), Canva, and Figma.

Solid understanding of design principles, typography, colour theory, and layout for both print and digital media.

Experience with user-centered design principles and a clear understanding of the UI/UX design process.

Preferred Skills & Qualifications

Experience with video editing software such as Adobe Premiere Pro, Final Cut Pro (FCP), or CapCut.

Familiarity with web development languages like Java or C-Sharp, and a basic understanding of HTML/CSS.

Knowledge of motion graphics and animation.

title: Graphic Designer - UI | UX
description:
To conceptualize, design, and execute visually appealing and innovative creative materials that align with the company’s branding, marketing, and communication goals. The graphic designer will ensure that all visual content is engaging, consistent, and optimized for various platforms, including digital, print, and social media, while adhering to project timelines and brand guidelines

Responsibility:
• Design Creation : Develop creative visuals, layouts, and designs for print and digital media, including advertisements, social media, brochures, and websites.
• Brand Adherence : Ensure all designs align with the company’s branding guidelines and maintain consistency across all platforms.
• Collaboration : Work closely with marketing, content, and product teams to understand project requirements and deliver effective visual solutions.
• Concept Development : Brainstorm and conceptualize new design ideas to enhance the company’s visual presence.
• Project Management : Manage multiple projects simultaneously, prioritize tasks, and meet deadlines.
• Revisions : Incorporate feedback from stakeholders and revise achieve the desired outcome.
• Asset Preparation : Prepare final design files for print production or digital use, ensuring quality and accuracy.
• Trend Awareness : Stay updated on design trends, tools, and techniques to bring fresh ideas to projects.

Qualification:

Knowledge, Skills, and Expertise:
• Expertise in Adobe Creative Suite - Photoshop, Illustrator, InDesign, XD, after effects, premier and other design tools
• Familiarity with branding and marketing strategies.

Educational Qualifications and Experience:
• Bachelor’s degree in graphic design, Visual Communication, or a related field.
• 2–4 years of professional experience in graphic design, preferably within an agency, marketing team, or similar environment

title: TouchDesigner UI/UX Designer (Visual-Focused)
description:
Location: Remote or Onsite
Experince: 2 - 4 years
Department: ODS LABS
Employment Type: Full - Time / Contractual

We are looking for a TouchDesigner UI/UX Designer (Visual-Focused) to join our dynamic creative team. This role emphasizes designing compelling, user-centered interfaces for interactive installations and immersive experiences. If you have a flair for visual storytelling, animation, and a passion for crafting intuitive user journeys using real-time platforms like TouchDesigner — we’d love to meet you.

Role Description:
• UI/UX Design & Development: Design and implement interactive user interfaces using TouchDesigner for immersive installations.
• Visual Storytelling: Produce engaging 2D/3D motion graphics, animations, and visuals that enhance user experience and align with the creative narrative.
• Cross-Functional Collaboration: Partner with creative directors, 3D artists, and developers to bring concepts to life through seamless design integration.
• Prototyping & Testing: Rapidly prototype UI concepts, gather feedback, and iterate to improve functionality and aesthetics.
• Brand & Design Consistency: Ensure all visual outputs align with brand identity and maintain consistency across multiple formats and experiences.
• Career Growth: Access mentorship and professional development programs designed to help you achieve your goals.
• Inclusive Environment: Join a supportive team that values your contributions and celebrates your success.

Skills and Qualification:
• Experience: 2–4 years of professional experience in UI/UX and motion design, with hands-on work in TouchDesigner.
• Software Skills: Primary: TouchDesigner (UI/UX & motion content creation)
• Secondary: Adobe Creative Suite (Photoshop, Illustrator, After Effects), Blender or 3ds Max, Notch
• UI Tools: Figma or similar
• Portfolio: A solid portfolio demonstrating TouchDesigner-based UI/UX projects, motion graphics, and immersive design work.
• Design Expertise: Strong grasp of typography, color theory, layout design, and animation principles.
• Team Collaboration: Excellent communication and teamwork skills, with the ability to interpret creative briefs and work within deadlines.
• Immersive Tech Exposure: Familiarity with volumetric displays, AR/VR environments, and experiential event technology.
• Creative Background: Formal experience in animation, 3D art, or motion graphics is a plus.

Why Join Us?
• A collaborative and forward-thinking creative culture.
• Opportunities to work on high-profile, tech-driven global projects.
• Professional development in immersive design and interactive technologies.

title: Content & Copywriting (Intern/Trainee) (Kochi, Copywriter, Blog Writer, Creative Writer, Fresher)
description:
Got a Way with Words? Let's Turn That Talent into Impact.

MaSs

We're MaSs – a future-forward digital marketing agency from the UK, with our delivery squad making waves in Kochi. We turn data into stories and ideas into action, crafting copy that doesn't just sit pretty – it drives results.

AI might be rewriting the rules, but we still believe in the power of a human touch. If you can write words that make people stop, think, and act – this is your invitation to do it with us.

What's the Gig?

We're looking for a sharp, word-loving Content & Copywriting Intern/Trainee who wants to dive headfirst into the world of digital storytelling. If you obsess over the perfect headline, love crafting compelling narratives, and are curious about how AI can amplify creativity – you belong here.

You'll work with our team of marketers to create copy that clicks, converts, and keeps audiences hooked. Plus, you'll learn to leverage AI tools to boost your workflow and sharpen your writing game.

What You'll Do (a.k.a. Your Superpowers)
• Write attention-grabbing copy for social media, websites, blogs, emails, and ads.
• Adapt your writing style to match different brands, audiences, and vibes.
• Collaborate with marketers to turn concepts into persuasive, personality-packed content.
• Learn how to use AI to brainstorm, edit, and optimize your copy.
• Stay on top of industry trends and audience psychology to make your writing smarter.
• Edit and fine-tune your work until it's pitch-perfect.

What We're Looking For (Is This You?)

Wordsmith-in-the-Making:
• You have a strong command of English (bonus points if you make grammar look effortless).
• You can make even the dullest topic sound fascinating.
• You love playing with language and know how to write with personality.

Curious & Adaptable:
• You're open to trying new writing styles and tones (from cheeky to corporate).
• You stay curious about how people think, act, and buy.
• You embrace AI tools to work smarter, not harder.

Hungry to Learn:
• You take feedback like a pro and use it to level up.
• You're excited to grow in a fast-paced, ever-evolving creative environment.

What's in It for You?
• Hands-on experience writing for real clients and real audiences.
• One-on-one mentorship from marketing pros who want you to shine.
• Exposure to cutting-edge AI writing tools and techniques.
• A fun, collaborative workspace where creativity rules.
• A shot at a full-time gig if you blow us away.

Ready to shape stories and spark action?
Apply today

description:
Got a Way with Words? Let's Turn That Talent into Impact, Smartly.

We're MaSs.

A no-fluff, straight-shooting digital marketing agency from the UK – with our delivery squad making moves in Kochi. We're all about
vibe marketing

What You'll Do & Learn (Your Vibe Training)

· Collaborate with the team to turn ideas into campaigns.

Who This Is For

We're not looking for people just chasing a paycheck. We're looking for learners who want to
level up their craft
. If you:

· Love language and can make grammar look easy.

· Stay curious and adaptable.

What You'll Get

Paid learning

·

·
Mentorship

AI-powered training

title: Digital Content Writer (Copy Resource)
description:
• Proven experience in content writing, copywriting, or marketing communications. - Strong command of English with excellent writing, editing, and proofreading skills. - Familiarity with RFX documentation and B2B marketing content. - Experience using Generative AI tools for content creation is a plus. - Ability to work collaboratively in cross-functional teams. - Strong storytelling skills with an eye for detail and tone.

Tailor messaging to resonate with diverse client personas and industry verticals. Creative Collaboration: Participate in brainstorming sessions to shape messaging strategy, tone of voice, and creative direction. title: Digital Content Writer
description:
About the Company

On a mission to give people limitless access to the vast world of Entertainment, Cineverse’s advanced, proprietary technology drives the distribution of over 70,000 premium films, series, and podcasts.

From providing a complete streaming solution to some of the world’s most recognizable brands, to super-serving our network of fan channels – from direct ad sales partnerships to premium global content – we offer more of the stories that move us, and technology that moves us forward. Industry leaders with a history of innovation, Cineverse is powering the future of Entertainment.

Job Title: Digital Content Writer

Overview:

The Digital Content Writer is responsible for crafting persuasive, brand-consistent, and performance-optimized messaging across Cineverse’s channels while building foundational documents that ensure long-term efficiency and brand cohesion.

Key Responsibilities:
• Write and edit copy for CRM campaigns, owned media placements, and app store listings.
• Develop campaign messaging frameworks to unify storytelling across Theatrical, FAST, SVOD, and Catalogue campaigns.
• Build and maintain content calendars across newsletters, editorial, and partner promotions.
• Draft editorial stories, blog posts, and press releases to strengthen Cineverse brand positioning.
• Collaborate with Merchandising to support SEO/ASO optimization for discoverability.
• Lead the creation of brand style guides covering tone, messaging, and voice.
• Develop AI prompt libraries and guides to accelerate and standardize copy creation.
• Support retention strategies with cancel-offer and churn messaging flows.
• Partner with Marketing Ops and Insights on A/B testing and reporting.
• Ensure all messaging aligns with Cineverse’s brand and campaign priorities.
• Ready to work US hours: 10:30 am – 7:00 pm ET / 7:30 am – 4 pm PT

Required Skills & Qualifications
• 2-3 years of professional experience in content marketing, copywriting, content writing or digital storytelling.
• Experience in streaming, media, gaming, News editorial or consumer entertainment.
• US market & culture experience is a must
• Strong background in short-form and long-form content (emails, push, editorial, press).
• Strong collaboration skills with the ability to translate insights into messaging.
• Excellent English grammar, attention to detail, and adaptability to multiple brand voices.

Preferred Qualifications
• Familiarity with AI copy tools, workflows, and prompt engineering.
• Knowledge of editorial or PR content development.
• Familiarity with SEO, ASO, and funnel-based messaging.( preferred)

Education
• Bachelor’s degree in Marketing, Communications, or related field required.
• Preferred: Coursework or certifications in Digital Marketing, Copywriting, or App Store Optimization (ASO).
• Additional Value: Familiarity with CRM platforms, UX writing, or lifecycle marketing copywriting is a plus.

title: Copywriter
description:

Position Overview:

We are seeking a talented and creative Copywriter to join our marketing team and play a key role in developing compelling and engaging content for our brand and platform. The Copywriter will be responsible for crafting clear, concise, and impactful copy for various marketing materials, including website content, blog posts, email campaigns, social media posts, press releases, and more.
Key Responsibilities:
• Collaborate with marketing and creative teams to develop content strategies and concepts that effectively communicate brand messaging, value propositions, and key selling points.
• Write and edit engaging and persuasive copy for a wide range of marketing materials and channels, ensuring consistency in tone, style, and brand voice across all communications.
• Research and gather information on industry trends, market insights, and target audience preferences to inform content development and ensure relevance and resonance with target audiences.
• Develop and maintain content calendars, schedules, and editorial plans to ensure timely delivery of content and alignment with marketing campaigns and initiatives.
• Optimize content for search engine visibility and performance, incorporating relevant keywords, metadata, and SEO best practices to improve organic search rankings and drive traffic and engagement.
• Proofread and edit content to ensure accuracy, clarity, grammar, and adherence to brand guidelines and editorial standards, and provide constructive feedback to other team members as needed.
• Stay up-to-date on emerging trends, technologies, and best practices in content marketing, copywriting, and digital media, and identify opportunities for innovation and improvement in content strategy and execution.
• Collaborate with cross-functional teams, including designers, developers, and marketers, to brainstorm ideas, execute campaigns, and deliver integrated and cohesive brand experiences.

Requirements:
• Bachelor's degree in English, Communications, Journalism, Marketing, or related field.
• Minimum 3-5 years of experience in copywriting, content creation, or content marketing, preferably in a digital marketing agency, tech startup, or PR-related industry.
• Exceptional writing, editing, and proofreading skills, with a keen eye for detail and the ability to craft clear, concise, and compelling copy that resonates with target audiences and drives desired actions.
• Strong storytelling ability and creative thinking skills, with a knack for developing engaging narratives and captivating content that captures attention and generates interest.
• Proficiency in writing for various channels and platforms, including web, email, social media, blogs, and press releases, and an understanding of how to tailor messaging and tone for different audiences and mediums.
• Familiarity with SEO principles and best practices, and the ability to optimize content for search engines and improve organic search performance.
• Excellent research skills and the ability to gather and synthesize information from multiple sources to develop informed and insightful content.
• Strong organizational and time management skills, with the ability to prioritize tasks effectively, meet deadlines, and work efficiently in a fast-paced and dynamic environment.
• Proficiency in content management systems (CMS), project management tools, and collaboration platforms.

Benefits:
• Competitive salary
• Flexible work schedule
• Professional development opportunities
• Collaborative and supportive work environment

About Fublis:

Fublis is a leading PR platform revolutionizing the way brands, startups, and creators connect with journalists and get their stories published. Our innovative technology streamlines the PR process, making it easier for businesses to reach their target audience and achieve media coverage.

Fublis is an equal opportunity employer and welcomes applications from all qualified individuals. We thank all applicants for their interest in joining our team, but only those selected for an interview will be contacted.[/vc_column_text][/vc_column][/vc_row]

title: Content & Copywriting Officer
description:
Location: Little London

Who We Are

Muslim Aid is a UK faith-based international development organisation that provides support to communities around the world affected by disasters, conflict, or endemic poverty without regard to their social, religious, or ethnic background. Established in 1985, Muslim Aid has facilitated the engagement of the British Muslim and non-Muslim community in support of its work in a variety of ways. Over the years, its humanitarian work has included responses to major crises around the world including, famine in East Africa, earthquakes and flooding in Pakistan and Bangladesh as well as conflicts in Syria and Yemen.

We place strong emphasis on long-term development projects that build the capacity of local people to help themselves. In addition to the 5 country offices worldwide we also work with multiple partner offices focusing on sustainable Development Programmes and providing humanitarian relief during times of crisis.
Summary Of

The Role

The Content & Copywriting Officer will involve developing engaging content for our social media channels, website blogs, and news section, as well as collaborating with the Search Engine Optimisation Officer to optimise copy for improved visibility and reach. You will play an important part in telling Muslim Aids story, inspiring our supporters, and helping to drive donations through impactful and well-crafted messaging.
About

The Role
• Develop compelling, engaging, and audience-focused content for social media platforms, blogs, news updates, and campaigns.
• Collaborate with the SEO Officer on the production of keyword-optimised copy for landing pages, appeals and campaign content.
• Develop storytelling pieces that highlight Muslim Aids projects, beneficiaries, and impact.
• Review written content for accuracy, consistency and alignment with Muslim Aids tone of voice and brand guidelines.
• Collaborate with the programmes, fundraising and communications teams to deliver content that supports appeals and organisational goals.
About You

You must currently hold the right to work in the UK. Muslim Aid is not offering sponsorship for this role
To Be Successful In This Role, You Will Need
• Proven experience in content writing, copywriting, or digital communications.
• Excellent writing, editing, and proofreading skills with attention to detail.
• Experience writing for social media, websites, and blogs.
• Excellent communication and interpersonal skills with the ability to liaise with a variety of stakeholders and employees at all levels.
• Strong research skills and ability to generate creative, compelling content ideas.
Why You Should Apply

Join Muslim Aid as a Content & Copywriting Officer and use your creativity to tell stories that inspire change. Youll craft impactful, optimised content that connects supporters to our mission and drives donations. If youre passionate about storytelling and making a difference, apply now to help shape Muslim Aids voice and impact.
Benefits You Will Enjoy Working For Us
• 25 days annual leave + 4 Privilege days
• Hybrid working
• Paid time off for medical appointments
• 2 hours lunch break on Fridays
• Time off in Lieu (TOIL)
• Pension Scheme
How To Apply

To apply please submit your cover letter (no more than 1 page) and CV and a portfolio of your work.

Applications will be accepted until the closing date. However, please note that Muslim Aid may conduct interviews and progress with the selection process on a rolling basis, with the aim of appointing a suitable candidate as soon as possible.

title: Senior Account Manager - Content/Copywriting Agency
description:
As Senior Account Manager, you’ll be responsible for managing a diverse portfolio of clients and driving their growth. You will also play a supporting role in selling Stratton Craig to new clients. The ultimate aim of the role is to ensure we retain clients and increase their spend to contribute to an overall increase in company revenue.

Job Accountabilities

Client servicing:
Leading the day-to-day management of your client portfolio, ensuring we deliver quality content on time and on budget.
This will include running briefing meetings; producing quotes, proposals and project plans; briefing writers; reviewing content; and managing amends
Identifying and managing account and project problems independently and providing effective solutions

Commercials:
Managing client budget spend and maintaining clear and consistent reporting of time, output, billing and budget forecasts in order to accurately plan and efficiently manage resources •
Supporting our Finance team with efficient and accurate month-end reporting for your projects •
Identifying project commercial risks and working with our SMT to mitigate them

Client development:
Understanding our clients’ businesses, the industries they operate in, and trends in best practice corporate communications
Proactively sharing ideas with clients, cross-selling and upselling our services in order to increase average project spend and overall client revenue and build deep, long-term strategic partnerships with our clients •
Working closely with our Client Services Director to successfully identify new business opportunities from your existing clients, writing client proposals and effectively presenting Stratton Craig’s offer to clients

Growth:
Supporting our Growth manager in selling Stratton Craig’s services to new clients by sharing examples of work, providing detail on our ways of working and matching the perfect writer to their requirement •
Contributing to Sales and Marketing ideation sessions by sharing insights and learnings from your client conversations, and participating in events/contributing to content we publish

Performance measurements
Client satisfaction
Growth in client spend
Healthy project commercials
Win record when involved in pitches/proposals for existing and new clients

Essential Skills and Experience

A minimum of 3 years’ experience in an agency role, ideally involving corporate marketing and comms
Proven content review / quality checking experience
Capable user of Microsoft Office Exceptional written communication skills, including flawless spelling and grammar Project management Relationship/stakeholder management

Desirable Skills and Experience Strong academic background – particularly in English and other written subjects
Content editing / writing experience
Experience liaising with senior stakeholders including C-Suite
Pitching / Sales experience
Foreign language speaker

Competencies/behaviours Passionate about the importance and value of language to businesses Energetic and proactive, with a focus on delivering the best business outcomes for our clients Detail oriented and well-organised Professional and well mannered at all times Confident and enthusiastic with a love of client meetings and conversation A strong sense of team membership and accountability Strategic thinking Self-motivation We work with global clients who can require calls and meetings out of hours – flexibility is required as well as some travel and overnight stays (typically within the UK).

Reporting to

Client Services Director

About Stratton Craig
Much more than a copywriting and content agency – we apply the critical skill of storytelling to all manner of communication and stakeholder engagement challenges.

Guided by data and insight, we develop brand language, content strategy and copy that inspires trust, belief and loyalty at every interaction.

Words are one of the most powerful tools we have. By using them wisely, we help clients build:
• Better relationships with their stakeholders
• A loyal client base
• Talented teams
• A reputation that gets noticed

We’ve supported hundreds of global clients to make their strategic communications, content and reporting more effective.
As a member of the Positive Change Group, we are trusted partners to some of the world’s leading businesses.

The Positive Change Group
Stratton Craig is part of the Positive Change Group, a collective of like-minded specialist agencies with a shared ambition to help bold and visionary businesses spark positive change.
By helping them define and communicate their purpose, strategy, culture and performance – the Positive Change Group is helping businesses inspire trust, build strong stakeholder relationships and create long-term value for the people who matter most.

The Group was founded in 2022, and has become the new holding company which currently consists of three specialist agencies:
• Stratton Craig – Content Strategy
• Black Sun Global – Stakeholder Engagement
• People Made – Brand and Culture

Together, bringing deep expertise on different aspects of stakeholder advisory and engagement, including brand, culture, strategic communications, reporting, ESG advisory, analytics and creative storytelling.

With established headquarters in London, Singapore, and a strong footprint in the US; the Group works closely together with over 100 multinational brands including the likes of AstraZeneca, Burberry, Allianz GI, Diageo, Meta, Olam, Carlsberg and RSM.

Come Join Us!
Joining Stratton Craig and The Positive Change Group means becoming part of an inclusive, dynamic community where your talents are nurtured, and your career can thrive. With competitive salaries, hybrid working, and continuous professional development, you’ll not only grow but also have the opportunity to make a difference every day, shaping the future of communications – and having fun along the way.
We pride ourselves on being committed to offering equal opportunities to all potential employees and have zero tolerance for discrimination. We foster a business culture where ideas and decisions from all people help us grow, innovate, create the best work and be relevant in a rapidly changing world. We welcome applicants from all backgrounds to apply and would encourage you to let us know if there are steps we can take to ensure that your recruitment process enables you to present yourself in a way that makes you comfortable.

For more information, please visit:
www.strattoncraig.com
www.positivechangegroup.com

Please view our privacy notices here :
www.strattoncraig.com/privacy/
www.positivechangegroup.com/privacy-notice

title: Content & Copywriting Officer
description:
Who We Are

Muslim Aid is a UK faith-based international development organisation that provides support to communities around the world affected by disasters, conflict, or endemic poverty without regard to their social, religious, or ethnic background.

Established in 1985, Muslim Aid has facilitated the engagement of the British Muslim and non-Muslim community in support of its work in a variety of ways. Over the years, its humanitarian work has included responses to major crises around the world including, famine in East Africa, earthquakes and flooding in Pakistan and Bangladesh as well as conflicts in Syria and Yemen.

We place strong emphasis on long-term development projects that build the capacity of local people to help themselves. In addition to the 5 country offices worldwide we also work with multiple partner offices focusing on sustainable Development Programmes and providing humanitarian relief during times of crisis.

Summary Of The Role

The Content & Copywriting Officer will involve developing engaging content for our social media channels, website blogs, and news section, as well as collaborating with the Search Engine Optimisation Officer to optimise copy for improved visibility and reach. You will play an important part in telling Muslim Aids story, inspiring our supporters, and helping to drive donations through impactful and well-crafted messaging.

About The Role
• Develop compelling, engaging, and audience-focused content for social media platforms, blogs, news updates, and campaigns.
• Collaborate with the SEO Officer on the production of keyword-optimised copy for landing pages, appeals and campaign content.
• Develop storytelling pieces that highlight Muslim Aids projects, beneficiaries, and impact.
• Review written content for accuracy, consistency and alignment with Muslim Aids tone of voice and brand guidelines.
• Collaborate with the programmes, fundraising and communications teams to deliver content that supports appeals and organisational goals.

About You

You must currently hold the right to work in the UK. Muslim Aid is not offering sponsorship for this role

To Be Successful In This Role, You Will Need
• Proven experience in content writing, copywriting, or digital communications.
• Excellent writing, editing, and proofreading skills with attention to detail.
• Experience writing for social media, websites, and blogs.
• Excellent communication and interpersonal skills with the ability to liaise with a variety of stakeholders and employees at all levels.
• Strong research skills and ability to generate creative, compelling content ideas.

Why You Should Apply

Join Muslim Aid as a Content & Copywriting Officer and use your creativity to tell stories that inspire change. Youll craft impactful, optimised content that connects supporters to our mission and drives donations. If youre passionate about storytelling and making a difference, apply now to help shape Muslim Aids voice and impact.

Benefits You Will Enjoy Working For Us
• 25 days annual leave + 4 Privilegedays
• Hybrid working
• Paid time off for medical appointments
• 2 hours lunch break on Fridays
• Time off in Lieu (TOIL)
• Pension Scheme

How To Apply

To apply please submit your cover letter (no more than 1 page) and CVand a portfolio of your work.

Applications will be accepted until the closing date. However, please note that Muslim Aid may conduct interviews and progress with the selection process on a rolling basis, with the aim of appointing a suitable candidate as soon as possible.

title: Content Designer / Copywriter
description:
End Date

Sunday 22 September 2024

Salary Range

£57,546 - £63,940

We support flexible working – click here for more information on flexible working options

Flexible Working Options

Hybrid Working, Job Share

Job Description Summary

Lloyds Banking Group is the UK’s leading bank with over 30m customers and its biggest digital bank, with over 18 million active online customers. We’ve placed an ambitious transformation programme and a multi-channel approach to banking at the heart of our strategy to be the best bank for customers, backed by significant investment in our platforms and people over the next three years.

We serve millions of customers every day, from individuals and families to large businesses and corporations. This means we’re well - placed to help Britain prosper by shaping the way we spend, save and borrow.

Job Description

JOB TITLE:

Content Designer / Copywriter

SALARY:

£57,546 - £63,940

LOCATION:

Chester

HOURS:

Full-Time

WORKING PATTERN:

Our work style is hybrid, which involves spending at least two days per week, or 40% of our time, at our Chester office.

About the opportunity

We’re looking for someone to help bring our digital experiences to life. You’ll be the expert on the copy, tone and personality of apps and websites our customers rely on every single day.

Within this team, you’ll combine research and insights with clear people-focussed language to refine and develop conversations with customers to help them do what they need to do.

You’ll be comfortable giving and receiving feedback to key internal customers across the business, and will work closely with product teams to create success metrics.

It’ll be your role to:
• Create engaging, readable, accessible content that gives our customers great digital experiences.
• Develop genuine empathy for people, understanding their needs, aspirations and challenges.
• Take ownership as the content expert in an agile environment.
• Think strategically about how our conversations can evolve, and spot opportunities for where they link into other experiences.
• Share expertise to help shape the overall design approach.
• Provide consistency in the way we have conversations with customers across topics and touchpoints.
• Promote and demonstrate how effective writing helps customers.

What you'll need
• Experience as a UX writer, conversation designer, or content designer.
• Familiarity working in a complex or regulated landscape – ideally financial services.
• A collaborative mindset ready to be a part of a busy multi-disciplinary team.
• Flexibility in writing on-brand content in multiple tones of voice.
• Confidence in writing concise, clear and consistent copy for different channels.
• The ability to influence and manage multiple stakeholders across product, risk, legal and branding teams.
• Experience using and collaborating in Design platforms, such as Figma.

About Working For Us

Our focus is to ensure we're inclusive every day, building an organisation that reflects modern society and celebrates diversity in all its forms. We want our people to feel that they belong and can be their best, regardless of background, identity or culture.

We were one of the first major organisations to set goals on diversity in senior roles, create a menopause health package, and a dedicated Working with Cancer initiative.

And it’s why we especially welcome applications from under-represented groups. We’re disability confident. So if you’d like reasonable adjustments to be made to our recruitment processes, just let us know.

We also offer a wide-ranging benefits package, which includes:
• A generous pension contribution of up to 15%
• An annual performance-related bonus
• Share schemes including free shares
• Benefits you can adapt to your lifestyle, such as discounted shopping
• 30 days’ holiday, with bank holidays on top
• A range of wellbeing initiatives and generous parental leave policies

Ready to start growing with purpose?

Apply today and let’s create something extraordinary together!

At Lloyds Banking Group, we're driven by a clear purpose; to help Britain prosper. Across the Group, our colleagues are focused on making a difference to customers, businesses and communities. With us you'll have a key role to play in shaping the financial services of the future, whilst the scale and reach of our Group means you'll have many opportunities to learn, grow and develop.

We keep your data safe. So, we'll only ever ask you to provide confidential or sensitive information once you have formally been invited along to an interview or accepted a verbal offer to join us which is when we run our background checks. We'll always explain what we need and why, with any request coming from a trusted Lloyds Banking Group person.

We're focused on creating a values-led culture and are committed to building a workforce which reflects the diversity of the customers and communities we serve. Together we’re building a truly inclusive workplace where all of our colleagues have the opportunity to make a real difference.

title: Copywriting Internship
description:
About HONOR

HONOR is a leading global provider of smart devices, striving to become an iconic technology brand and to create an intelligent world for everyone through powerful products and services. Our commitment to R&D fuels our mission to develop technology that empowers individuals worldwide to go beyond their limits, enabling them to achieve and accomplish more. With a diverse portfolio of high-quality smartphones, tablets, laptops, and wearables, HONOR offers innovative, premium, and reliable products designed to help people realize their best selves. Discover more about us at HONOR United Kingdom.

Position: Copywriting Intern

Location: London, UK

Key Responsibilities:
• Assist in managing the content calendar to ensure timely delivery of engaging social media and digital marketing content.
• Create compelling copy for advertorials, native ads, infographics, and digital banners based on creative briefs.
• Collaborate with the design team and other departments to maintain consistency in visual presentation and messaging.
• Uphold brand consistency by aligning all content with the brand image and overall marketing strategy.
• Conduct market and competitor analysis to gather insights on social media trends and audience preferences to enhance content creation.
• Participate in planning and executing digital marketing campaigns to support broader marketing objectives.
• Write and edit social media posts for platforms such as Facebook, Instagram, Twitter, and LinkedIn.
• Design and implement social media campaigns to boost brand visibility and user engagement.
• Assist in crafting email marketing content, advertising copy, and website text to ensure effective communication.

Qualifications:
• Pursuing a degree in English, marketing, communications, social media, film, or a related field OR possess a strong portfolio of content or copy production showcasing narrative skills.
• Exceptional writing and editing abilities across various mediums.
• Basic understanding of SEO, social media, and digital marketing principles.
• Strong communication skills and a collaborative mindset.
• Effective time management skills in a fast-paced environment to meet deadlines.
• A genuine passion for content creation and marketing, with a desire to learn and evolve.

At HONOR, we celebrate diversity and inclusion and are committed to building teams that represent a variety of backgrounds, perspectives, and skills. Please submit your CV and cover letter to Yikhinma@honor.com.

We look forward to receiving your resume in English.

Embark on an exciting journey with HONOR to go beyond!

Please review our Privacy notice.

title: Copywriter - Freelance

title: Social Media Content & Copywriter
description:
Company Overview:

JYZ Design is a boutique creative agency differentiating ourselves with quality work. We partner with passionate businesses to create a branding as unique as their vision. We specialize in website design, brand building, content creation and social media ads for the hospitality, Ecommerce and education industries. Our business thrives on entrepreneurship and participates in many different businesses.

Job Purpose:

JYZ Design is looking to grow and we are looking for people to grow with us. This position will support the day-to-day work with supervision from a manager. The successful applicant with be tasked with social media content, UGC content, blog copywriting and some marketing tasks. All our team members get to dip their toes in a variety of tasks and roles, so the more you have to bring to the table, the better.

Please make sure you include a writing portfolio and/or social media content you've created that represents a creative style, experience or a willingness to learn the tasks as described above. Bonus if you have a blog or experience in travel!

Requirements:
• NO remote workers – candidate must already be living in Calgary, Alberta.
• Knowledge of local area (lots of our clients are in tourism!)
• Constant curiosity for marketing optimization and where it fits into the clients' business
• Comfortable with communication standards for a variety of mediums
• Ability to self-edit as well as work of others
• Works to optimize speed of work
• Well organized approach to a variety of project work
• Ability to stay agile, be self motivated to learn
• Ability to meet deadlines and work effectively in a high-activity work environment
• Team player with strong communication skills
• Attention to detail and ability to follow a regiment workflow
• A history of innovation, creativity and delivering results
• A desire to work with designers, art directors, project managers and other writers
• A portfolio of your work – blogs, social content
• Understands Tiktok, Instagram, Facebook popular culture, trends and language
• Able to create and edit a Tiktok and Reels
• Able to write an engaging caption
• Able to manage the production of content on location with clients

Specific Skills a Plus (training provided):
• SEO – search engine writing
• Sales & client management
• Photography & Videography
• Web content management - Wordpress
• Email marketing - mailchimp
• Social media marketing - Instagram and Facebook ads

A perfect fit for our culture, you...
• Appreciates freedom in hours, working from home and independence
• Genuinely love what you do
• Are constantly seeking inspiration, the top trends and have innovative ideas when it comes to design and marketing
• Are looking for something different in your everyday work
• Are looking for opportunities to quickly advance your career and expand into different roles like Project management or Marketing director related
• Enjoy working with a close team and finding community
• Have great taste! Always has an opinion on the latest marketing campaigns, designs and what you see online.
• LOVES DOGS!

Benefits:
• Casual dress
• Dental care
• Extended health care
• Flexible schedule
• Paid time off
• Vision care
• Hybrid work model (2 days WFH, 3 days in office)

• Full-time

Please provide a portfolio with examples of work such as a website, social media page, or PDF (dropbox/Google drive links). Applications without portfolios will NOT be considered.

title: SEO Content Writer (Contract)
description:
Job Description

What is the opportunity?

Do you love applying your strategic mindset to crafting stories and content that drives impact? We’re looking for an SEO Content Manager driven by a curiosity for data and insights and the ability to turn them into actionable content.

As SEO Content Manager you will help bring to life high-quality, search- optimized content across RBC channels that drive organic growth and engagement. Blending creativity with strategy, you’ll be responsible for writing and editing content that aligns with consumer needs and brand voice ensuring all content supports our business goals.

This role is an opportunity for someone who’s just as comfortable writing new long-form articles as they are refining existing pages, analyzing competitors, and developing keyword strategies.

What you will do?
• Research, write, and edit high-quality, SEO and AI-optimized content (blog posts, video scripts, landing pages, web copy, social posts, etc.).
• Create content briefs, style guides, and tone-of-voice documentation to guide internal and external contributors.
• Conduct keyword research, search intent analysis, and competitive content audits to identify opportunities.
• Optimize on-page elements including meta titles, descriptions, headers, and internal linking.
• Ensure all content adheres to SEO and AI search best practices such as keyword placement, readability, and optimal character counts.
• Collaborate with designers, strategists, and SEO specialists to deliver cohesive, performance-driven content.
• Track and analyze content performance metrics and continuously refine strategies to improve rankings and engagement.
• Stay current with SEO trends, Google algorithm updates, and emerging content formats.

Qualifications
• 3+ years of experience in content writing, copywriting, or SEO-focused content creation.
• Strong understanding of SEO best practices, on-page optimization, and keyword strategy.
• Proven ability to perform and apply keyword research and competitive analysis.
• Excellent editing, proofreading, and storytelling skills with attention to detail.
• Experience creating content briefs, style guides, and managing editorial consistency.
• Familiarity with tools like Google Search Console, and SEMrush.
• Ability to balance creativity with performance data and business goals.
• Bachelor’s degree in Marketing, Communications, English, Journalism, or related field preferred.

Nice to Have
• Financial services industry experience
• Writing portfolio or samples.
• Experience with content management systems (e.g., WordPress).
• Understanding of content lifecycle management and content governance.
• Basic knowledge of HTML and structured data markup.

What’s in it for you

We thrive on the challenge to be our best, progressive thinking to keep growing, and working together to deliver trusted advice to help our clients thrive and communities prosper. We care about each other, reaching our potential, making a difference to our communities, and achieving success that is mutual.
• Leaders who support your development through coaching and managing opportunities
• Work in a dynamic, collaborative, progressive, and high-performing team
• Opportunities to do challenging work

Job Skills
A/B Testing, Collaborating, Communication, Content Creation, Content Editing, Content Management, Content Marketing, Content Writing, Copywriting, Detail-Oriented, Digital Marketing, Digital Marketing Platforms, Effectiveness Measurement, Google Analytics, Search Engine Marketing (SEM), Search Engine Optimization (SEO), SEO Best Practices, SEO Content, Website Analytics

title: Freelance Copywriter
description:
OVERVIEW
GIANT Creative is Ontario’s premier full-service performance marketing agency.
At GIANT, we develop captivating creative by combining data-driven insights and strategy with compelling art direction and design. We provide our partners with BIG thinking and integrated creative solutions across all channels, which drive giant results - from research to ideation to execution.

GIANT is seeking a freelance copywriter to support our dynamic team in London, On. This contract, in-office role is pivotal in producing high-impact visual communications that resonate with diverse audiences. We are seeking an experienced copywriter to help improve the effectiveness of our website and marketing materials. This role, and the ideal candidate will have a passion for writing and possess strong written communication skills.
You will work with a team of marketers to help generate sales leads and improve the quality of our website’s content. You will be responsible for writing both compelling blog posts and marketing copy for our website and will report directly to our art director.

Key Responsibilities:
• Write compelling content for print, web, product packaging, advertising, and marketing materials with a distinct voice
• Interpret copywriting briefs to understand project requirements
• Conduct high-quality research and interviews as necessary
• Use SEO principles to maximize copy’s reach
• Edit and proofread copy as needed
• Source images and other content
• Produce well-written content that is SEO friendly and optimized for conversion
• Create compelling ad copy, landing pages, and marketing campaigns
• Write high-quality product descriptions and provide supporting content
• Collaborate with designers and creative teams
• Work with analysts to ensure messaging is consistent across the company
• Brainstorm and manage projects and juggle multiple deliverables
• Define key messages and brand voice for external communications

Skills and Experience:
• 2-3 years of experience as a copywriter.
• A bachelor’s degree in marketing, communications, journalism, English, or a related field
• Strong editorial, proofreading, and writing skills
• Familiarity with keyword research
• Experience with SEO copywriting best practices
• Experience with social media and content marketing
• Excellent interpersonal, verbal, and written communication skills
• Ability to manage multiple projects and meet deadlines under pressure
• Passion for writing with an excellent portfolio of work

title: Copywriter
description:
We are seeking a talented and strategic contract Copywriter to help shape and scale the creative direction of our brand across all marketing channels. As a key player within a fast-paced, dynamic creative team, you will craft compelling copy that enhances the customer experience, strengthens brand identity, and drives business growth.

The ideal candidate is a creative thinker with a proven track record in brand storytelling, marketing copy, and content strategy. You are skilled in developing engaging messaging for diverse customer segments while maintaining a consistent brand voice across digital and traditional platforms. You should also be comfortable collaborating with marketing managers, designers, animators, and executives to bring ideas to life.

What You'll Do:
• Create compelling product positioning and value props tailored to our core audiences
• Develop clear, engaging, and brand-aligned copy for various marketing channels, including social media, web, video, email campaigns, and advertising.
• Collaborate with marketing managers, product teams, and designers to create content that supports business objectives and resonates with target audiences.
• Utilize AI tools to enhance content generation, streamline workflows, and optimize messaging for various channels
• Conduct research on industry trends, competitors, and customer insights to craft persuasive and effective copy.
• Assist in defining and refining brand voice and messaging guidelines, ensuring consistency across all content.
• Edit and proofread copy to ensure clarity, accuracy, and alignment with brand standards.
• Adapt content strategies based on A/B testing, SEO best practices, and performance data.
• Manage multiple projects in a fast-paced, deadline-driven environment while maintaining high creative standards.
• Partner with channel marketing leads and user research to establish on-going a/b testing of copy for channels and audiences

What You'll Bring to the Role:
• 3+ years of experience in copywriting, content marketing, or a related field.
• Strong portfolio showcasing experience in crafting marketing copy for digital and traditional platforms.
• Familiarity with AI tools for content creation, optimization, and automation.
• Experience writing for diverse formats, including social media, web, email, and video scripts, and marketing landing pages.
• Understanding of SEO best practices and data-driven content optimization.
• Ability to collaborate with designers, marketers, and other stakeholders.
• Excellent communication skills and attention to detail.
• Comfortable working in a fast-paced, agile environment

title: Senior Copywriter
description:
We Are: 

Accenture Song is the world’s largest tech-powered creative group. We accelerate growth and value for our clients through sustained customer relevance. Our capabilities span ideation to execution: growth, product and experience design; technology and experience platforms; creative, media and marketing strategy; and campaign, content and channel orchestration. With strong client relationships and deep industry expertise, we help our clients operate at the speed of culture through the unlimited potential of creativity, technology and intelligence—both human and artificial. Visit us at: www.accenture.com/song
