title: Lead - Procurement Education / Training
company: 7721 Vantive Healthcare Technologies Private Limited IND
description: Vantive es una empresa de terapia de órganos vital con la misión de prolongar la vida y ampliar las posibilidades para los pacientes y los equipos de atención de todo el mundo. Durante 70 años, nuestro equipo ha impulsado innovaciones significativas en el cuidado de los riñones. A medida que construimos nuestro legado, estamos profundizando nuestro compromiso de mejorar la experiencia de diálisis a través de soluciones digitales y servicios avanzados, al tiempo que miramos más allá de la atención renal e invertimos en la transformación de las terapias de órganos vitales. Una mayor flexibilidad y eficiencia en la administración de terapias para los equipos de atención, y vidas más largas y plenas para los pacientes: eso es lo que Vantive aspira a ofrecer. Creemos que Vantive no solo construirá nuestro liderazgo en el espacio de la atención renal, sino que también ofrecerá un trabajo significativo a aquellos que se unan a nosotros. En Vantive, pasarás a formar parte de una comunidad de personas centradas, valientes y que no se conforman con lo mediocre. Cada uno de nosotros está motivado para ayudar a mejorar la vida de los pacientes en todo el mundo. Únase a nosotros para avanzar en nuestra misión de extender vidas y expandir las posibilidades. Procurement Training Development Lead Role Summary: The Procurement Training Development Lead is responsible for designing, delivering, and continuously evolving Procurement capabilities and skill maturity. A key focus of this position is to embed upskilling as a strategic lever for procurement excellence—ensuring that employees, stakeholders, and suppliers are equipped with the right knowledge, tools, and hands-on skills to drive performance and compliance. The role will partner closely with the CPO, procurement leadership, category managers, Centers of Excellence (COEs), and end users to build a culture of continuous learning and capability development. It will also support PMO and Continuous Improvement (CI) through user adoption, and building across internal and external partners, in-depth process knowledge through targeted training interventions and change management initiatives. Summary of Responsibilities: Partner with procurement teams to identify skill gaps and training needs, and translate these into targeted learning solutions. Leverage procurement domain expertise to design and deliver engaging live and virtual training sessions, workshops, and onboarding programs tailored to upskill and evolve procurement, stakeholder and supplier knowledge. Develop and manage digital learning assets including e-learning modules, job aids, standard operating procedures (SOPs), and other enablement materials to support procurement excellence. Measure training effectiveness through participant feedback, assessments, and key performance indicators (KPIs), using insights to continuously improve program impact. Maintain a global training calendar and coordinate sessions across regions to ensure consistent and timely delivery of learning initiatives. Support change management efforts for new systems, tools, and process updates by creating and executing enablement strategies that drive user adoption. Help integrate procurement content into enterprise onboarding programs in collaboration with HR, ensuring all company-wide users understand relevant procurement policies, tools, and processes. Serve as a liaison with HR and Learning & Development (L&D), external training providers or consulting groups (as needed) to ensure alignment with enterprise learning platforms, standards, and governance. Core Responsibilities (detailed, but not an exhaustive list) 1. Procurement Functional Training Lead onboarding and continuous learning for procurement users. Develop and maintain a comprehensive curriculum covering systems, processes, policies, and best practices. Create a role-based maturity matrix to track placement and growth of procurement professionals. Lead training on strategic sourcing processes (RFP/RFI, supplier selection, negotiation, contracting). Develop materials for sourcing tools (e.g., e-sourcing platforms, CLM systems). Conduct onboarding and refresher sessions for sourcing professionals, responsible procurement. 2. Training Design & Development Conduct needs assessments collaborating with Procurement teams and use insights to design role-based learning paths for procurement professionals and stakeholders. Develop training courses, job aids, and e-learning content using authoring tools and/or work with training development resources (internal or external). Manage course creation and distribution via LMS platforms, ensuring alignment with learning objectives and standards. Create assessments and apply industry-standard methodologies to measure training effectiveness. Maintain course lifecycle and refresh schedules based on feedback and evolving needs. Additionally, own the development and release schedule for all procurement-related content, including third-party supplier training. Lead annual learning planning sessions across procurement teams; coordinate with Vantive Learning for alignment. Use ServiceNow case data and user feedback to identify knowledge gaps and drive improved training. Develop and deliver foundational curriculum on AI in procurement to support digital literacy and innovation. Maintain help content, FAQs, and self-service resources across procurement tools and processes. Deliver training via LMS (e-learning), live-virtual sessions, and class-room formats. Manage training budgets, resource requirements, track enrollments, and align learning methodologies with students globally and aligned with growth targets set by procurement. 3. Process & Policy Enablement Ensure sourcing teams understand procurement policies, thresholds, and compliance requirements. Provide guidance on supplier onboarding, risk management, and audit readiness. Support adoption of new sourcing tools and process changes. 5. Change Enablement & Communications Support COE and Procurement teams in drafting and distributing training communications. Maintain procurement training content on intranet and collaboration platforms. Contribute to change management efforts through stakeholder engagement and targeted messaging. Own/develop training content for newsletters, FAQs, and other communications. Monitor training metrics (completion rates, ratings, abandonment rates) to inform improvements. 6. Master Data Management (MDM) Training Provide training on procurement data governance standards. Guide teams through supplier creation and modification processes, emphasizing standardization and data quality. Teach best practices to ensure consistent, clean master data across procurement functions. 7. Digital Enablement, Analytics & Continuous Improvement Educate procurement users on AI/ML applications, including use cases in sourcing, contract creation, and spend analysis. Promote data integrity and system integration across procurement platforms to ensure seamless digital operations. Drive analytics adoption and user enablement in collaboration with IT, digital, and data teams. Align training and communications with project milestones, transformation initiatives, and continuous improvement (CI) goals. Support a culture of continuous improvement and project management through targeted learning paths, coaching, and enablement strategies. Provide actionable insights and training data to inform process enhancements, technology adoption, and functional maturity. Qualifications Bachelor’s degree in Business, Supply Chain Management, Learning & Development, or related field. MBA or Master’s in Supply Chain strongly preferred. 6+ years of progressive experience in procurement, including sourcing, contract management, transactional procurement, and training development/delivery. Advanced proficiency in LMS platforms and e-learning tools; hands-on experience with Coupa, Cornerstone, iCertis, JD Edwards/ERP, and Pega. Strong technical aptitude and ability to learn new systems quickly. Exceptional communication skills and ability to engage stakeholders across functions. Proven experience in leading change management and driving adoption. Familiarity with adult learning principles and digital learning platforms. Experience in a Procurement CoE or Shared Services environment. Knowledge of compliance, sourcing, and supplier management. Ability to work cross-functionally and influence without authority. Key Competencies 1. Procurement Expertise (Domain SME) Deep understanding of sourcing, contracting, supplier management, and procurement operations. Familiarity with procurement systems (e.g., Coupa, iCertis, JD Edwards/ERP, CLM, e-sourcing platforms). 2. Learning & Development (Domain SME) Proficiency in instructional design, adult learning principles, and curriculum development. Experience with LMS platforms and e-learning authoring tools (e.g., Articulate, WalkMe). Ability to create engaging, role-based learning paths and measure training effectiveness. 3. Communication & Collaboration (SME) Exceptional written and verbal English communication skills. Ability to influence without authority and collaborate cross-functionally with leadership, COEs, and end users Comfortable around different organizational levels 4. Change Management & Enablement (SME) Strong capability in driving user adoption and managing change across diverse teams. Skilled in stakeholder engagement, communication planning, and training rollout strategies. Can work well with ambiguity and blank page project types Can change directions, move on quickly and re-think direction quickly without emotion 5. Strategic Thinking & Continuous Improvement (Proficient) See big picture / long-term objectives and can imagine the journey and knows how to execute Ability to align training initiatives with organizational goals, project milestones, and CI efforts. Experience using data and feedback to inform process enhancements and transformation. 7. Technical Aptitude (Proficient) Comfort with learning and navigating complex systems and tools. Ability to translate procurement domain knowledge and related technical concepts into accessible training content. 8. Project & Program Management (Proficient) Strong organizational skills to manage multiple training programs, schedules, and content lifecycles. Experience in planning, executing, and evaluating learning initiatives at scale. 3. Digital & AI Literacy (Proficient) Knowledge of AI/ML applications in procurement and digital transformation. Ability to educate users on emerging technologies and promote analytics adoption. Understanding of data governance and system integration principles. Adaptaciones razonables Vantive está comprometida para trabajar y proveer ajustes razonables para personas con discapacidades, a nivel global. Si por una condición médica o discapacidad, necesitas algún ajuste en cualquier etapa del proceso de aplicación o entrevista, por favor ingresa a este enlace y déjanos saber la naturaleza de tu requerimiento junto a tu información de contacto. Enlace al formulario Recruitment Fraud Notice Vantive has discovered incidents of employment scams, where fraudulent parties pose as Vantive employees, recruiters, or other agents, and engage with online job seekers in an attempt to steal personal and/or financial information. To learn how you can protect yourself, review our Recruitment Fraud Notice. En Vantive, su trabajo ampliará sus habilidades, conocimientos y oportunidades de crecimiento y aprendizaje para avanzar en su carrera. En 2023, comenzamos el viaje para establecer los negocios de cuidado renal crónico y terapias agudas de Baxter en una empresa independiente. Estamos encantados de presentarle a Vantive. Juntos, nos basaremos en nuestro legado de casi 70 años en terapias agudas y diálisis en el hogar y en el centro para brindar la mejor atención de su clase a las 1+ millones de personas a las que servimos. En Vantive, creemos no solo en construir nuestro liderazgo en el espacio de la atención renal, sino también en ofrecer un trabajo significativo a quienes se unen a nosotros. Ofrecemos una amplia gama de emocionantes oportunidades profesionales en varios departamentos, desde investigación y desarrollo hasta marketing y ventas. Si está buscando impulsar la innovación y el crecimiento en una nueva organización impulsada por un propósito, tenemos un lugar para usted en Vantive

title: Professional Education Trainer
description:
We’re looking for an exceptional Professional Education Skills Trainer to join our Professional Education Team, based in Mumbai, India. Reporting to Assistant Manager - Professional Education. As Technical Skills Trainer you will travel to a range of locations in India and will be primarily responsible for delivering system training sessions to surgical teams, ensuring the competent setup and operation of the Versius robotic system as well as providing product knowledge support to those teams during their initial proctored cases. You will be an integral part of the Clinical Education team and will liaise with a wide range of other team members.

About CMR Surgical

CMR is an exciting and evolving company to be joining right now. Our commitment to our goal of building a world-class medical devices company is underpinned by the ground-breaking innovation of our next generation of surgical robots and a diverse team of talented and supportive individuals.

We’re breaking new ground which makes working here exciting, it provides autonomy, opportunity and makes the things you do visible. Come and join us and see what you’re capable of.

Responsibilities
• Deliver time to time trainings to surgical team as per company’s training protocol Preparing requisite manuals and materials of training sessions
• Conducting internal training to enhance employees’ system knowledge
• To create training materials and perform informational presentations about Versius surgical system offered by the company
• Communicate training needs and schedule
• Track and compile collected data
• To develop a competency and skill sets in an individual to perform his/her effectively and efficiently in the workplace
• The trainer should communicate to the trainees about what is expected out of training in a simple and professional way
• To give system demonstration to the customers that would visit Mumbai CMR office time to time

We’re a rapidly developing company and roles can change and evolve. You’ll be willing to turn your hand to anything within the Professional Education remit that supports the team with delivering its objectives.

About you

To be successful in this role, you’ll need to have/be:
• Evidenced experience in Operating Room process management or hospital staff education development/training
• Training Ability –demonstrated commitment to customer and peer training, specifically related to advanced technology within a clinical environment
• Highly Organised –you will be responsible for a variety of key planning & coordinating activities including customer visits for dry box & wet lab test-drives of Versius
• Bachelor’s degree in medical/ paramedical/ science or related field
• Previous experience of one year in Health care sector.
• Knowledge of various training and teaching methods
• Proficient computer skills, Microsoft Office Suite (Word, PowerPoint, Outlook & Excel)
• Good interpersonal skills, verbal and written communication skills.
• Great interpersonal and communication skills
• You will be based in Mumbai
• Willingness to Travel as per business needs

At CMR we’re building a diverse, inclusive, and authentic workplace; what matters most to us is that you identify with our values and are passionate about making a difference.

We’d really like to hear from applicants from underrepresented groups and we recognise everyone has individual personal circumstances, so we’re open to discussing reduced / flexible / hybrid working hours for this role.

Why Join Us?

We offer a competitive salary and a great benefits package including a bonus, non-contributory pension, private healthcare which covers pre-existing conditions, annual personal day for every employee to use however they wish and enhanced global parental leave pay.

We recognise that everyone has a life outside of work and at times we can experience things which are significant and can impact on our working lives. We’ve just launched our Global Parental Leave and Health and Wellbeing leave supporting our colleagues going through the menopause, fertility cycles or pregnancy loss and those going through gender reassignment; allowing them time to look after themselves and those close to them.

CMR can support with travel reimbursement for in-person interviews if you need a taxi for access needs.

Interested? We’d love to hear from you!

title: Professional Learning Coordinator
description:
Overview

170+ Years Strong. Industry Leader. Global Impact.At Pinkerton, the mission is to protect our clients. To do this, we provide enterprise risk management services and programs specifically designed for each client. Pinkerton employees are one of our most important assets and critical to the delivery of world-class solutions. Bonded together, we share a commitment to integrity, vigilance, and excellence.

Pinkerton is an inclusive employer who seeks candidates with diverse backgrounds, experiences, and perspectives to join our family of industry subject matter experts.

The Professional Learning Coordinator will primarily focus on creating and delivering training to the BAC staff to support the success of operational and client-directed learning needs, particularly regarding onboarding training sessions for new-hire operations employees. This person will develop training content utilizing dynamic approach and materials embedded with a range of adult learning principles. In addition to leading training for new hires, the Professional Learning Coordinator will assist with creating additional training resources as needed, as well as distribute and implement training initiatives for staff on shift, on site, and remotely. Professional Learning Coordinator will assist in Operations by monitoring Security systems, Incident management and report writing as needed. The Professional Learning Coordinator reports to the Account Manager and the Professional Learning Manager

Responsibilities
• Represent Pinkerton’s core values of integrity, vigilance, and excellence.
• Onboard, orient, and train new hires in an instructor-led environment
• Conduct needs-assessments by working with subject matter experts and other key stakeholders to identify knowledge gaps, objectives, training needs, etc.
• Collaborate with colleagues to build and edit training content aligned with best practices and quality standards, such as case studies, presentations, eLearning modules, handouts, etc.
• Review and maintain training materials and records accurately, auditing for updates and revisions regularly
• Perform instructor-led style training for new hires
• Perform other related duties as required
• Strong customer service skills
• Flexibility to work all shifts, and willingness to assist the team when needed as instructor or operating monitoring Security systems, Incident management and report writing as required
• All other duties, as assigned.

Qualifications
• Bachelors in adult education, organizational behavior, psychology, project management or a related field and/or equivalent experience in training/coaching, adult education, curriculum design, content creation, Corporate Security

Competencies:
• Confidence, especially with public speaking
• Ability to multitask and balance workload and competing priorities
• Ability to work with minimal direction
• Takes initiative and is proactive in utilizing available time to make thoughtful contributions to support team projects and tasks
• Creative and detail oriented
• Flexibility/Adaptability, comfortable with fast-paced change
• Ability to work collaboratively and independently
• Critical thinking; ability to synthesize multiple ideas or concepts
• Emotional Intelligence and intuitive to unexpressed needs of others
• Exceptional verbal/written communication skills

Working Conditions:

With or without reasonable accommodation, requires the physical and mental capacity to effectively perform all essential functions;
• Regular computer usage.
• Occasional reaching and lifting of small objects and operating office equipment.
• Frequent sitting, standing, and/or walking.
• Travel, as required.

Pinkerton is an equal opportunity employer to all applicants and positions without regard to race/ethnicity, color, national origin, ancestry, sex/gender, gender identity/expression, sexual orientation, marital/prenatal status, pregnancy/childbirth or related conditions, religion, creed, age, disability, genetic information, veteran status, or any protected status by local, state, federal or country-specific law.

title: Lead Training Manager
description: Work Flexibility: Onsite Who we want: • Hard-working winners. Confident, competitive and results-oriented professionals who create a track record of success. • Dedicated achievers. People who thrive in a fast-paced environment and will stop at nothing to ensure a project is complete and meets regulations and expectations. • Effective communicators. People who can interpret information clearly and accurately to concisely communicate results and recommendations to stakeholders. • Collaborative partners. People who build and leverage cross-functional relationships to bring together ideas, information, use cases, and industry analyses to develop best practices. What you will do: • Relationship management skills in a sales/marketing function within a team environment or independently • Strong product and procedural knowledge • Understanding and knowledge of key competitive landscape • Support development of educational content utilizing HCP input • Support program development with guidance from others • Maintain collaboration with broader Medical Education/product marketing/sales training, etc • Lead Medical Education program coordination, logistics and content delivery • Organize in-class or virtual courses • Identify what we want to measure/track and most appropriate method • Understand our Medical Education and business strategy • Provide input to future plans • Assist in defining business metrics • Provide data and input to plan • Understand KOLs profile and starts networking • Understand and provide input to training and Medical Education workstreams • Gain expertise in Medical Education programs and adapt programs with customer’s needs • Understand the different communication channel strategies • Partner with Marketing Communications to develop communications plan Minimum Qualifications (Required): • Bachelor’s degree required • 4+ years of work experience required Preferred Qualifications (Strongly desired): • MBA preferred • 2+ years medical device or Medical Education experience preferred • Excellent presentation and interpersonal communications skills • Strong analytical and problem-solving skills • Ability to manage multiple projects while delivering on established timelines • Ability to be persuasive in the absence of organizational authority • Must be able to understand and work within complex interdivisional procedures and policies • Demonstrated proficiency in Microsoft Office (Excel, Word & PowerPoint) Travel Percentage: 40% Stryker is one of the world’s leading medical technology companies and, together with its customers, is driven to make healthcare better. We are proud to be named one of the World’s Best Workplaces! For more information, visit: www.stryker.com Work Flexibility Remote – Role allows you to work the majority to 100% of time from an alternate workplace. These roles could have travel expectations, and you must work within the country of the job requisition location. Field-based – You can expect to regularly work a majority to 100% of time at customer facilities and has a set territory or expectation to travel within a set boundary. Almost all sales roles would likely be qualified as field-based. Onsite – Role is 100% located at a Stryker facility. Some ad hoc flexibility may be available depending on role, level, and job requirements. Manufacturing roles and any role that requires physical presence at the office would qualify under this category. Hybrid – You can expect to regularly work in both an alternate workplace and a Stryker facility. Roles that are partially remote or co-located would qualify as hybrid, and the expectation to be onsite would be defined and agreed upon by your manager/supervisor.

title: Training Program Manager
description: Job Description Are you ready to take on a multifaceted role that requires intimate knowledge and personal experience working with commercial channels? We're seeking a dedicated individual with a passion for driving sales success to join our team! The Training & Enablement team delivers programs and enablement solutions across all field training areas: operational, technical/product, sales, professional and sales management. You will be responsible for leading and optimizing the commercial training program. Using your specialized knowledge, you will design, curate, and implement programs that deliver high value, feedback, and return on investment in a mostly remote, virtual environment. Partnering with front-line sales managers, marketing, global partners, HR business partners, vendors, senior sales managers, and the regional sales VPs, you will drive initiatives and programs forward in a collaborative and mutually beneficial manner. You will play a key role in the overall intent to build organizational capability to support our critical initiatives. This role is highly visible within the organization. We are looking for a driven and motived teammate with strong project management skills, familiarity with sales enablement technologies and ability to influence others. Responsibilities: Collaborate with the commercial org, marketing, and product teams to develop and implement training materials and resources. Conduct needs analysis and execute findings. Build and curate courses and curriculum to create online and in-person learning experiences and environments. Design learning activities, assignments, and assessments. Collaborate with subject matter experts to develop course content. Deliver and facilitate training sessions. Manage program logistics including scheduling, producing webinars, managing logistics for face-to-face sessions. Manage vendor relationships. Manage online learning communities. Monitor training, capture metrics and provide regular reports on effectiveness. Analyse and continuously improve content working with the relevant subject matter experts. Stay current on best practices in instructional design. Qualifications Qualifications/Skills: Experience working in a Matrix organization. Strong interest in learning and development. Knowledge of instructional theory, adult learning principles, and needs assessment. Proficiency with learning management systems (LMS). Understanding of website design best practices. Excellent project management and organizational skills. Experience with development platforms, including Articulate 360 and Vyond. Excellent written and oral communication skills, including the ability to effectively convey technical information to non-technical colleagues and clients. Strong critical thinking skills. Ability to prioritize and manage multiple simultaneous deadlines. Experience facilitating/teaching over web-based technologies and large face-to-face audiences. Education, Experience & Licensing Requirements: Bachelor’s degree or equivalent experience in instructional design, education, or related field preferred. Experience as an instructor. Previous experience in instructional design, learning, or training. Experience in a sales operations or sales enablement role a plus. Strong understanding of sales processes and methodologies, including sales enablement platforms and technologies. Additional Details This job has a full time weekly schedule. It includes the option to work remotely. Our pay ranges are determined by role, level, and location. Within the range, individual pay is determined by work location and additional factors, including job-related skills, experience, and relevant education or training. During the hiring process, a recruiter can share more about the specific pay range for a preferred location. Pay and benefit information by country are available at: https://careers.agilent.com/locations Agilent Technologies Inc. is an equal opportunity employer. Qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, protected veteran status, disability or any other protected categories under all applicable laws. Travel Required: 25% of the Time Shift: Day Duration: No End Date Job Function: Marketing Graduate and Student Career Site Visit our career site and learn more about Agilent Watch our video playlist to get a glimpse of life at Agilent! As a global leader in laboratory and clinical technologies, we are passionate about bringing great science to life. Our commitment to quality and innovation supports cutting-edge life science research, patient diagnostics, and ensures the safety of water, food, and pharmaceuticals. As scientists and clinicians pursue small, everyday advances and life-changing discoveries, we provide trusted answers to their most critical questions and challenges. Leveraging more than 50 years of expertise, we create advanced instruments, software, and consumables supported by teams of highly skilled and knowledgeable people. With 18,000 employees around the world, our global reach and comprehensive solutions provide the most reliable and accurate results, as well as optimal scientific, economic, and operational outcomes. We work collaboratively with our customers on their journey to make a real difference in human lives. Our culture is founded on trust, respect, and uncompromising integrity, and we pride ourselves on being a dynamic and inclusive workplace that celebrates diversity and fosters innovation. We can’t wait for you to join us as we continue our mission to improve the world around us. Information about Agilent is available at Agilent.com.

title: Education and Training Partner
description:
Education & Training Partner

Kettering, Northamptonshire | Full-time, Monday–Friday 37.5 hours a week

About The Role

We're proud to be partnering with our client, a leading name in the food manufacturing industry, to find an experienced Education & Training Partner for their high-performing site in Kettering.

This is an exciting opportunity for a motivated learning and development professional to take ownership of the site's training strategy — leading the Education & Training (E&T) pillar and driving a culture of capability, compliance, and continuous improvement.

You'll work closely with teams across HR, Production, and Operations to deliver impactful training that develops people and supports site success.

Key Responsibilities
• Lead and develop the E&T pillar and training programmes across the site.
• Design and roll out a Subject Matter Expert (SME) framework to build internal capability.
• Ensure all training materials and records are accurate, compliant, and up to date.
• Manage induction and onboarding for new employees.
• Introduce digital tools and systems to enhance training delivery and tracking.
• Coach and develop the E&T Coordinator and act as a key partner to site leadership.

About You
• Proven experience in L&D, training coordination, or HR, ideally in manufacturing or a similar setting.
• Strong understanding of instructional design and learning management systems.
• Confident communicator who can influence and engage at all levels.
• Highly organised, proactive, and passionate about continuous improvement.
• Comfortable using Microsoft Office and modern learning technologies.

Why Apply?
• Join a globally recognised business at the forefront of its industry.
• Play a key role in developing people and shaping site capability.
• Work in a collaborative, forward-thinking environment.
• Excellent opportunities for career growth and development.

Interested?

Apply now or get in touch to learn more about this fantastic Education & Training Partner opportunity with our client in Kettering.

title: Tutor. Education & Training
description:
Position: 1:1 Tutor. Job Education & Training Jobs

Overview

1:1 Tutor of Maths & English We re looking for Teachers, HLTAs or experienced Tutors to work on a one-to-one basis with students who are receiving education outside of a traditional school environment. This role is ideal for someone who enjoys tailoring learning to individual needs and making a real difference to young people who need additional support with Maths and English.
Responsibilities
• Deliver engaging one-to-one tuition sessions in Maths and/or English
• Support students who may be out of school for a range of reasons (for example, SEMH, anxiety, medical needs)
• Create a safe and encouraging learning environment
• Plan sessions based on each learner s needs and ability
• Sessions may take place in community settings or in the student s home (with safeguarding and safety always prioritised)
What we re looking for
• QTS, HLTA status, or strong tutoring experience
• Confident teaching Maths and English from Key Stage 2 to Key Stage 4
• A calm, flexible and supportive approach
• Someone who can build positive relationships with learners
• Reliable, organised, and a strong communicator
Why join us
• Flexible part-time or full-time hours available
• Competitive hourly rates
• Ongoing support from a friendly and experienced team
• An opportunity to make a genuine impact on a young person s education
How to apply

If you are interested in this role please email with an up to date copy of your CV, or give us a call for an informal chat about opportunities.
The Education Network Offer & Compliance

Our specialist team boasts extensive combined experience and an unrivalled reputation within the education sector. We take pride in delivering high service levels to both schools and candidates, with an approach that is honest and efficient and designed to offer a recruitment solution tailored to your needs. We provide opportunities for further training and development to enhance your career. You will work in a friendly, caring, and supportive environment where every child matters.

Our committed consultants strive to find roles that suit your professional aspirations, with excellent pay and ongoing opportunities for growth. The Education Network is dedicated to safeguarding and promoting the welfare of children and young people. Appointments are subject to comprehensive vetting procedures, including enhanced DBS checks and references, and Safer Recruitment practices. We are an equal opportunities employer and operate as a recruitment agency for this role.

Due to the high volume of applications, shortlisted candidates are contacted within three days.

Data Privacy and Processing:
By applying for this role, you agree for The Education Network to process and store your personal data, including your CV and application form, for recruitment purposes. We are committed to protecting your privacy and handling data in accordance with GDPR. Your information will be kept securely and will not be shared with third parties without your consent. We retain data for up to 24 months unless you request deletion earlier.

You may request access to, amend, or delete your data at any time by contacting Neville Wood at The Education Network.

title: SEN Teacher. County Education & Training
description:
Position: SEN Teacher. Job in County Education & Training Jobs

Overview

SEN Teacher
• Good School with Outstanding Features
• Key Stage 4 Complex Needs Class
• SEN Teacher Role
• 8 Pupils and 2 full time TAs
• Ealing LA
• Excellent Public Transport Links
• 2-3 term Maternity Cover

A vacancy has arisen for an SEN Teacher to join a high achieving, friendly and successful SEN school in Ealing. This SEN teacher role has come up as a member of staff will be going off on maternity from the October half term. The Headteacher wants to ensure there is a comprehensive handover and would like to appoint from September, most likely through to the end of the academic year.

As a result the school are seeking an SEN teacher to take on one of their KS4 complex needs classes.

This excellent Ealing SEN school is for students with a wide range of complex needs. It is co-educational and caters for up to 95 children and young adults aged from 7 - 19. The building comprises of ten classrooms, a therapy room, Food Technology, Art Room, a kitchen and a hall which doubles as a gym. The school has 2 minibuses which are used regularly for educational visits and school journeys.

There was a new wing opened in 2008 which houses the Sixth Form and an additional kitchen. A brand new state of the art sensory room opened in September and has already proved highly successful.

The Headteacher is a fantastically inclusive and realistic leader who understands the demands placed on his teachers and works to ensure that the resources, training, support and infrastructure are all in place so that his staff and ultimately the pupils are set up to succeed. The school has a burgeoning reputation and there is significant interest from the LA and parents outside of the borough for school expansion, talks are ongoing surrounding additional capacity for September.

For this reason there is a great chance that a permanent position in school would be available in September subject to the usual processes in line with equal opportunities legislation.

The class consists of 8 pupils with a range of needs including down syndrome, global developmental delay, one child with a complex medical condition and one pupils with severe arthritis and learning difficulties. The pupils attainment levels are between P6 and P8 so experience working in either complex needs or in EYFS would be advantageous. Behaviour in class and across the school in general is good and the two full time TAs will be a fantastic help getting you attuned to the needs and routines of the class.

All the pupils in class are verbal but some Makaton and PECs usage will occur in class to support learning.

The ideal teacher will be able to plan, deliver and assess lessons that focus on a sensory curriculum, have good behaviour and classroom management skills, have a proven track record as a "good" teacher and bring passion and commitment to their job.

This is a wonderful opportunity to join a forward thinking, supportive and successful school. Applications from overseas trained teachers with relevant experience are welcomed. Likewise applications from good or outstanding mainstream teachers are encouraged

REESON

Education:

REESON Education is London's Premier Recruitment Agency. Established in 2006 by experienced teachers, education professionals and recruitment specialists, we have built our business and reputation on the cores values of honesty, integrity and excellence.

We care about education and the provision of education and have established an excellent reputation with schools and teachers alike.

At REESON Education we work closely with a large network of Nurseries, Primary Schools, Secondary Schools and Colleges across London. Our client base provides us with an abundance of available daily supply, long term and permanent opportunities across all age groups in all areas of London.

title: Senior Manager, Professional Education Team, Learning, Human Resources
description:
Connect to your Industry

The development of our people is a key component of our People Priorities, and our Employee Value Proposition. Our role is to support the performance and growth of around 20,000 colleagues that collectively comprise Deloitte UK. Our Talent and Learning mission is to “Measurably improve the experience and performance of colleagues at Deloitte”. Learning is a vital component of our employee experience.

Deloitte is one of the largest student employers in the UK. In total, we support around 4,000 students on Apprentice and Graduate programmes, providing a broad range of work experience and formal learning and development opportunities. Our Professional Education team plays a key role in building the technical knowledge and skills of our Graduates and School Leavers through design and delivery of their Professional Qualification pathways ensuring they respond to business need and are setting our students up to successfully achieve their qualification and progress in their career.

Connect to your career at Deloitte

Deloitte drives progress. Using our vast range of expertise, we help our clients' become leaders wherever they choose to compete. To do this, we invest in outstanding people. We build teams of future thinkers, with diverse talents and backgrounds, and empower them all to reach for and achieve more.

What brings us all together at Deloitte? It’s how we approach the thousands of decisions we make every day. How we behave, our beliefs and our attitudes. In other words: our values. Whatever we do, wherever we are in the world, we lead the way, serve with integrity, take care of each other, foster inclusion, and collaborate for measurable impact. These five shared values lead every decision we make and action we take, guiding us to deliver impact how and where it matters most.

Connect to your opportunity

Investing in our people is paramount to our success. Professional education is a critical component of our early career experience, directly impacting talent development, retention, and ultimately, business outcomes. As a Senior Manager within the Professional Education Team, you will play a pivotal role in shaping the future of professional development at Deloitte, driving strategic transformation and innovation to maximise the value we deliver to both our people and our clients.

In this high-impact role, you will work closely with the Head of Professional Education, senior partners in Audit & Assurance (A&A) and across the firm; the Talent & Learning leadership team, the Director of Early Careers, and the Head of Early Experience Learning. You will help to provide strategic leadership and direction to a team of experienced professional qualification managers, ensuring alignment with Deloitte's Purpose, People Priorities, and Values. Your deep understanding of professional education, combined with your business acumen and strategic vision, will be instrumental in developing and implementing a world-class professional education strategy that supports our learners in achieving their qualifications efficiently while meeting the evolving needs of our business.

Success in this role hinges on your ability to build strong partnerships and foster a collaborative environment. You will work closely with key stakeholders across HR, including Early Careers Resourcing & Recruitment, HR Business Partners, Business Area Learning Teams, Learning & Professional Education Partners, and the Student Advisory Service. By effectively leveraging the expertise and perspectives of these teams, you will ensure the successful transformation of our Professional Education offering and its integration with broader talent initiatives.

Working with the Head of Professional Education and senior Audit stakeholders, your role will include the following:

Programme Transformation, Design and Development
• Lead and execute the strategic transformation of our Graduate Audit ACA Training Model for September 2026. This involves collaborating with senior Audit stakeholders to ensure alignment with evolving business needs and optimising student success.
• Drive firm-wide alignment of all professional qualification programmes to deliver a consistent and exceptional student experience while maximising operational efficiency across all business areas.
• Play a leading role in the broader transformation of our Professional Education offering, proactively identifying and implementing innovative professional qualification solutions to address the evolving skills requirements of the business.
• Lead the transition to the 'Next Gen ACA' qualification and manage changes required due to apprenticeship levy funding. Ensure minimal disruption to students and business operations while maximising the benefits of the new programme.
• Leverage deep professional qualification expertise and data-driven insights to continuously review and enhance apprenticeship and firm-wide qualification offerings, ensuring they remain aligned with business needs and reflect best practices.

Stakeholder Engagement
• Lead strategic engagement with senior partners across Audit and Assurance and firm-wide to shape the vision and direction of our professional education offerings, including the transformation of the Graduate Audit ACA Training Model. Ensure alignment with business objectives and a consistent, high-quality student experience.
• Collaborate with senior partners to develop and implement governance frameworks, policies, and processes for the new Audit ACA programme that enhance its quality and impact. Assess the divergence and applicability of these frameworks to professional education programmes firm-wide.
• Build and nurture strong relationships with key HR stakeholders, including senior business partners, Employee Relations, HR Advisory, Recruitment, Resourcing, Onboarding, and Central Business Services. Drive strategic alignment across HR functions to optimise the student experience, from recruitment and onboarding through to professional qualification and beyond.

Operational Delivery / Third-Party Management
• Oversee the operational delivery of professional education programmes, including managing our supplier to deliver the new Audit & Assurance Graduate programme for September 2026, ensuring a seamless, high-quality experience for students.
• Monitor student Institute and Apprenticeship compliance, developing strategies and targeted interventions to improve areas of non-compliance.
• Play a leading role in managing relationships with our third-party suppliers, Central Business Services, and the Student Advisory Service team to define, monitor, and continuously improve service level agreements (SLAs) and key performance indicators (KPIs).
• Develop and implement strategies to optimise the efficiency and effectiveness of key operational processes, including exam results management and query resolution.
• Develop and manage strategic partnerships with apprenticeship and professional education providers and professional bodies, ensuring alignment with Deloitte's quality standards and business objectives.
• Negotiate and manage contracts with third-party providers, ensuring value for money and compliance with all relevant regulations.
• Proactively identify and mitigate risks associated with third-party relationships, ensuring business continuity and reputational integrity.
• Represent Deloitte in engagements with external professional bodies, such as the ICAEW, to influence policy development and ensure compliance with industry standards.

Connect to your skills and professional experience
• Qualified Chartered Accountant (ACA) with extensive experience in professional education and development, specializing in accounting and tax qualifications (e.g., ACA, ICAS, CFAB, CIMA) or equivalent.
• Proven track record of successfully leading and transforming professional qualification programs within a complex, matrixed organization.
• Deep understanding of apprenticeship policy, levy funding rules, and early careers development frameworks.
• Exceptional stakeholder management skills, with a demonstrated ability to build strong relationships, influence senior leaders, and drive consensus across diverse stakeholder groups.
• Strong business acumen and analytical skills, with experience using data and insights to inform strategic decision-making and measure programme effectiveness.
• Excellent communication and presentation skills, with the ability to effectively convey complex information to a variety of audiences, both written and verbally.
• Proven project management expertise, with a track record of successfully delivering complex initiatives on time and within budget.
• Strong leadership skills, with the ability to inspire and motivate teams to achieve ambitious goals.
• Experience of leading and developing teams.
• Proficient in utilizing digital platforms and analytical tools to enhance program delivery and effectiveness.
• Budget management experience and some experience of third-party contracting and management. You will show a strong commercial orientation to ensure value for money and supplier excellence.
• Experience of the professional services industry is highly desirable.
• A bachelor's degree or international equivalent is essential.

For a full job description, please visit our online Deloitte Careers portal.

title: Learning Support Assistant
description:
Vision for Education is seeking dedicated and compassionate Learning Support Mentors to join our team.

Full Time Or Part time

Leeds

December 2025

About the role

Join Vision for Education as a Learning Support Mentor

Location: Leeds

Salary: £270–£450 per week (dependent on experience and qualifications)

Contract Type: Full-time, Part-time, Long-term

Start Date: December 2025

About the Role

Vision for Education is seeking dedicated and compassionate Learning Support Mentors to join our team. In this role, you'll work closely with students across primary and SEND settings, providing one-on-one or small group support to help them overcome barriers to learning. Your focus will be on assisting students with Special Educational Needs and Disabilities (SEND), Social, Emotional, and Mental Health (SEMH) challenges, and those for whom English is an additional language.

Key Responsibilities

Provide tailored support to students, fostering their academic and personal development.

Collaborate with teaching staff to implement individualised support plans.

Assist students in developing study skills, resilience, and confidence.

Monitor and track student progress, adjusting support strategies as needed.

Maintain accurate records of interventions and communications.

Requirements

Experience working with children or young people in educational settings.

Familiarity with supporting students with SEND or SEMH needs.

Strong communication and interpersonal skills.

Ability to adapt to diverse learning environments and needs.

What Vision for Education Offers

Competitive weekly pay through our in-house PAYE system.

Guaranteed pay scheme (subject to availability and qualifying criteria).

Pension contributions (subject to a qualifying period).

Full compliance with Agency Workers’ Regulations (AWR).

FREE professional development training, including Team Teach and safeguarding courses.

Generous refer-a-friend or colleague bonus scheme.

Access to a dedicated consultant for ongoing support

About us:

Vision for Education York is a market-leading education supply agency and part of The Edwin Group who have been recognised as a Top 10 UK-employer in The Sunday Times Best Places to Work 2024.

We are regularly rated as 'Excellent' by our staff in all categories and highly praised as having industry leading and world-class levels of employee engagement across the Group.

What we can offer you in return:

Competitive rates of pay – up to £650 a week!

Access to free CPD training courses to further enhance your skills and understanding.

A dedicated, caring consultant to support you every step of the way throughout your placement.

Opportunities for ongoing work in a variety of schools and settings.

What to do next:

If you meet our requirements and are itching to get back into the classroom, then we would LOVE to hear from you!

Apply today via our website, or for more information about the role and other opportunities call us on (phone number removed) or email (url removed)
