Strong experience in SEO strategy to improve website visibility and search engine rankings. (Mandatory skill)
Skilled in social media advertising to create, manage, and optimize campaigns across various platforms. (Mandatory skill)
Google Analytics experience to track and analyze website traffic and user behavior for data-driven decisions.
Expertise in brand development to enhance and nurture the companys image and reputation in the market. (Mandatory skill)
Adept in conducting market research and trend analysis to identify opportunities and benchmark performance.
Competence in paid advertising techniques to efficiently manage budgets and maximize ROI.
Effective marketing strategy acumen to guide campaigns from conceptualization through execution.

Roles And Responsibilities
Develop and implement cohesive digital marketing strategies that increase brand awareness and drive conversion.
Manage social media profiles, increase engagement, and foster relationships with an online audience.
Coordinate brand strategy initiatives that differentiate and position our products effectively in the market.
Oversee the execution of SEO strategies to enhance online presence and ensure alignment with marketing objectives.
Leverage analytics tools to measure the success of marketing campaigns and adjust strategies for optimal performance.
Collaborate with internal teams to align brand messaging across all digital and physical channels.
Stay current with digital marketing trends, competitive landscape, and industry developments.
Generate insightful reports for management on digital marketing performance and strategic recommendations.

Required Qualifications
Bachelors degree in marketing, Communications, Business, or a related field.
2+ years of experience in digital marketing, preferably with experience in green technology, renewable energy, or sustainability sectors.
Proficiency in digital marketing tools and platforms such as Google Analytics, Google Ads, SEMrush, Hootsuite, Mailchimp, and social media management tools.
Strong understanding of SEO, SEM, content marketing, email marketing, PPC, and social media marketing.
Experience with website optimization, A/B testing, and conversion rate optimization.
Knowledge of content management systems (CMS) such as WordPress, and familiarity with HTML/CSS is a plus.
Excellent written and verbal communication skills with the ability to create engaging content and copy for digital platforms.
Strong analytical skills and experience with data-driven marketing decision-making.
Ability to work independently and as part of a collaborative team.
Passion for sustainability and green technologies, with a commitment to promoting eco-friendly initiatives.

Preferred Skills
Experience with video marketing, YouTube, and multimedia content creation.
Familiarity with CRM tools
Basic knowledge of design tools like Canva or Adobe Creative Suite for creating digital assets.
Strong project management skills with the ability to prioritize and manage multiple tasks simultaneously,

title: Lead, Digital Marketing - 3PP, India
description:
WHO YOU’LL WORK WITH

The Lead, Digital Marketing India, will report to the Marketing Director, India and partner closely with the Brand Marketing and Digital Commerce teams in India and the Digital Marketing teams in Singapore SEA&I Office. This role will collaborate with teammates across Nike to build more effective and efficient ways to inspire and connect with athletes*.

Specifically, this role will collaborate and partner with the following key internal and external stakeholders to build integrated marketing plans: Digital Marketing, Brand Management, Digital Commerce, Brand Creative, Integrated Media, Energy Marketing, Product & Merchandising, Retail Marketing, Finance & Procurement, Agency & Production partners within India and across SEA&I and APLA.

WHO WE ARE LOOKING FOR

The Lead, Digital Marketing in India is a seasoned digital marketer with a deep understanding of consumers—their lifestyles and online shopping behaviours. This incumbent supports both brand and business objectives, connecting Nike members with innovative experiences and compelling stories that reinforce the company's position as an industry-leading sport and lifestyle brand. Demonstrating teamwork and initiative, the Lead is curious, driven to innovate, and embraces a culture of testing, learning from failure, and evolving strategies. Valuing data and consumer insights, the Lead also appreciates the creative process and understands the importance of marketing technology, O2O (online-to-offline), and digital direct-to-consumer channels. As a thought partner, digital evangelist, and consumer advocate, the Lead is always ready to contribute new ideas.

In this role, the Lead is responsible for driving the digital marketing strategy to transform Nike’s brand into the most sophisticated, athlete-focused digital brand in India. Working as part of the integrated marketing team, the Lead brings best-in-class brand and commerce experiences to life for consumers, supporting an integrated Consumer Marketplace approach.
• Bachelor's degree in Business, Marketing, Communications or related field.
• 7+ years of experience in Digital Marketing or Brand Marketing.
• Passion for sport - whether you’re a seasoned athlete, just starting out or being a fan of it.
• Understanding of the digital and e-commerce landscape, user experience and our digital platforms.
• Experience working with e-commerce Marketplace Platforms, D2C and Brand owned digital commerce platforms.
• Experience with digital brand and paid media strategy and planning.
• Experience working with marketing analytics, deriving actionable insights and applying learnings.
• Ability to drive a culture of always-on testing and learning, including the rapid application of consumer signals into strategy, planning, and content iteration.
• Team player with experience working collaboratively and effectively in a matrix organization.
• Strong organizational and project management skills with proven ability to juggle between the details and big picture, manage multiple and competing projects and priorities.
• Ability to learn and adapt quickly and work in a constantly evolving environment, making judgment calls and shifts as needed.
• Ability to thrive within a fast-paced, high energy, skilled team of marketers that have a passion for sport and culture and creating meaningful connections between consumers and the Nike brand.
• Advocate for India consumers sharing consumer behaviors, insights and digital norms.
• Expert proficiency in Microsoft PowerPoint or Apple Keynote and strong proficiency in Microsoft Excel.
• Excellent verbal and written proficiency in English.

WHAT YOU’LL WORK ON

In this role, you will play a pivotal part in shaping Nike's digital marketing initiatives in India, driving brand engagement, and supporting business growth. You will collaborate with multiple teams to advance Nike’s digital presence, lead impactful campaigns, and act as a key liaison for internal and external partners. Your expertise will help maximize digital marketing effectiveness, elevate the consumer experience, and ensure continuous improvement through data-driven strategies.
• Focus on key projects that enhance consumer experiences, accelerating brand engagement and business opportunities for Nike.
• Act as an integral member of the India Digital Marketing Team, SEA&I Digital Marketing team, India Brand Marketing, and Nike Direct Digital Commerce team.
• Build and drive the Nike India Digital Strategy.
• Lead digital marketing campaigns and oversee daily operations across India's digital ecosystem.
• Develop expertise in the digital and e-commerce landscape in India to maximize marketing reach and engagement.
• Become a subject matter expert on digital marketplace platforms, leveraging them to elevate the consumer brand experience and support member engagement and retention.
• Serve as the brand representative and liaison with both internal and external partners to align on Nike's vision and strategy for each platform.
• Lead the creation of premium, innovative digital experiences, exploring new marketing methods tailored to each platform.
• Strategize and lead seasonal platform plans in partnership with Brand and NDDC, including planning for key moments and product launches.
• Co-develop platform strategies and agreements, including search and brand ads/events.
• Collaborate with and provide brand approvals to third-party agency partners.
• Drive digital marketing performance with accountability to brand and business KPIs.
• Implement digital marketing best practices informed by analytics to enhance efficiency, consistency, and effectiveness.
• Facilitate feedback, communicate successes, and share learnings to support team growth and ongoing improvement.

Note: At Nike, we're committed to providing a fair and transparent application process for all applicants. Nike does not charge candidates any fees for recruitment or applications.

title: Brand Manager- Marketing & Communications
description:
We are seeking a passionate and strategic Brand Manager to lead our marketing and communications initiatives. This role is pivotal in shaping the brand narrative, driving consumer engagement, and delivering high-impact campaigns across multiple channels. The ideal candidate will bring deep expertise in brand management, advertising, and media planning—especially within the retail, luxury, or jewellery sectors.

Key Responsibilities

Brand Strategy & Development
• Define and execute brand positioning, messaging, and identity across all touchpoints.
• Ensure brand consistency across internal and external communications.
• Monitor brand health metrics and implement strategies to enhance brand equity.

Advertising & Media Planning
• Plan and manage ATL campaigns including TV, print, radio, and outdoor media.
• Lead BTL initiatives such as in-store promotions, events, and sponsorships.
• Collaborate with media agencies to optimize media mix and maximize ROI.
• Oversee media planning and buying to ensure cost-effective and impactful placements.

Creative & Digital Campaigns
• Supervise creative development for digital, social media, influencer, and traditional advertising.
• Provide creative direction and feedback to internal teams and external agencies.
• Maintain high standards of visual and verbal brand aesthetics.
• Drive innovation in content creation and storytelling.

Market Intelligence & Insights
• Analyze market trends, customer behavior, and competitor activities to inform strategy.
• Leverage consumer insights to develop targeted campaigns and product positioning.
• Conduct post-campaign analysis to measure effectiveness and refine future initiatives.

Project & Team Management
• Lead cross-functional teams to deliver projects on time and within budget.
• Manage external partners including creative agencies, media planners, and production houses.
• Foster a collaborative and high-performance culture within the marketing team.

Qualifications & Skills
• MBA/PG in Marketing, Advertising, or a related field.
• 6–10 years of experience in brand management or advertising, preferably in retail, luxury, or jewellery sectors.
• Strong knowledge of ATL & BTL advertising, digital marketing, and media planning.
• Excellent creative judgment with a sharp eye for detail and aesthetics.
• Strong project management, leadership, and communication skills.
• Ability to analyze market trends, customer insights, and competitor activities.

Job Types: Full-time, Permanent

Pay: ₹500,000.00 - ₹700,000.00 per year

Work Location: In person

title: Ralph Lauren Brand Management Assistant
description:
Company Description
Ralph Lauren Corporation (NYSE:RL) is a global leader in the design, marketing and distribution of premium lifestyle products in five categories: apparel, accessories, home, fragrances, and hospitality. For more than 50 years, Ralph Lauren's reputation and distinctive image have been consistently developed across an expanding number of products, brands and international markets. The Company's brand names, which include Ralph Lauren, Ralph Lauren Collection, Ralph Lauren Purple Label, Polo Ralph Lauren, Double RL, Lauren Ralph Lauren, Polo Ralph Lauren Children, Chaps, among others, constitute one of the world's most widely recognized families of consumer brands. At Ralph Lauren, we unite and inspire the communities within our company as well as those in which we serve by amplifying voices and perspectives to create a culture of belonging, ensuring inclusion, and fairness for all. We foster a culture of inclusion through: Talent, Education & Communication, Employee Groups and Celebration.

Position Overview
This role is a Fixed Term position supporting the Coordinator with information gathering on Wholesale corners and assisting the corners with their day-to-day needs - while acting as an Ambassador for Ralph Lauren and his brands.

Essential Duties & Responsibilities
• Liaise with Key Accounts, Corner Managers and merchandise coordinators to communicate staffing.
• Maintaining and updating records of both staffing and account contacts.
• Understanding PRL commercial, sales objectives, recording and monitoring sales of corners with vacancies.
• Building relationships to ensure that our Accounts are covering and communicating vacancies with additional staff.
• Build relationship with funded staff members raising any critical issues which need to be escalated to the Retail Manager.
• Assist with PRL and Lauren seasonal training seminar events for funded staff. Helping with the coordination and management during the event and set up.
• Assisting with uniform ordering and roll out and ensuring that the right uniform is ordered and delivered, prioritising key accounts.
• Managing the incentive pay outs and ensuring they are issued in a timely manner.
• Liaise with Key Accounts, Corner Managers and merchandise coordinators to communicate staffing.
• Maintaining and updating records of both staffing and account contacts.
• Understanding PRL commercial, sales objectives, recording and monitoring sales of corners with vacancies.
• Building relationships to ensure that our Accounts are covering and communicating vacancies with additional staff.
• Build relationship with funded staff members raising any critical issues which need to be escalated to the Retail Manager.
• Assist with PRL and Lauren seasonal training seminar events for funded staff. Helping with the coordination and management during the event and set up.
• Assisting with uniform ordering and roll out and ensuring that the right uniform is ordered and delivered, prioritising key accounts.
• Managing the incentive pay outs and ensuring they are issued in a timely manner.

Experience, Skills & Knowledge
• Individual must be a self-starter who can self-manage themselves well under pressure and at times with little direction
• Professional, presentable and pro-active in responses
• Strong communicator
• Presentation skills- both in person and virtually
• Creative flare with attention to detail and highly organised
• Entrepreneurial spirit and approach to work with the ability to adapt and deal with fast paced and changing environments
• Excellent communication & Organisational skills
• Strong computer skills: Excel, Power point and outlook
• Travel may be required

title: Brand Manager Innovation
description:
Great things are happening in the Europe and Australia (EUAU) region. Each day, our 2,500 plus colleagues bring their passion to our offices, manufacturing sites, R&D center, and commercial/distributor markets across Europe, Australia, and New Zealand. We are energized by over 150 years of bringing people together with the food they love. With beloved brands Old El Paso, Häagen-Dazs, Nature Valley, Betty Crocker, Fibre One, Latina Fresh and more, we are on a mission to become the undisputed growth leader in food for EUAU. In a world that’s ever-changing, we look to stay ahead and seek people who share our love of food and are hungry to shape the future.

We have an exciting opportunity for you to shape the future of one of our most beloved brands, Old El Paso, with strategic innovation that drives category growth, delights consumers and advances the agenda in the Mexican Food category.

We are looking for an ambitious marketing innovator to lead this work, someone who can bring passion, grit, agility and disruptive thinking as they work to discover and execute strategic innovation projects. They will develop deep empathy for consumers to understand potential demand spaces, develop strategic ideas to meet those spaces, learn in the real world through experimentation and then ultimately leverage the scale of General Mills to accelerate growth for Old El Paso in our International markets.

You will be part of the Old El Paso brand development team serving the International segment, and partner with the markets to drive innovation strategy, positioning, and growth opportunities for the brands in our key markets across Europe and Australia.

What your role is

In this role, you’ll be at the forefront of shaping our innovation pipeline. You’ll design and validate a bold strategic plan that sets the vision, defines the business model, and prioritises opportunities for long-term growth—constantly refining assumptions as you learn. Being part of a high-performing, cross-functional team, you’ll unite diverse expertise behind ambitious objectives and keep everyone motivated to deliver.

From insight to launch, you’ll bring breakthrough ideas to life across the full marketing mix, ensuring product, price, promotion, and placement come together seamlessly. Agile experimentation will be central to your approach, helping you test and adapt quickly before scaling. Beyond execution, you’ll act as the champion of innovation—selling the vision, generating excitement, and securing buy-in from stakeholders, markets, and retailers to bring new growth opportunities to market.

What you will bring to the team

You’ll bring at least 4 years of experience in the CPG food industry, with practical innovation expertise and a track record of creating, testing, and launching disruptive ideas. You understand how to balance consumer desirability, technical feasibility, and business viability, and you have the curiosity and drive to turn insights into opportunities.

Strong communication and influencing skills will help you gain buy-in across the organisation and with external partners. You thrive in fast-moving environments with the resilience to adapt quickly and the willingness to challenge “business as usual.” Above all, you’re passionate about solving consumer problems, eager to experiment, and unafraid to roll up your sleeves to make innovation happen.

What’s in it for you?

Work with Heart - offers us flexibility that also requires partnership to ensure we regularly come together in person for those moments that help drive our business forward. Our hybrid work policy means an average of 2 days per week in the office with the opportunity to finish at 15:00 on Fridays.

Wellbeing - We want our people to feel well and thrive, for this we offer free Headspace account for you and up to 5 friends or family members, ongoing activities, Employee Assistance Program and more.

Bonus - Our people are at the heart of what makes General Mills great, so when goals are reached, you'll be rewarded through our bonus scheme.

Health & Dental Insurances – All colleagues get the opportunity to join our insurances from day one.

Family & Carers Leave - Every family is unique. Our approach allows every family to have the opportunity to spend quality time-off to support them from the point of birth or adoption to care, with enhanced covers.

Enjoy other perks like enhanced pension contributions, subsidised canteen, access to both peer-to-peer recognition and discount platforms, 2 extra days for volunteering work, and more...

Great Place To Work

title: Assistant Brand Manager Marketing
description:
Title: Assistant Brand Manager

Mission

To support the UK Marketing team across MGA brands, ensuring the marketing function delivers a high level of support to the business and contributes to the growth and success of our brand portfolio.

Key Result Areas & Time Allocation

Key Result Area

Time Utilisation

1. Product Line Management Support

30%

2. Marketing Activation

20%

3. Sales Support

30%

4. Showroom & Trade Shows

10%

5. Ad Hoc Projects

10%

Total

100%

Reporting Line

Reports to: Senior Brand Manager

Position Requirements

Education & Experience
• Degree-level education and/or CIM qualification.
• Minimum 2 years’ experience in a fast-paced business or marketing environment.
• Experience in brand or marketing support roles preferred.

Skills, Knowledge & Abilities
• Strong analytical and problem-solving skills.
• Excellent planning, time management, and organisational skills.
• Flexible and proactive approach to workload and changing priorities.
• Confident relationship builder with strong interpersonal skills.
• Ability to adapt quickly and work effectively under pressure.
• Exceptional written and verbal communication skills.
• Passion for brand management and eagerness to learn.
• Self-motivated team player with the ability to work independently.
• Hands-on attitude with enthusiasm for all tasks, big or small.
• Good understanding of cross-functional collaboration.
• Proficient in PowerPoint, Excel, and Word.
• Working knowledge of Illustrator and InDesign is desirable but not essential.
• Confident using platforms such as Google Docs and Box.
• Committed to adhering to company health & safety policies and procedures.
• Key Responsibilities1. Product Line Management Support (30%)Support the ongoing management and communication of the UK product line, including new product introductions, positioning, and competitive analysis.
• Coordinate product samples for customer selections.
• Collaborate with the US team to manage the product asset library (sales materials, presentations, imagery, manuals, and product specifications).
• 2. Marketing Activation (20%)Support the execution of marketing initiatives as outlined in the Marketing Plan, including PR, social media, experiential, influencer, and partnership campaigns.
• Liaise with external PR agencies to coordinate sample and asset delivery.
• Work with design agencies to adapt assets for UK-specific use (POS, catalogues, digital, and social media).
• Provide administrative and logistical support such as raising purchase orders and managing sample requests.
• 3. Sales Support (30%)Provide continuous brand and product support to the UK Sales Team.
• Supply retailers with accurate and timely product information, including specification forms, copy, images, certificates, and compliance documentation.
• Maintain and upload product information to customer portals as required.
• 4. Showroom & Trade Shows (10%)Assist in maintaining and updating the UK showroom with new graphics, creative assets, and product samples.
• Support the organisation and attendance of trade shows and exhibitions in collaboration with the Sales Team (occasional unsocial hours may be required).
• 5. Ad Hoc Projects (10%)Provide support to the Consumer Handling Agency and other internal teams as needed.
• Undertake additional marketing and brand-related projects as required.
• Why Join Us? As Assistant Brand Manager, you’ll play a key role in shaping the presence of beloved MGA brands in the UK market. This is an exciting opportunity to gain hands-on brand management experience, collaborate with a dynamic global team, and make a tangible impact in a creative, fast-paced environment.

title: Manager - Brand Marketing
description:
We're looking for a Brand Marketing Manager to lead brand marketing initiatives that drive measurable impact and elevate Manulife's brand presence across Canada. Reporting to the Director of Branding, this role owns the planning and execution of priority campaigns - bringing bold ideas to life through seamless cross-functional collaboration.

You'll play a central role in shaping brand narratives-translating strategic direction into integrated campaigns that connect with Canadians and support business objectives. From ideation to delivery, you'll work across Brand, Creative, Digital, Communications, and Segment Marketing teams to ensure Manulife shows up with clarity, consistency, and relevance across every touchpoint.

Position Responsibilities:
• Lead the development and execution of integrated marketing campaigns across Canada, ensuring cohesive storytelling across paid, owned, and earned channels.
• Design and implement omnichannel programs that unify digital, advisor, and experiential channels under a consistent brand vision.
• Own the brand calendar and campaign roadmap, maintaining alignment and visibility across marketing and key stakeholder groups.
• Partner with Brand, Communications, Digital, and Business Marketing teams to deliver campaigns that balance creative excellence with commercial impact.
• Oversee campaign timelines, budgets, and workflows to ensure efficient execution and cross-functional coordination.
• Manage relationships with creative agencies and external partners, driving alignment, quality, and timely delivery of campaign assets.
• Equip business marketing teams with adaptable campaign assets and toolkits that maintain brand integrity while enabling relevance.
• Lead special initiatives that build brand equity, deepen customer engagement, and reinforce Manulife's reputation as a trusted, innovative brand.

Required Qualifications:
• 5-7 years of progressive experience in marketing within financial services, insurance, or consumer-facing industries, with a focus on integrated campaigns.
• Demonstrated ability to lead cross-channel marketing initiatives from strategy through execution.
• Deep understanding of brand strategy, creative development, and campaign planning in complex, matrixed environments.
• Experience managing agency and partner relationships with a focus on alignment, quality, and performance.
• Strategic thinker with strong business acumen - able to connect brand ambition to measurable outcomes.
• Proven ability to lead cross-functional teams and manage multiple priorities in a fast-paced environment.
• Proficiency in digital ecosystems including social media, CRM, and performance marketing.
• Curiosity and openness to AI-powered marketing tools and emerging technologies that enhance personalization and efficiency.

Preferred Qualifications:
• Bilingualism (English and French) is an asset. If the successful candidate is in Quebec, proficiency in both languages will be required to support clients from various provinces outside of Quebec.

When you join our team:
• We'll empower you to learn and grow the career you want.
• We'll recognize and support you in a flexible environment where well-being and inclusion are more than just words.
• As part of our global team, we'll support you in shaping the future you want to see.

#LI-Hybrid

About Manulife and John Hancock

Manulife Financial Corporation is a leading international financial services provider, helping people make their decisions easier and lives better. To learn more about us, visit https://www.manulife.com/en/about/our-story.html.

Manulife is an Equal Opportunity Employer

At Manulife/John Hancock, we embrace our diversity. We strive to attract, develop and retain a workforce that is as diverse as the customers we serve and to foster an inclusive work environment that embraces the strength of cultures and individuals. We are committed to fair recruitment, retention, advancement and compensation, and we administer all of our practices and programs without discrimination on the basis of race, ancestry, place of origin, colour, ethnic origin, citizenship, religion or religious beliefs, creed, sex (including pregnancy and pregnancy-related conditions), sexual orientation, genetic characteristics, veteran status, gender identity, gender expression, age, marital status, family status, disability, or any other ground protected by applicable law.

It is our priority to remove barriers to provide equal access to employment. A Human Resources representative will work with applicants who request a reasonable accommodation during the application process. All information shared during the accommodation request process will be stored and used in a manner that is consistent with applicable laws and Manulife/John Hancock policies. To request a reasonable accommodation in the application process, contact recruitment@manulife.com.

Referenced Salary Location
Toronto, Ontario

Working Arrangement

Hybrid

Salary range is expected to be between
$86,250.00 CAD - $155,250.00 CAD

If you are applying for this role outside of the primary location, please contact recruitment@manulife.com for the salary range for your location. The actual salary will vary depending on local market conditions, geography and relevant job-related factors such as knowledge, skills, qualifications, experience, and education/training. Employees also have the opportunity to participate in incentive programs and earn incentive compensation tied to business and individual performance.

Manulife offers eligible employees a wide array of customizable benefits, including health, dental, mental health, vision, short- and long-term disability, life and AD&D insurance coverage, adoption/surrogacy and wellness benefits, and employee/family assistance plans. We also offer eligible employees various retirement savings plans (including pension and a global share ownership plan with employer matching contributions) and financial education and counseling resources. Our generous paid time off program in Canada includes holidays, vacation, personal, and sick days, and we offer the full range of statutory leaves of absence. If you are applying for this role in the U.S., please contact recruitment@manulife.com for more information about U.S.-specific paid time off provisions.

title: Brand and Product Marketing Manager
description:
Job Title: Brand and Product Marketing Manager

Location(s): Downtown Toronto (presence at the office 5 days a week is preferred, this position requires 20% travel to store locations)

Reporting to: Marketing Director

Brand and Product Marketing Manager

Be the Strategic Marketing Leader to bring UNIQLO to the next level

https://www.uniqlo.com/ca/en/

https://www.fastretailing.com/employment/en/

https://www.fastretailing.com/eng/about/

Are you driven by the power of great brands and exceptional products? Do you thrive on bringing innovative, high-quality apparel to life for a diverse audience? Uniqlo Canada is seeking a visionary and results-oriented Brand Product Marketing Manager to lead our mission of making LifeWear accessible and beloved across Canada. You will own the end-to-end marketing strategy for key product categories and seasonal campaigns, translating our global brand vision into compelling local narratives that resonate deeply with Canadian consumers.

UNIQLO is a global apparel retailer committed to changing the world through the power of clothing. As part of Fast Retailing—one of the world’s largest retail groups—we’re known for LifeWear: high-quality, functional, affordable clothing designed for everyone, everywhere. With more than 2,500 stores worldwide, almost 30 stores in Canada, and strong growth ambitions in the Canadian market, UNIQLO offers a unique opportunity to lead, influence, and grow with a forward-thinking, performance-driven organization.

Position Overview:

This role within the Product Marketing team is responsible for establishing the Uniqlo brand in Canada through communication of our brand values and iconic products. In this role, the individual must collaborate with Global Marketing at our Headquarters in Japan on marketing planning, creative development and local adaptation for specific product categories. They will also be accountable for the creation of the product specific Canada region marketing plan and localized execution. The Marketing Manager will report to the Product Marketing Team Director. They will interface with various teams including Global Marketing, Merchandising, Visual Merchandisers, PR, E-Commerce, Digital Marketing and In-store Marketing.

Key Responsibilities:
• Develop and execute product marketing strategies and plans on an annual/seasonal basis
• Collaborate with Global Marketing to provide input on creative briefs for seasonal product campaign development
• Provide direction and guidance on product shoot list and in-store asset creation
• Lead product/project planning and execution in collaboration with other departments
• Establish understanding of Uniqlo Lifewear with breakthrough communication that elevates the brand and supports the key brand attributes through product marketing communication
• Ensure optimized product marketing communication for the US consumer for all product marketing materials
• Manage agency relationships and conduct briefings for marketing plan development and execution
• Plan and execute in-store and in-market product marketing events
• Conduct business analyses and post marketing campaign reviews
• Support the training and development of junior and new marketing team members
• Other related duties to be assigned by direct supervisor

Who you are:
• Bachelor Degree in Marketing, Business, Communications or related field
• Minimum 5 years’ experience working in the marketing/product marketing and/or communications preferably within retail, fashion, apparel, consumer goods, or a fast-paced agency environment
• Managerial and leadership experience to lead a team
• Experience in working for product marketing/communications
• Proven ability to develop insightful marketing strategies and flawlessly execute integrated campaigns from concept to analysis
• A genuine interest in apparel, design, and innovation. Ability to translate product features into compelling consumer benefits
• Exceptional written and verbal communication skills. Ability to craft clear, persuasive, and on-brand narratives
• Deep empathy for the Canadian consumer and a data-driven approach to understand their needs and behaviors
• Thrives in cross-functional teams and can influence others
• Ability to manage multiple priorities effectively in a fast-growing, global organization

What We Offer:
• The opportunity to lead the brand and product marketing function of a globally respected brand during a key growth phase in Canada
• Play a pivotal role in shaping globall loved brand within the exciting Canadian Market
• A results-driven, entrepreneurial culture where your decisions drive real business impact
• Competitive salary, performance bonus, and comprehensive benefits
• A high-visibility role with collaboration across global and regional executive teams
• Career growth in a company that values ambition, innovation, integrity, and performance

Join Us.
If you’re energized by the challenge of building a global brand locally and have the drive to make LifeWear a staple in every Canadian wardrobe, we want to hear from you!

UNIQLO Canada is an equal opportunity employer. Accommodations are available upon request during the recruitment process.

We sincerely appreciate the interest and enthusiasm of all applicants. While every application is carefully reviewed, only candidates whose qualifications closely match the requirements of the position will be contacted.

ABOUT US

https://www.uniqlo.com/ca/en/spl

Welcome to Uniqlo, where our journey from a single store in Hiroshima to a global brand embodies the essence of Japanese simplicity and innovation. Our founder, Tadashi Yanai, envisioned a company that transcends traditional fashion, focusing instead on creating high-quality, functional clothing that serves the everyday needs of people worldwide. This vision gave birth to our LifeWear concept—apparel that is simple, yet essential; designed to make life better for all.

As you embark on your journey with UNIQLO, know that you are joining a company that never gives up. Every challenge we have faced has made us stronger, smarter, and more determined to push boundaries. We are more than just a fashion brand—we are a global movement driven by sustainability, purpose, discipline, and the belief that great clothing can change lives.

Vision and Culture

At Uniqlo, we embrace the Japanese philosophy of continuous improvement. This principle drives us to constantly refine our products and processes, ensuring that we deliver clothing that offers new and unique value. Our commitment to quality and innovation is evident in our fabric technologies, such as HEATTECH, which provides warmth without bulk, and AIRism, designed to keep you cool and comfortable. These advancements reflect our dedication to enhancing the everyday experiences of our customers.

Our name, UNIQLO, is a blend of 'unique' and 'clothing,' symbolizing our mission to provide distinctive apparel that meets universal needs. We believe in the power of simplicity and strive to create designs that are both timeless and accessible, allowing individuals to express their personal style effortlessly.

We invite you to embrace our core values of simplicity, quality, and continuous improvement. Together, we will continue to innovate and inspire, bringing the best of Japanese craftsmanship and philosophy to wardrobes around the world.

Welcome to the Uniqlo family, where we are united in our pursuit of making everyday life better through exceptional clothing.

[For internal use ONLY] #LI-POST

title: Vice President, Marketing and Brand
description:
Salary:

About UJA Federation of Greater Toronto

At UJA Federation of Greater Toronto, our vision is to lead the most vibrant Jewish community in North America a community characterized by its diversity, unity, compassion, generosity, and commitment to Jewish values. Together with our philanthropic, volunteer, and professional leadership, we are changing lives.

As one of North Americas leading Jewish non-profits, UJA Federation of Greater Toronto works to preserve and strengthen the quality of Jewish life in Greater Toronto, Canada, Israel, and around the world. UJA advances this mission through fundraising, programs, and research focused on our strategic pillars: fighting poverty and improving well-being, growing Jewish education and identity, countering antisemitism and hate, and strengthening connections with Israel and Jewish communities worldwide.

About the Opportunity

We are seeking a seasoned, strategic, and mission-driven Vice President of Marketing and Brand to help guide and elevate our work. UJAs ability to connect, inspire, and mobilize our community has never been more essential.

As Vice President of Marketing and Brand, you will bring deep expertise to a high-impact strategic leadership role. You will provide strategic leadership and oversight across a diverse team, ensuring that UJAs marketing and brand are cohesive, innovative, and aligned with our mission. Reporting to the Senior Vice President, Marketing, Communications & Brand, you will work with an accomplished team to strengthen strategic focus and ensure alignment with UJAs most important goals with a particular emphasis on fundraising marketing to drive philanthropic support.

This role will also play a central part in UJAs brand refresh supporting the transition, leading rollout across all touchpoints, and stewarding the refreshed identity so that it continues to resonate with donors, community members, and stakeholders well into the future.

This is a rare opportunity for an experienced leader to channel their skills toward building the future of Jewish life in Toronto and beyond.

Key Responsibilities

Strategic Marketing & Brand Leadership
• Develop and implement integrated marketing and brand strategies that strengthen UJAs reputation, drive community engagement, and advance fundraising efforts across all donor levels.
• Elevate the teams capacity for strategic thinking, ensuring that execution aligns with UJAs long-term goals and community priorities.
• Lead the development of annual and multi-year marketing and brand plans, aligned to organizational strategy and fundraising revenue goals.
• Play a key role in advancing UJAs brand refresh, ensuring the transition is strategically implemented and embedded across the organization.
• Oversee marketing and brand budgets, ensuring resources are allocated effectively and ROI is maximized.
• Define and track key performance indicators (KPIs), regularly reporting on marketing and brand impact and using data to inform strategy and decision-making.

Fundraising Marketing
• Lead the development and execution of marketing strategies that inspire philanthropic giving across all donor segments from grassroots community donors to major gifts and corporate partnerships.
• Guide and strengthen UJAs direct response marketing capacity, ensuring best practices in email, print, digital, and social fundraising.
• Provide strategic oversight and direction to the direct response function, ensuring campaigns drive measurable fundraising results.
• Partner with the development team to align fundraising marketing with donor cultivation, stewardship, and recognition strategies.
• Ensure fundraising marketing integrates seamlessly with UJAs overall brand narrative, positioning giving as central to UJAs mission.
• Utilize donor data and segmentation to deliver personalized and targeted appeals that maximize donor retention and growth.

Team Management & Development
• Provide leadership and oversight for a multi-disciplinary marketing team, including design, digital, and fundraising marketing functions.
• Coach, mentor, and inspire staff to build leadership skills and foster professional growth, while instilling accountability and excellence.
• Recruit and onboard marketing and brand talent as needed, ensuring the team has the skills and capacity to deliver on strategic priorities.
• Continuously review team structures and workflows, optimizing them as necessary to balance creative execution with strategic oversight.

Brand Oversight
• Partner in the successful implementation and rollout of UJAs brand refresh, ensuring consistency across all channels and audiences.
• Take ownership of brand stewardship going forward, embedding the refreshed identity across campaigns, donor communications, and organizational culture.
• Ensure brand consistency across all touchpoints, while evolving creative approaches to meet the needs of a dynamic and diverse community.
• Position UJA as a leading voice in philanthropy and Jewish community life through brand storytelling and integrated marketing campaigns.
• Ensure all marketing and brand efforts protect and strengthen UJAs reputation, complementing communications/crisis response as needed.

Digital & Data-Driven Marketing
• Oversee digital marketing and brand presence across web, email, paid and organic media, and social platforms, to maximize reach, engagement, and fundraising conversion.
• Use data and analytics to measure performance, optimize campaigns, and inform decision-making.
• Foster a culture of testing, learning, and continuous optimization across all channels.

Campaign & Community Marketing
• Direct the marketing and brand strategy for annual fundraising campaigns and other initiatives, ensuring messaging and tactics inspire giving and community involvement.
• Collaborate closely with planning, fundraising, communications, and program teams to deliver coordinated, compelling campaigns.
• Leverage market research, community insights, and audience segmentation to tailor messaging and outreach to donors and prospects.

Cross-Organizational Collaboration
• Partner with colleagues across UJA to ensure marketing and brand efforts are fully integrated with planning, fundraising, communications, and programming.
• Act as a strategic advisor to senior leadership, bringing marketing and brand expertise to organizational priorities and decision-making.
• Build and manage relationships with agencies, freelancers, and vendors to expand creative and digital capacity when needed.
• Stay current on marketing and brand trends, technologies, and best practices, identifying opportunities to innovate and scale new channels.

Qualifications
• Education: Bachelors degree in Marketing, Communications, Business, or a related field; advanced degree preferred.
• Experience: Minimum of 1215 years of progressive experience in marketing and brand leadership, with at least 5+ years in a senior role overseeing large teams and complex campaigns. Corporate and nonprofit fundraising marketing experience is a plus but not required.
• Leadership Skills: Demonstrated ability to lead, motivate, and develop high-performing teams, balancing day-to-day management with long-term strategy.
• Strategic Thinker: Proven success in building and executing integrated marketing and brand strategies that deliver measurable results.
• Rebrand Experience: Demonstrated success in leading or supporting a brand refresh or rebrand initiative and overseeing rollout and long-term stewardship.
• Creative Oversight: Experience managing design and creative teams, with a strong eye for brand consistency and compelling storytelling.
• Digital Expertise: Deep knowledge of digital marketing strategies, platforms, and analytics; ability to integrate digital with traditional marketing.
• Campaign & Fundraising Marketing: Demonstrated success in developing and overseeing donor-focused marketing campaigns that drive fundraising growth and community engagement.
• Direct Response Marketing: Experience guiding and strengthening a direct response fundraising program, with proven results in donor acquisition, retention, and growth.
• Mission-Driven: Passion for UJAs mission and the Jewish community, with an understanding of the urgency and responsibility of this work in todays environment.
• Organizational Skills: Ability to manage multiple priorities in a fast-paced environment while maintaining high standards of quality and accountability.
• Data-Driven Mindset: Ability to set KPIs, track marketing and brand performance, and report on results to leadership.

This is a full-time permanent position.At UJA we support a flexible workscheduleandall ofour employees engage in hybrid work. Engagement and connection are key to supporting the best employee experience and we want to ensure that this puts balance and well-being at the forefront of our approach to ways of working. In addition to a rich time off policy, UJAs offices are closed on all Jewish holy days (yomtov)and we support early office closures toobservethe Jewish Sabbath (Shabbat).

Qualified applicants are invited tosubmita cover letter and resume.
Only those applicants invited forinterviewwill be contacted.Please be advised that all offers of employment are contingent upon the successful completion of professional references and background checks including Social Media Account(s) and a Police Records Check/Vulnerable Sector Screening.

Commitment to Inclusion and Accessibility:

UJA Federation supportsa diverse candidateand employment experience. We are proud of our dynamic professional team, which reflects the diversity of the Jewish community and general community alike in Greater Toronto. We are an equal opportunity employer and welcome applicants from all communities. We encourage you to follow us to get regular updates on open roles. We are committed to creating an inclusive and accessible workplace and believe this is essential to ensure that every member of our team can thrive.

We adhere to barrier-free and accessible employment practices in compliance with the Accessibility for Ontarians with Disabilities Act (AODA). Should you require Code-protected accommodation through any stage of the recruitment process, pleasenotify usand we will work with you to meet your needs.

description:

title: Manager Corporate Brand Management - Corporate Brand Strategy
description:
The Position

Join our team as a Manager Corporate Brand Management and play a key role in driving the global expansion of our corporate brand. Do you have a deep strategic understanding of brand management and a passion for brand design, are thinking on your feet, and driving change through collaboration? We're excited to invite you to join our team at Boehringer Ingelheim. Your expertise will be key in implementing and operationalizing our corporate brand.

Tasks & responsibilities
• You will provide strategic counsel and guidance to assess and adopt evolving branding needs, ensuring alignment with Boehringer Ingelheim’s Corporate Brand Identity and brand architecture. In this capacity, you will collaborate closely with other functions within Corporate Affairs as well as senior management.
• Your expertise will allow you to actively contribute to the evolution and governance of Boehringer Ingelheim’s Corporate Brand, ensuring it supports current business needs while fostering future growth.
• In addition, you will take an active role in supporting the activation and operationalization of the Corporate Brand Identity. By offering consultancy and building a comprehensive library of brand assets, you will empower the organization to effectively utilize its branding tools.
• A key part of your responsibilities will be to oversee the governance of the Corporate Brand framework and identity. You will monitor and steer its consistent application across all functions, businesses, and geographies to ensure alignment with our global standards.
• Through close collaboration with other teams, you will gather valuable insights and establish feedback loops. These efforts will help inform the organization about the success of its branding activities and enable continuous optimization of the Corporate Brand.

Requirements
• Bachelor’s Degree in Business Administration or Marketing; alternatively Psychology, Humanities, Social Sciences, or other in connection with several years relevant work experience in a matrixed organization (e.g. in an agency or consultancy)
• Strong knowledge of brand identity and management topics, including design system approaches, and a profound understanding of applying design tools and/or software
• Very good knowledge of governance approaches and how to ensure consistency across geographical and functional layers
• Excellent interpersonal and consultancy skills, paired with an innovative and creative mindset with a strong focus on strategic design topics
• Ability to achieve objectives and deliver results within quality, time, and budget constraints
• A collaborator who prefers an inclusive approach
• Natural curiosity and a willingness to learn and adapt
• Strong command of English required and a good command of German preferred

Ready to contact us?

If you have any questions about the job posting or process - please contact our HR Direct Team, Tel: +49 (0) 6132 77-3330 or via mail: hr.de@boehringer-ingelheim.com

Recruitment process:
Step 1: Online application - The job posting is presumably online until November 21th, 2025. We reserve the right to take the posting offline beforehand. Applications up to November 6th, 2025 are guaranteed to be considered.
Step 2: Virtual meeting up to and including the beginning of January 2026
Step 3: On-site interviews are planned for mid-January 2026

title: Director, Global Brand Strategist (m/f/d)
description:
Reporting to the Senior Global Brand Director, the Director, Global Brand Strategist (m/f/d) will be a hands-on strategic thinker, collaborator, and implementor within the Brand Strategy Center of Excellence (COE) as part of the Fresenius Medical Care (FME) Global Communications organization. In this capacity, the Global Brand Strategist will support in delivering top-tier global services to FME's global Business Partners (BP) in the area of Brand Strategy. Additionally, the Global Brand Strategist will help establish and maintain industry-standard global practices in process, planning and stakeholder partnership with their Business Partners. This role will be a key asset to FME and its world class communications team that develops and implements a global company communications strategy supporting FME in achieving their business goals.

The Global Brand Strategist will work closely with the Senior Global Brand Director and manage brand marketing, communications, and strategy for the global Fresenius Medical Care brand. The Senior Global Brand Strategist will help develop, champion, and implement initiatives to ensure the brand remains relevant to core audiences, supports the brand story, and strengthens brand equity across the globe. Initiatives will involve the hardwiring of our global brand narrative into our business operations, providing education and inspiration for employees and driving widespread understanding and adoption of the one global Fresenius Medical Care brand story.

Your assignment:
• Work in close partnership with the Senior Global Brand Director to shape and share the overall global brand strategy including:
• Brand identity, narrative, equity, health, and reputation approach
• Brand governance model
• Manage branding projects in partnership with internal creative resources to deliver best in class results in:
• Brand architecture, naming and portfolio alignment
• Key messaging and positioning, working in concert with Business Partners from business segments and regions
• Visual expression, systems, and related assets for internal and external audiences
• Assist in driving audience insights work (in partnership with analytics team and segment marketing) including patient, customer and partner segmentation work, acquisition and retention strategies and overarching brand building strategies
• Communicate brand objectives and strategies to internal and external partners to inform their work, including market development, creative briefs, etc.
• Collaborate effectively with a global team of internal and external partners for integrated brand campaign development including ideation, insight definition, reasons to believe, customer research and claims development - ensuring a consistent audience experience (patients/physicians/partners) across all marketing touchpoints.
• Serve as a reliable partner to and collaborator with regional peers to ensure the addressing of cultural nuances unique to any given region: North America, EMEA, APAC and LATAM
• Conduct competitive, category, and industry mapping regularly to keep teams on the forefront of the business landscape and to better inform our marketing and innovation

Your profile:
• Bachelors Degree in Management, Marketing, Advertising or comparable
• Minimum 7 years’ experience in marketing, brand, research, brand strategy, and implementation; Agency experience a plus
• Effective oral and written communication skills
• Experience developing insight-collection approaches (qualitative and quantitative) to inform brand strategies and collect learnings from branding efforts
• Strong ability to foster trusting relationships with cross functional teammates, ensuring brand strategy is always well-informed as well as well-communicated across the organization
• Demonstrated interest in transformational storytelling focused on driving brand excellence and culture within the organization
• Has shown curiosity and ability to navigate complex challenges, work with team members to understand these, and to articulate paths forward
• Brings tact, diplomacy and professionalism to each and every interaction
• Values relationship creation and management with people at all levels of the organization
• Strong program and project management skills – coordinating multiple stakeholders and initiatives
• Fluent in English (written and spoken)

title: Brand Manager (Lindor)
description:
Who We Are

At Lindt, we are a global fast-growing consumer goods company, enchanting the world with premium chocolate. We are driven by our passion for excellence and go the extra mile ensuring that every Lindt experience is nothing short of exceptional. Our collective efforts are geared towards making a positive impact, not only in the world of premium chocolate but also in the lives of our employees, customers, and communities. Our company embraces a culture defined by the core values of Excellence, Innovation, Entrepreneurship, Responsibility, and Collaboration, fostering a dynamic and collaborative environment where these principles drive our success.

Position Purpose:

The Brand Manager will take responsibility for leading more Lindor formats. The position will be primarily responsible for leading and developing brand-building strategies and plans for formats and reviewing Price/Pack Architecture. Additionally, the position will leading renovation of our key portfolio, executing projects and initiatives that support both the short and long-term marketing strategy. The Brand Manager is responsible for leading cross-functional teams (locally and internationally) to build and execute product innovation and renovation, and brand initiatives to grow brand relevance, drive profitable market share growth, and build brand equity. This person will take lead in managing vendor and agency partners and all aspects of their projects.

This is a hybrid role in strong collaboration with the cross functional team based in Stratham, NH. Three days per week are required in our Stratham, NH corporate office / or Boston, MA.
Essential Job Functions & Responsibilities:

Marketing Strategy
• Develop, present, and execute consumer-relevant, annual marketing plans for LINDOR formats with clear measures for success that contribute to sales, profit and brand health objectives.
• Lead core cross-functional team focused on optimizing the price/pack architecture and competitiveness of our key portfolio.
• Develop and oversee new product development for LINDOR formats.
• Develop and execute full 360-degree marketing campaigns across digital, social, media, shopper, and in-store touchpoints.
• Leverage working knowledge of consumer, category and brand and continually identify, develop, and execute business-building initiatives which deliver against the global brand strategy, and the company's business and marketing objectives.

Research & Analytics
• Lead or conduct routine analysis of the brand, key initiative, competition, category, customer and consumer. Synthesize key findings and indications which enhance brand and company performance.
• Lead and assist with insight gathering research that collects consumer and competitive knowledge that can be utilized to enhance and evolve the brand's recipe development, promotional acceptance and communication evolution, among others.
• Thoroughly understand internal brand metrics, such as sales and profit, and actively contribute to sales projections and financial planning to drive the brand.

Brand/Customer Support
• Develop and execute marketing communication plans via advertising and consumer promotions, including media recommendations, social media, PR, and consumer activations.
• Communicate regularly with the Sales Strategy Team and Directors, Field Sales Force, and Customer Marketing to ensure that marketing programs are properly implemented.
• Proactively communicate and collaborate with Field Sales to ensure meaningful integration and alignment in meeting the needs of the customer and marketplace.
• Attend sales calls and actively participate in selling at the customer level

Qualifications & Requirements:

Skills & Knowledge:
• Marketing experience within a FMCPG
• Experience in new product development
• Previous experience with full P&L responsibility, a plus
• Experience working in an international corporate environment, a plus
• Research experience - consumer panels & Qualitative / Quantitative research methods

Education:
• Bachelor's degree required
• MBA preferred

Other Requirements:
• Ability to travel up to 10%

Total Rewards:

Compensation Range: $106,000.00 - 138,000.00

To learn more about our benefits visit https://jobs.lindtusa.com/total-rewards

Lindt USA’s salary range reflects market rates based on our size, revenue, and location. Starting pay is determined using a wide range of factors including, but not limited to, job-related skills, knowledge, and experience as well as market conditions. A bonus and/or long-term incentive may be included as part of this compensation package.

Lindt and Sprüngli is an equal opportunity employer and considers all qualified applicants for employment without regard to race, color, national origin, religion, sex, disability, age, veteran status, or any other classification protected by state, local or federal law. Applicants for this position must successfully pass a background screening and may be required to pass drug screenings as well.

If you are looking to join a winning team and fast-track your career, contact us!

Join us on our journey of excellence, impact, and growth #LifeAtLindt

title: Director of Brand Marketing
description:
Master Trades Group | Hybrid – Columbia, MD HQ (as needed)

Compensation: $125,000–$135,000 base + 20% bonus opportunity

Classification: Full-Time | Exempt

Reports To: Chief Marketing Officer

Join a Fast-Growing Home Services Platform

Master Trades Group is a private-equity-backed residential services platform operating 12+ trusted local Plumbing, HVAC, and Electrical brands across multiple states. Our brands share one mission: to deliver same-day, expert service rooted in trust, professionalism, and community reputation.

We are seeking a Director of Brand Marketing to architect, scale, and elevate our brand strategy across the platform. This is a hands-on leadership role for a strategic builder who can think big and execute locally—driving brand differentiation, creative excellence, and measurable business outcomes.

What You’ll Do

Brand Positioning & Architecture
• Define and maintain a unified brand architecture and clear value proposition across all markets.
• Develop differentiated brand positioning and messaging frameworks that cut through industry sameness.
• Build and execute annual brand plans aligned with data-driven revenue and value-creation goals.

Local Market Connectivity
• Translate platform strategy into breakthrough, localized execution that builds connection and relevance.
• Coach Branch Managers and local teams to deliver consistent, high-quality brand representation.
• Ensure all brands show up authentically in their communities while benefiting from shared creative systems.

Media & Investment Strategy
• Oversee brand media planning and spend across broadcast, OTT, radio, outdoor, social, and experiential channels.
• Partner with agencies to deploy media mix modeling (MMM) and testing frameworks that improve ROMI.
• Ensure brand investments drive measurable outcomes—share of voice, branded search, inbound volume, and awareness lift.

Creative Excellence & Content
• Lead creative direction that builds emotional connection, communicates value, and earns trust.
• Develop scalable creative systems and asset libraries for use across all operating brands.
• Manage internal and external creative partners with urgency, clarity, and focus on quality.

Cross-Functional Leadership
• Collaborate closely with performance marketing, CRM, call center operations, and local market leaders.
• Support employer branding and recruitment marketing to attract high-quality field talent.
• Represent brand strategy in strategic planning sessions, leadership presentations, and quarterly reviews.

What Success Looks Like
• Stronger local brand visibility and trust across all markets
• Increased branded search and direct call volume
• Reduced reliance on high-cost lead channels
• Improved CAC, ROMI, and LTV
• Enhanced brand preference and customer loyalty

What You Bring
• 8–12+ years in brand leadership roles (multi-location, franchise, or local service category preferred).
• Proven ability to build and deploy brand systems across diverse markets.
• Experience with MMM, brand tracking, media planning, and creative development.
• Strong analytical mindset tied to CAC, LTV, and EBITDA impact.
• Excellent communication and influence skills across C-suite, GMs, agencies, and field teams.
• Bachelor’s degree required; MBA or advanced marketing training preferred.

You’ll Be a Great Fit If You…
• Excel at differentiating brands in saturated, commoditized markets.
• Operate with speed, precision, and accountability in a private-equity environment.
• Balance creative storytelling with data-driven decision-making.
• Thrive in a hands-on role building scalable brand infrastructure from the ground up.

Comprehensive Benefits: Medical, dental, vision, 401(k) match, PTO, paid holidays, company-paid life, disability, EAP.

EOE

title: Marketing Brand Manager + Sports Industry + Omaha
description:
What started as a small mission to protect athletes has evolved into a nationally recognized sports brand — now featured in major retailers and trusted by athletes across the country.

With a growing team, this company continues to expand its footprint in the sports world with attitude, energy, and innovation. We’re looking for a Marketing Brand Manager (1099 independent contractor) who’s ready to match that pace.

The Role:

This isn’t a sit-behind-the-desk marketing job — it’s hands-on, creative, and full of energy. You’ll be at the center of a brand that thrives on momentum, managing everything from social media strategy to high-profile relationships with athletes, partners, and vendors.

As a 1099 contractor, you’ll deliver results while working closely with the leadership team to maintain brand consistency and deliver on key initiatives. You’ll create content that connects, campaigns that convert, and moments that capture attention. If you love the challenge of constant movement and bold ideas, this is where you belong.

Key Responsibilities:
• Own and execute the social media content calendar, bringing creative ideas to life.
• Edit and produce videos and digital content that tell compelling brand stories.
• Manage client and vendor relationships, representing the brand with professionalism and personality.
• Lead creative campaigns across social, digital, and live events.
• Bring energy, humor, and a team-first attitude to every project.
• Adapt quickly and thrive in a fast-moving, ever-changing environment.

Qualifications:
• 3+ years of experience in marketing, brand management, or digital content creation (sports or lifestyle brand experience preferred).
• Skilled in graphic design, video editing, and digital marketing tools.
• Strong writing, storytelling, and social media strategy experience.
• Creative mindset with a balance of strategy and execution.
• Excellent relationship-building and communication skills.
• Reliable, self-motivated, and energized by collaboration.

Schedule & Travel:
• Up to 50% travel — November–April (about 1 week per month) and Memorial Day–Labor Day (about 2 weeks per month).
• Flexible scheduling typical of an independent contractor arrangement (core collaboration hours: Monday–Friday, 8:30 AM–5 PM).

What You’ll Gain:
• Collaborate with a fast-growing, high-energy sports brand with national visibility.
• Work directly with athletes, creators, and partners across the industry.
• Attend live events and brand activations nationwide.
• Be part of a collaborative, creative environment with room to make an impact.
• Discounts on products designed for athletes, by athletes.

For confidential consideration, please complete our Lutz application for this role listed on our website: www.lutz.us/current-opportunities. You can also send your resume to Jana Mustard at jmustard@lutz.us. We understand that confidentiality is extremely important, and your resume will NOT be forwarded to our client without your permission.

title: Sr. Brand Marketing Manager for US Market
description:
Why Birdman Birdman is one of Latin America’s fastest-growing consumer brands — and the
market leader in plant-based performance nutrition and wellness in Mexico.
We’ve built one of the most admired wellness brands in our home market through
innovation, authenticity, and sustainability , and now we’re taking flight globally.
Our vision is to become a
global wellness leader , expanding into multiple countries. The
United States
is our next and most ambitious challenge — the largest, most competitive, and opportunity-rich wellness market in the world. This next chapter is about
building a global wellness powerhouse rooted in purpose, performance, and cultural relevance.
Role Overview This is a
once-in-a-lifetime opportunity
to
own Birdman’s brand strategy and execution in the U.S.
and to
build a leading health & wellness brand from the ground up.
As
U.S. Brand Marketing Manager , you will take full ownership of
brand strategy, positioning, P&L, innovation, experiential marketing, PR, partnerships, and consumer insights —crafting how Birdman shows up across retail, digital, and culture.
You’ll report directly to the
U.S. Commercial & Marketing Director , with a dotted line to the
Marketing Director in Mexico
for global brand alignment. You will
leverage the strong foundation, creative resources, and capabilities from our HQ team in Mexico , while operating with
full autonomy
to hire
U.S.-based agencies and partners
or build a
small, high-performing local team
over time.
Important disclaimer:
Birdman is a hypergrowth company. The pace is fast, the expectations are high, and ambiguity is constant. This isn’t a corporate marketing role—it’s a
builder’s role.
We’re looking for a
strategic and resourceful brand builder : someone creative, analytical, and resilient who thrives in ambiguity, can make things happen with limited resources, and knows how to turn vision into execution.
For the right person, the upside is unmatched:
massive personal growth, high visibility, and the chance to build a global wellness brand’s success story in the U.S. from scratch.
The Ideal Candidate You are a
hybrid marketer —a brand builder with cultural instinct and creative vision, combined with the rigor of a data- and performance-driven operator.
You deeply understand the
U.S. consumer and retail landscape , ideally from having
lived and worked in the market.
You’ve built or scaled brands that have won across retail, social, and experiential channels.
You thrive in high-growth, ambiguous environments—turning limited resources into world-class execution. You’re entrepreneurial, proactive, and solutions-oriented, with a bias for action and accountability.
You can
balance big-picture strategy with hands-on execution , inspire agencies and partners to deliver at Birdman’s level of ambition, and bring a
founder’s mindset
to building something new.
Above all, you bring
resilience, curiosity, and an unstoppable drive
to make Birdman one of the next great global wellness brands—starting with the U.S.
Key Responsibilities
Brand Strategy & Growth
Define and own Birdman’s
brand strategy, positioning, and architecture
for the U.S., ensuring cultural relevance, differentiation, and global consistency.
Manage
brand P&L and budgets , balancing investment efficiency with ROI and growth targets.
Lead the
U.S. product innovation and go-to-market roadmap , adapting global launches and shaping future pipeline needs.
Partner with HQ to ensure brand identity, messaging, and creative assets reflect Birdman’s global purpose while resonating locally.
Marketing & Activation
Lead
experiential marketing, PR, influencer, and co-branding partnerships
that elevate awareness, engagement, and brand love.
Identify and activate
strategic collaborations
with retailers and lifestyle/wellness brands that amplify reach and cultural relevance.
Drive
local campaign execution
across retail, social, and digital, partnering with Performance Marketing and Social teams to ensure a seamless brand-to-conversion flow.
Build, brief, and manage
U.S.-based agencies and partners , ensuring creative excellence and accountability to metrics.
Insights & Performance
Leverage
consumer and market insights
(Nielsen, IRI, SPINS, Ipsos, brand tracking, digital analytics) to drive brand, pricing, and innovation decisions.
Track
brand performance KPIs
(awareness, sell‑out, equity, conversion, ROI) and present clear business readouts with learnings and next steps.
Monitor
competitive and cultural trends
to identify white spaces, category shifts, and innovation opportunities.
Cross‑Functional Leadership
Collaborate closely with
Sales, Trade, Ecommerce, Performance Marketing, and HQ
to deliver an integrated growth strategy.
Represent the
voice of the U.S. consumer
across the organization, influencing innovation, communication, and commercial priorities.
Build and mentor a
small, high‑performing U.S. brand/experiential team
over time.
Must‑Have Requirements
Proven experience
defining and executing brand strategy
in the U.S., ideally with regional or global exposure.
Experience in top‑tier CPG, food & beverage, wellness, or lifestyle brands , bringing best practices and strategic discipline.
Deep understanding of the U.S. consumer, retail, and cultural landscape , ideally from having
lived or worked in the U.S. for at least 1 year.
Track record of measurable brand growth —awareness, share, equity, or revenue—and strong P&L management.
Experience in
product innovation and category expansion
from strategy to launch.
Strong experience leading
agencies, partnerships, and cross‑functional teams
in dynamic, matrixed environments.
Builder mindset:
resourceful, proactive, and comfortable operating in ambiguity and limited‑resource contexts.
Data‑and insight‑driven decision‑making , with fluency in market analytics (Nielsen, IRI, SPINS, Ipsos, etc.).
Fluency in English (C1–C2)
required;
Spanish
is a plus.
Location:
Ideally based in
Mexico
(Guadalajara or CDMX preferred), with
occasional travel to the U.S.
for market visits, activations, and partner management. Candidates based in the
U.S.
are also welcome, with
periodic travel to Guadalajara HQ
for alignment with the leadership and creative teams.
Nice‑to‑Have Requirements
Experience leading or supporting
brands expanding from LATAM to the U.S.
or vice versa.
Background in
fast‑paced, high‑growth companies
where ownership and adaptability are critical.
Proven experience in
influencer, social, and experiential marketing
within wellness or lifestyle categories.
Prior exposure to
co‑branding, retail collaborations, or partnership marketing.
The Company:
Birdman is on a roll! We're a fast-growing plant-based food company, dedicated to making healthier, sustainable, and cruelty‑free food choices a breeze. With our mouthwatering and nourishing plant‑based products, we're winning over the hearts (and taste buds) of customers everywhere. Get ready, because the global plant-based revolution is just getting started and it's going to be epic! We're on the lookout for the absolute best talent to help us fulfill our promise, expand our reach, and have a massive impact on the planet and people's lives. Join us and let's create some plant-powered magic together!
