title: Retail Operations Area/ Cluster Manager
description:
Who We Are Looking For?

As the Retail Operations Area/ Cluster Manager, he/she will lead and manage a group of store manager to deliver area business plan and KPIs within budget. To be accountable for overseeing the individual store activities are effectively carried out. Assist in achieving financial and operational goals of the business. Coach and supervisor a team of Store Managers to deliver excellent retail experience for our customers in order to achieve sales and other retail targets.

What Awaits You:
• Support to stores on delivering KPIs on Sales, profitability and service standard
• Lead and motivate a team of Store In Charge to achieve business objectives, operations excellence in Store & Service standards
• Analyse reports and trends, to engaged internal functions to identify opportunities and roll out plans
• To assess store environments and workflow in order to put up practical proposals for business improvement
• To comply with company procedures at all times in order to protect valuable assets including its people and to achieve company KPIs
• Review store surrounding retail environments to identify areas for improvement opportunities
• Responsible in identifying potentials candidates among the store teams and groom them as part of succession planning
• Be exemplary role model to the team members in work ethics and sales driven with a flair for creativity

We Are Excited About You If You Have:
• Diploma holder with a passion for retail management
• At least 3 years of operational experience in a similar capacity
• Knowledge of Retail/ Health&Beauty related industry
• Possess Strong leadership qualities
• Confident & self-driven
• Strong integrity and professionalism
• Results orientated, resourceful, and willing to be “hands-on” when required
• With good analytical skills & commercial sense
• Meticulous and committed
• Strong level of judgement
• Good communication (spoken and written), interpersonal and people management skills
• Coaching and supervisory skills
• Planning skills
• Digitally Inclined

Why Should You Join Watsons?

Watsons is Singapore’s leading beauty and health retailer with more than 100 stores located islandwide. We inspire and enable every one of our customers to Look Good, Do Good, Feel Great every day.

We are building a culture that you will be proud to be part of. We foster an open culture of communication and innovation, readying the company to be agile for changes in the new retail age.

Why You Will Love Working Here:
• Fun and collaborative culture in a fast-paced environment with passionate and committed team members make up the Watsons Family!
• Flexible workspace with activity-based working concept that stimulates creativity, collaboration, and communication in a vibrant environment
• Equip our people with the right skills so that they can thrive and stay Fit for the Future.
• Good career growth opportunities and ongoing learning and development
• A competitive compensation package including a wide range of benefits and employee perks
• Privilege staff discount and Watsons membership points and vouchers

Are you ready to make an impact with us? Come join us for a great experience that will prepare you for even bigger challenges!

title: Head of Retail - Luxury Maison
description:
• Lead a dual-market retail network across SG & MY.
• Shape commercial strategy, grow client loyalty, and lead retail talent.
• Luxury maison committed to excellence, transformation, and timeless service.

Our client is a globally recognised luxury maison celebrated for its heritage, craftsmanship, and commitment to timeless excellence. As part of its continued investment in Southeast Asia, the brand is seeking a Head of Retail to lead its boutique network across Singapore and Malaysia.

This is a a pivotal senior management role that combines leadership, transformation, and client excellence.

What You Will Do
• Lead the overall retail strategy and performance across Singapore and Malaysia.
• Coach Boutique Managers and retail teams to deliver on sales, service, and client development objectives.
• Partner with senior leadership to define commercial plans and drive operational excellence.
• Oversee clienteling initiatives to strengthen VIC engagement and repeat purchase behaviour.
• Champion people development, succession planning, and retail capability building.
• Drive key transformation projects including store openings, renovations, and retail systems rollout.

The Ideal Profile

You should possess at least 12–18 years’ luxury retail experience with proven multi-store and cross-market leadership. You should have strong foundations in boutique operations paired with strategic and commercial acumen. Deep understanding of client development and service excellence in a luxury environment is also crucial. Prior experience in watches, jewelry, or fashion & leather goods maisons would be advantageous.

To Apply

Please write in with an updated CV to timothy@greytree.co / marcus@greytree.co stating the above job title. We look forward to hearing from you soon!

title: Retail Manager - Jacquemus, Middle East
description:
INSPIRE | EXHILARATE | DELIGHT

For over seven decades, Chalhoub Group has been a partner and creator of luxury experiences in the Middle East. In its pursuit to excel as a hybrid luxury retailer, the Group has curated a portfolio of over 10 owned brands and strengthened its distribution and marketing expertise for over 400 international names across luxury fashion, beauty, jewellery, watches, eyewear, and art de vivre categories.

 Every step at Chalhoub Group is taken to build a future where luxury dreams become reality — bridging cultures and crafting memorable experiences for our consumers. Be it by constantly reinventing itself, committing to innovation, or embracing new technologies, the Group is shaping the future of luxury retail. It delivers seamless omnichannel experiences across more than 950 stores, online platforms, and mobile apps. Driving this innovation journey is The Greenhouse — the Group’s innovation hub, incubator, and accelerator for startups and emerging businesses, regionally and globally.

Chalhoub Group fosters a people-at-heart culture rooted in diversity, equity, and inclusion, and a workplace catalysed by forward thinking and future-proofing. Today, it brings together over 16,000 talented professionals across eight countries in the Middle East, with a presence in LATAM. Their collective efforts have earned the Group the Great Place to Work® certification in several markets.

Sustainability is at the core of the Group’s strategy, guided by a clear commitment to people, partners, and the planet. Chalhoub Group is proud to be a member of the United Nations Global Compact, a signatory of the Women’s Empowerment Principles, and to have pledged to reach Net Zero by 2040.

What you'll be doing

Our Retail Manager is responsible for ensuring that Store Managers maximize the commercial performance of their retail shops and deliver exceptional Guest Experience. Our Retail Manager is also responsible for establishing a bridge between back-office and their network of stores which they control/audit on a continuous basis and implement corrective solutions and actions.
Key Responsibilities
• Understand the brand strategy and cascade within the given network
• In conjunction with Marketing, ensure the full implementation of the of marketing and CX strategies and programs
• Implement Brand guidelines taking in consideration each market specifications
• Agree on a yearly calendar of sales with commercial team
• Control discount and margins to insure constant business profitability
• Follow up periodically on the sales figures per line and stock at hand (Sell-Out)
• Manage potential shortages, review orders and inform merchandising team on the status
• Record, monitor and analyze market trends, competitors activities
• Provide commercial with quantitative and qualitative reports using data from market studies and inhouse systems
• Define sales target per sales team member
• Manage the P&L for the brand at hand
• Monitor the performance of the brand and send recommendation
• Manage the organization's resources within budget guidelines
• Provide prompt, thorough, and accurate information to keep management appropriately informed of the brands financial position
• Develop and motivate team members to ensure transfer of know-how and continuous positive work environment
• Monitor team members performance and provide formal and informal feedback and appraisal in order to maximize efficiency

What you’ll need to succeed
• Experience in Leading a Flagship Retail store or Multiple Retail stores, within Luxury Fashion.
• Currently based in the UAE or GCC
• UAE driving license would be an added benefit for this role
• Ability and Flexibility to travel across the GCC (UAE, Kuwait & KSA)

What we can offer you

With us, you will turn your aspirations into reality. We will help shape your journey through enriching experiences, learning and development opportunities and exposure to different assignments within your role or through internal mobility. Our Group offers diverse career paths for those who are extraordinary, every day.

We recognise the value that you bring, and we strive to provide a competitive benefits package which includes health care, child education contribution, remote and flexible working policies as well as exclusive employee discounts.

We Invite All Applicants to Apply

It Takes Diversity Of Thought, Culture, Background, Differing Abilities and Perspectives to truly Inspire, Exhilarate and Delight our customers. At Chalhoub Group, we are committed to inclusion and diversity.

We welcome all applicants to apply and be part of our exciting future. We ensure equal opportunity for all our applicants without regard to gender, age, race, religion, national origin or disability status.

title: Retail Store Manager
description:
Booktopia is seeking an experienced Retail Sales Manager to lead our children’s bookstore located in a major shopping mall. The ideal candidate has strong mall retail experience, excellent sales and team leadership skills, and a genuine passion for children’s books and education.

title: PR & Communications Lead
description:
About ElevenLabs

ElevenLabs is a research and product company defining the frontier of audio AI. Millions of people use our technology to read articles, voice over videos, and restore voices lost to disability. Leading developers and enterprises worldwide use ElevenLabs to build intelligent agents for support, sales, and education.

We launched in January 2023 with the first AI model to cross the threshold of human-like speech. In January 2025, we raised a $180 million Series C round, valuing the company at $3.3 billion. By September 2025, that valuation doubled to $6.6 billion as we surpassed $200 million ARR in under three years.

Our mission is to build the most important audio AI platform in the world, solve AI audio intelligence, and make information accessible in any voice, language, or sound.

Our core offerings are our Creative Platform and the Agents Platform, powered by proprietary Text to Speech, Speech to Text, and conversational AI models.

We are just getting started. If you want to work hard and create lasting impact, we would like to hear from you.

How we work
• High-velocity: Rapid experimentation, lean autonomous teams, and minimal bureaucracy.
• Impact not job titles: We don’t have job titles. Instead, it’s about the impact you have. No task is above or beneath you.
• AI first: We use AI to move faster with higher-quality results. We do this across the whole company—from engineering to growth to operations.
• Excellence everywhere: Everything we do should match the quality of our AI models.
• Global team: We prioritize your talent, not your location.

What we offer
• Innovative culture: You’ll be part of a generational opportunity to define the trajectory of AI, surrounded by a team pushing the boundaries of what’s possible.
• Growth paths: Joining ElevenLabs means joining a dynamic team with countless opportunities to drive impact - beyond your immediate role and responsibilities.
• Learning & development: ElevenLabs proactively supports professional development through an annual discretionary stipend.
• Social travel: We also provide an annual discretionary stipend to meet up with colleagues each year, however you choose.
• Annual company offsite: Each year, we bring the entire team together in a new location - past offsites have included Croatia and Italy.
• Co-working: If you’re not located near one of our main hubs, we offer a monthly co-working stipend.

About the Role

We are seeking a communications & public relations professional to help package the incredible work that is happening across the company into a set of compelling narratives that resonate with our customers and community. This will be a challenging, fast paced role that has you at the center of all of the amazing partnerships and product research coming out of the company.

You'll partner closely with growth, engineering, research, and our leadership team to deliver world-class content. Specifically, you will:
• Own and execute global product and technology communications strategies that drive the business forward and reinforce the company’s reputation as the category leader
• Be a trusted advisor to executive leadership and key cross-functional partners, including product, growth, partnerships, and policy teams
• Manage company news and announcements across earned and owned channels – leverage media relationships to secure coverage across top technology and business publications and drive strategy and brand consistency across company socials and blog
• Proactively secure and help prioritize inbound media and speaking engagement requests
• Build the bench of executive thought leaders across the company; develop exec comms plans, seed them with content ideas for their socials, and prep ahead of speaking events

Requirements
• This is a high autonomy, high impact, and high growth role. The ideal candidate must have a passion for technology, AI Audio, and voice-first interfaces. Additionally, we are looking for someone with:
• Comms/marketing experience at a high growth SAAS/AI company preferred
• Exceptional written, oral, interpersonal, and presentation skills
• Can understand and speak to both highly technical developer audiences and non-technical enterprise and creator audiences
• Has strong attention to detail and sweats the small stuff when it comes to content
• Has strong relationships with prominent tech and business outlets while also being adept at navigating and securing coverage across emerging channels such as podcasts, newsletters, or others that may be better suited for reaching our target audiences
• Strong track record of building communications programs 0-1, thinking creatively, and driving business and product narratives forward
• Excitement to operate as a player/coach; you’ll be building the Eleven Labs brand as part of a small, nimble teamLikely spends a good portion of their day reading tech news across platforms

Location

This role is remote and can be executed globally. However, to facilitate working with the growth team, we prefer candidates based in GMT-4 to GMT+3.

#LI-Remote

title: Public Relations Account Manager
description:
Senior Account Manager / Account Director

We’re looking for a leader who is ready to be a part of something special. We’ve already proven our credentials as an agency, delivering outstanding work for a wide range of clients, from listed businesses to social enterprises. And one thing you’ll notice about our work is that whoever we’re delivering for, they can expect the same levels of dedication and care.

You’ll be a true partner in the ambitions of the agency, growing with us and being rewarded accordingly. You’ll help the business owner shape how the agency looks, feels and functions. This role will be a truly empowering experience, giving you the scope to play a leading role.

We’re still relatively young as a business – we’re looking for somebody with high levels of enthusiasm, and a strong sense of entrepreneurialism. We want someone who recognises and celebrates our strong start, and can help us to capitalise on the massive opportunities that are in our near future.

This isn’t a typical agency role. It’s something that will be hugely rewarding for the right candidate, with the ability to help shape your own destiny within the business as a senior leader.

You will be heard – your opinion matters to us. In fact, having an opinion and expressing it is a must-have for the successful applicant.

We’ll always recruit based on attitude and ability, rather than on the strength of a CV, but we’d really appreciate candidates to have drive and creativity (we don’t want someone who will just turn up and follow instructions) and to show an interest – whether that’s in culture, politics or sport, we want you to demonstrate a passion. What we’re looking for is a future leader.

What you’ll need:

• Strong PR experience, preferably working on multiple accounts at an agency with B2B credentials

• The ability to write, analyse and present – we’re a true team where we all pitch-in when required

• Line-management experience

• Creativity to deliver results for our clients

• Strong presentational/new business skills, giving our clients ultimate confidence in our service

What you'll do:

• You’ll help shape the growth of the agency from day one.

• You’ll be a key point of contact for a variety of clients, ensuring the delivery of great work.

• You’ll be given key accountabilities for helping to grow the business, as well as displaying our values.

• You’ll report in to the business owner, sharing new business ideas and insights in an energetic and well thought through manner.

title: Communications & Public Relations Manager
description:
The Communications & Public Relations Manager at One Carbon World in Edinburgh will develop and implement communication strategies to enhance brand visibility and support climate action. Responsibilities include creating engaging content, managing public events, ensuring consistent messaging, and handling crisis communication. The role promotes inclusion and flexible working opportunities, with a focus on sustainability and climate change.
Location: Hybrid

Benefits: Hybrid scheme | Company pension | Competitive salary

Reports to: VP and Head of Communications

Are you looking to use your communication skills to make a real difference in climate voluntary action, mitigation and adaptation? We have an exciting opportunity for a new Communications Manager to join the One Carbon World team.

About OCW

One Carbon World is a climate-positive, not-for-profit organisation, and an official observer organisation of the United Nations Framework Convention on Climate Change (UNFCCC). We are also a proud member of the UN Global Compact Network UK.

We are registered in the UK and have operations in over 55 countries, offering advice and support on measuring, reducing, and rebalancing the emissions of small and large organisations. One Carbon World supports the transition to net zero, creating the conditions for organisations to cut their greenhouse gas emissions to as close to zero as possible. We are world leaders in verified carbon removal projects and nature-based solutions and have been internationally recognised for our steadfast commitment to addressing the challenges of climate change through practical and impactful solutions. We were awarded the Climate Positive Award by the Green Cross UK for our innovation and net-zero commitment and were recognised by the European Commission as Key Innovators in carbon removals.

One Carbon World is an inclusive and diversity-friendly employer. We value difference, promote equality and work against discrimination—this not only enhances our organisational capability but also matches our core organisational values of integrity, responsibility, kindness, and supportiveness. We welcome and encourage applications from people of all backgrounds and support flexible working opportunities.

If you are passionate about climate change, climate action, and sustainability and have the skills required, we invite you to apply for this position!

The role
• To create and execute innovative public relations and brand communication strategies to enhance our brand visibility and reputation.
• To support our mission through creating and issuing engaging content across all media types including our social platforms. With a focus on educating the public, engaging in climate debates; building our reputation; and increasing engagement and interaction by others.
• To create and deliver, or support our participation in, public-facing events (podcasts, talks, UN events, webinars, etc.) to educate others on climate change, whilst raising brand awareness and building networks.
• To ensure consistent messaging across all communication channels by creating templates and key messages for use by all.
• To manage communication during crises or sensitive situations, ensuring our message is consistent, timely, and professional.
• To create and deliver internal messaging to continue to upskill and motivate staff, aligned with overall company goals.
• To report and review activities, to continually improve.

You will be keen to work flexibly as part of our team, modelling our values, mission, and vision in your work at all times. You will support and promote inclusion, diversity and equality of opportunity in the workplace; and treat with confidentiality any private or sensitive information about our clients and partners, staff, and projects.

The Candidate

The ideal candidate will be organised and resourceful. They must be able to manage multiple priorities and present a professional image to stakeholders. The candidate should exercise good judgment, maintain confidentiality when required, collaborate well with others, and communicate clearly and effectively.

You will have a Bachelor’s degree in Communications, Marketing, Public Relations, Environmental Sciences and Sustainability, Sustainable Development, or a related field (Master’s degree preferred).

We acknowledge that skills and experience can be acquired in many ways, including professional careers, and lived experiences. We encourage applications that fulfill the person specification through any of these paths. You will be demonstrably competent in:
• Creating a range of public-facing innovative content for a brand or organisation with a focus on sustainability.
• Brand building or PR, with a focus on raising awareness on sustainability.
• Project management and core business IT skills
• Working with high-profile clients; and as a supportive/flexible team player.
• Working at a fast-pace whilst consistently meeting deadlines
• Using strong creative and critical analytical skills, grasping quickly new concepts and embracing new ideas.
• Deploying excellent spoken and written communication skills, with impressive attention to detail.
• Demonstrating a high standard of professional behaviours, from collaboration to integrity.

Additional, desirable skills:
• Working on, or good knowledge of, the climate change agenda and the issues and organisations involved
• Using email marketing or social media management tools (e.g. Hootsuite, HubSpot).
• Creating and optimising paid ads across social media.
• Working for an international or not-for-profit organisation.

Job Type: Full-time

Pay: £30,000.00-£33,000.00 per year

Benefits:
• Company pension

Schedule:
• Monday to Friday

Application question(s):
• Can you describe a time when you developed or contributed to a communications or public relations campaign related to climate change or sustainability? What was your approach, and how did you ensure the messaging was both accurate and engaging for your audience?

Work authorisation:
• United Kingdom (required)

Work Location: Hybrid remote in Edinburgh EH2 3BU

Application deadline: 04/04/2025
Reference ID: OCW Brand Communications & Public Relations Manager
Expected start date: 31/03/2025

title: Director, Brand & Communications
description:
The Role:

We’re looking for a Director of Brand & Communications to elevate Apryse’s story and make sure the world knows we’re the best SDK provider on the planet. This is a highly strategic and hands-on leadership role for a seasoned communicator and brand builder who can connect the dots between what we do, why we do it, and how it feels to be part of it .You’ll own our global brand narrative , shaping how Apryse shows up in the market, in the media, at events, and inside our own walls. You’ll be responsible for ensuring our story is not only heard, but felt by customers, partners, and employees alike.

Responsibilities:

Brand Leadership
• Define and evolve the Apryse brand to reflect our innovation, momentum, and purpose.
• Craft a clear, compelling, and differentiated brand narrative that positions Apryse as the category leader in SDKs.
• Ensure brand consistency and excellence across all channels, creative assets, and global touchpoints.
• Partner with design, product, and growth teams to bring the brand to life through every experience.

External Communications
• Lead our global PR and media strategy, earning attention, not just buying it.
• Build and manage a storytelling engine across content, video, events, and thought leadership that amplifies our presence in the market.
• Cultivate relationships with media, analysts, and industry influencers to drive awareness and credibility.
• Oversee strategic events, speaking engagements, and sponsorships that showcase Apryse’s leadership.

Internal Communications & Culture
• Champion an authentic internal brand that aligns with who we are and where we’re going.
• Lead internal communications to ensure our teams are informed, inspired, and engaged knowing what we’re building and celebrating how far we’ve come.
• Create internal brand advocates who live and breathe the Apryse story every day.
• Infuse a sense of fun and connection into how we communicate

Cross-Functional Impact
• Partner closely with executives and department heads to align messaging and ensure brand authenticity from the inside out.
• Collaborate with HR and Talent teams on employer brand and employee engagement initiatives.
• Manage external agencies, PR partners, and creative vendors to deliver world-class brand and communication programs.

Requirements:
• 10+ years of experience in brand strategy, communications, or integrated marketing leadership (preferably in B2B tech or SaaS).
• Proven success building and elevating global brands ideally in high-growth or category-defining environments.
• Deep experience leading PR, content, and integrated storytelling programs that drive awareness and affinity.
• A track record of building and motivating high-performing teams.
• A natural storyteller who can inspire action with words, visuals, and experiences.
• Comfortable moving between strategy and execution — rolling up your sleeves when needed.
• Passionate about technology, innovation, and the power of clear communication to drive culture and growth.

Benefits:
• Competitive salary commensurate with experience & qualifications.
• Generous paid time Off (PTO) is offered to support the ability to rest and recharge.
• A great team environment and resources, supporting you to do the best work of your life and providing unlimited career growth potential.
• Highly autonomous environment.
• Excellent work-life balance.
• Diverse and inclusive workplace where we all learn from each other.

Company Description

As the industry-leading provider of document software development (SDK) technology powering everything from traditional desktop software to innovative web and mobile applications, at Apryse we are committed to delivering cutting-edge technology solutions that empower our clients to achieve their goals. With a broad international portfolio of combined companies, products, and leading technologies, we are actively changing the way the world works with documents to make work better and life simpler.

Customers like IBM, Autodesk, DocuSign, Boeing, Microsoft (and many more!) come to us to realize their web and mobile strategies for document management, editing, and collaboration as the #1-ranked commercial document SDK of choice for companies worldwide. As a result, you can find our document technology in thousands of solutions, including those of household names, used by millions across virtually every industry. Our XODO app alone has 25M unique installs -- and counting -- and the highest ratings among PDF productivity apps on the largest online app marketplaces.

Ready to join our team?

If you are interested in helping Apryse deliver on its commitments and taking your career to the next level, we invite you to apply online now. Additionally, we view the above section as a guide, not a checklist. We welcome diverse and non-traditional backgrounds and encourage you to apply even if you do not have every requirement listed

We are committed to a work environment that is inclusive to all and free of discrimination. It is our policy to be an equal opportunity employer without regard to race, color, religion, sex, age, national origin, disability, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, genetic predisposition or carrier status, veteran status, citizenship status or any other factors prohibited by law. Apryse will provide reasonable accommodations for qualified individuals.

title: Communications Officer
description:
Salary:

COMMUNICATIONS OFFICER

Full-Time Position

Prince Albert, Saskatchewan

The Northern Inter-Tribal Health Authority is a dynamic and evolving healthcare agency that provides health program support to its four northern partners - Prince Albert Grand Council, Meadow Lake Tribal Council, Lac La Ronge Indian Band, and Peter Ballantyne Cree Nation.

POSITION MANDATE

Under the guidance of the Executive Director, the Communications Officer will execute NITHA's communication strategies. This role involves collaborating with the NITHA team to facilitate effective and comprehensive communication with the NITHA Partnership and a range of external stakeholders. The Communications Officer is responsible for planning, developing, and implementing NITHA's communication, marketing, and public relations initiatives, targeting both internal and external audiences. We are seeking candidates who demonstrate strong cultural sensitivity and respect for diverse traditions, with a particular emphasis on working effectively with Indigenous communities. This position will be based in Prince Albert, Saskatchewan.

QUALIFICATIONS/EXPERIENCE

Our ideal candidate will be an innovative professional with the skills, knowledge, and abilities required, including the following:
• A Bachelors degree in Communications, Public Relations or Journalism, or an acceptable combination of education, training and experience.
• 3 years or more of relevant experience in internal and corporate communications.
• Exceptional written and oral communication skills.
• Experience in developing, leading, and implementing all areas of strategic communications, marketing and public relations.
• Experience in developing and managing visual communication materials for various media, including print, digital, and online. This could involve designing logos, brochures, websites, social media graphics, and other visual assets to convey a message effectively.
• Ability to be creative in producing communications materials, including the ability to synthesize information and feedback into easily understood and audience-appropriate briefing notes, reports and presentations.
• Maintains positive relationships with a wide range of stakeholders, exercising diplomacy, judgement and tact.
• Maintains a high degree of confidentiality and cultural sensitivity.
• Advanced computer skills, but not limited to, Windows, desktop publishing, Adobe Professional and Microsoft Office.
• Experience with Indigenous audiences, knowledge, and cultural competency would be an asset.
• Demonstrates strong cultural sensitivity.
• Experience working with or within a First Nations organization and/or speaking a First Nations language is an asset.
• Possesses a valid Class 5 drivers license and can travel as required.

NITHA has a competitive salary/benefits package. Please note that only a complete application, including a cover letter, resume, three (3) work-related references, and a copy of education /certification, will be considered. We thank all applicants; however, only those selected for an interview will be contacted.

CLOSING DATE:

Open Until Filled

Interested applicants may submit their application in confidence to:

Human Resources Advisor

Northern Inter-Tribal

Health Authority

PO Box 787

Prince Albert, SK

S6V 5S4

Fax: (306) 953 - 5010

Email: hr@nitha.com

www.nitha.com

title: Press Relations (PR) and Strategy Specialist — Master-Level Internship
description:
Please Apply through our Vosyn Career Page

https://vosyn.breezy.hr/p/ddc7270424b6-finance-master-s-level-internship

Job Title: Press Relations (PR) and Strategy Specialist — Master-Level Internship

Level: Master’s Level Internship

Department: Marketing & Communication

Duration: 520 Hours (approximately 3 months)

Work location: Remote (with hybrid options in Toronto)

Compensation: Hourly ($32)

About Us: At Vosyn, we embrace the exciting, game-changing world of Artificial Intelligence, driving innovation and pioneering impactful projects across various industries. We are a trailblazing Language Synthesis AI firm reshaping global communication by dissolving language barriers and empowering users.We believe in fostering a culture of flexibility, continuous improvement, and solution-focused strategies. Here, every idea is welcomed, nurtured, and has the potential to scale to new heights. Currently, we're at the forefront of a significant IPO endeavor, truly a unicorn in the making. We invite you to be part of our journey and leave your imprint on the future of AI.

About the Role: As a PR and Communications Intern at Vosyn, a pioneering AI-driven company offering products like VosynVerse, VosynCore, and VosynConnect, you will play a key role in driving our public relations and communication efforts. This fully immersive internship provides a unique opportunity to work alongside senior leadership to amplify Vosyn’s brand voice and promote groundbreaking AI solutions across media, investors, and key stakeholders.

This is an exciting opportunity for Master’s level students or recent graduates to gain hands-on experience in public relations, strategic communications, and engagement initiatives within a fast-paced, high-growth environment at the forefront of AI innovation.

Key Responsibilities:
• Assist in developing and executing PR and communication plans.
• Support media relations by helping build and maintain relationships with key media outlets and influencers.
• Contribute to the creation of press releases, social media content, and website updates.
• Help plan and manage press conferences, media events, and other PR activities.
• Monitor and analyze the performance of PR and communication activities, providing insights and recommendations.
• Collaborate with the marketing team to build comprehensive campaigns that drive engagement and growth.
• Assist in maintaining and enhancing the company’s brand identity through consistent messaging.

About You:
• Currently enrolled or recently graduated from a Master’s in communications, marketing, public relations, or a related field. Master’s program enrollment or completion is mandatory.
• Strong written and verbal communication skills.
• Understanding of media relations and social media platforms.
• Proficiency in using content creation tools such as Adobe Creative Suite (Photoshop, Illustrator, InDesign) is a plus.
• Excellent organizational skills and attention to detail.
• Ability to work both independently and collaboratively in a fast-paced environment.
• Eager to learn and adapt to new challenges in the field of PR and communications.
• Passionate about AI and eager to contribute to the future of technology.
• Ability to work both independently and collaboratively.
• Strong problem-solving skills and attention to detail.
• New graduates are encouraged to apply

We believe exceptional talent often emerges from diverse paths. If you possess a profound curiosity, a genuine passion for continuous personal and professional growth, and a strong desire to apply your unique abilities to create significant impact within our team, we strongly encourage you to apply—even if your background doesn’t align perfectly with every single qualification.

Why Join Us:
• Be part of the invigorating journey of a start-up transitioning to an IPO.
• Engage directly with senior management and strategic advisory board members.
• Enhance your CV with a rich array of experiences unique to Vosyn and AI Venture Lab.
• Gain hands-on experience contributing to projects that drive growth and make a lasting impact in a fast-paced startup environment.

DEI and Workplace Safety:

At Vosyn Inc., we are committed to fostering a diverse, equitable, and inclusive workplace where every employee feels valued and supported. We believe that diversity of thought, background, and experience enriches our company culture and enhances innovation. We are an equal-opportunity employer and encourage candidates from all walks of life to apply. As part of our commitment to creating a safe and healthy work environment, we prioritize workplace safety, adhering to all relevant regulations and promoting a culture of responsibility. We believe that a safe and inclusive workplace is essential for the well-being and success of our team members. Join us in building a workplace that values diversity, prioritizes equity, and ensures the safety and well-being of every individual.

Recruitment Process:
• Application Submission: Candidates are invited to submit their resumes and cover letters through our career portal.
• Written Questionnaire: Selected candidates will receive a set of 10 written questions to assess their fit and technical knowledge..
• Video Questionnaire: Candidates who successfully pass the written assessment will be asked to answer 10 additional questions to be submitted in a video format to further evaluate their skills and cultural fit. The ability to video record your answers will be required.
• Evaluation: Our team will review the responses to both questionnaires. Candidates who meet our criteria will be invited to the next stage.
• Orientation Session: Successful candidates will be invited to participate in an orientation session where they will learn more about Vosyn, our projects, and what to expect during the internship. After this session, you will be given the opportunity to opt-in if you believe that this internship is for you.

Please note: At Vosyn, we hire on a rolling basis, so we encourage you to apply as soon as possible. While we operate with flexibility, we also cater to academic semester work terms to align with school schedules, ensuring a smooth transition for students joining us.

Be a part of a fast-growing global organization that values diversity of thought, experience, and culture. Our interns come from top universities worldwide, and we invite you to contribute, learn, and grow with us on this exciting journey.

Please note that only candidates who apply through our website will be contacted

Apply Now:
Vosyn Careers

Job Types: Full-time, Part-time, Internship / Co-op

Pay: Up to $32.00 per hour

Work Location: Remote

title: Communications Specialist, Public and Media Relations
description: Where You'll WorkAt the heart of CommonSpirit Health's ministry are the national office departments that provide the foundational support, resources, and expertise that empower local communities to focus on what they do best-caring for patients. Our teams bring together expertise in clinical excellence, operations, finance, human resources, legal, supply chain, technology, and mission integration.Guided by our faith-based values, the national office fosters consistency, alignment, and innovation across CommonSpirit. By centralizing expertise and leveraging economies of scale, we enable each location to operate efficiently while maintaining flexibility to address unique local community needs. From advancing digital solutions to driving health equity, these departments extend the healing presence of humankindness everywhere we serve.Job Summary and ResponsibilitiesThis is a remote position.Job SummaryThe Communication Specialist is responsible for supporting public relations and media relations activities. This role includes broadening the recognition of the organization and enhancing its reputation. The Specialist plays a support role in driving the narrative of the organization, executing communications strategies, and handling interactions with the media.Essential Key Job ResponsibilitiesSupport a comprehensive PR and media relations strategy that promotes, protects, and enhances the CommonSpirit's reputation within the communities we serve and across key stakeholders, including community organizations, government agencies, and industry associations.Identify and pursue opportunities for thought leadership, speaking engagements, public relations events and industry awards to enhance the organization's reputation and visibility.Maintain strong relationships with media outlets and reporters.Support the development and distribution of all press releases, media alerts, and public statements.Plan and coordinate press conferences, media interviews, and other PR events.Either directly or with a designated member of the team, support media inquiries and the management of relationships with media representatives and outlets, including proactive media pitches, press releases and media kits to generate positive media.Advise the executive leadership and key members of the organization on matters relating to public relations and media strategy.Develop and implement crisis communication plans and handle potential PR issues strategically and proactively.Either directly or with a designated member of the team, coordinate messaging and communication efforts during crisis situations.Monitor and analyze PR results regularly and report on the impacts of PR activities.Job RequirementsRequired Education and ExperienceBachelor's degree in Communications, Public Relations, Journalism, or a related field. Minimum of 3 years of experience with public relations, external communications, or related roles.Demonstrated relationships with national and regional press outlets, journalists, bloggers, and influencers.Proven track record in designing and executing successful public relations strategies.Strong knowledge of digital PR platforms and media management software.Experience in crisis and reputation management.Experience managing external PR agencies and vendors.Proficiency in media monitoring and PR software/tools.

title: Manager of Public Relations and Communications
description:
About Good Life
Good Life Companies is a fast-growing, independent RIA platform dedicated to empowering financial advisors to achieve true independence and long-term success. We provide the education, tools, and ongoing support advisors need to build, manage, and grow thriving independent practices—so they can focus on what matters most: serving clients, growing their business, and living their version of the good life.

Position Summary
We are looking for a versatile marketing and PR professional who is a driven go-getter energized by the opportunity to build out Good Life’s Public Relations and Corporate Marketing efforts. This new role will require an entrepreneurial mindset to balance the needs of a role that is equal parts PR/Media Strategy and Corporate Marketing (Social Media, Podcasts, etc…). While you will be part of the larger marketing team, you will independently manage the PR and Corporate Marketing verticals, including strategy and execution under the leadership of the Director of Marketing.

Key Responsibilities

Public Relations & Media (30%)
• Develop and execute Good Life’s public relations strategy to increase brand awareness across the RIA and financial services marketplace.
• Build relationships with key media outlets (Citywire RIA, Barron’s Advisor, Advisor Hub, etc.) to secure coverage and thought leadership opportunities.
• Create and distribute press releases highlighting advisor transitions, leadership updates, platform enhancements, and key milestones.
• Manage media inquiries, executive interviews, and speaking engagements.
• Develop materials such as press kits, white papers, and multimedia content.

Corporate Marketing & Thought Leadership (60%)
• Lead Good Life’s corporate marketing strategy to support advisor recruitment, business growth, and brand differentiation.
• Manage a multi-platform social media strategy (LinkedIn primary) to build engagement and visibility among financial advisors and industry partners.
• Develop and manage multi-platform content to position Good Life as an authority on advisor independence and firm growth.
• Oversee podcast production from planning and guest coordination to editing, publishing, and promotion.
• Conduct competitive analysis to identify trends and opportunities to enhance brand influence.

Corporate Communications (10%)
• Develop internal communication initiatives that strengthen company culture and keep advisors and staff informed.
• Partner with HR, Compliance, and Executive Leadership to ensure messaging is accurate, timely, and compliant.
• Lead crisis communication efforts to protect Good Life’s reputation.

What Initial Success Looks Like (6-12 months)
• Complete an assessment of the current state of Good Life PR, social media, and podcasting to build a foundation for long-term growth.
• Through partnership with the Director of Marketing, formalize a multi-platform marketing strategy that elevates Good Life including social media and podcast reach.
• Establish KPIs to measure the impact of PR and corporate marketing efforts.
• Expansion of Good Life’s visibility through new media relationships, speaking engagements, and award opportunities.
• Develop a consistent thought leadership voice through blogs and content that support recruiting and brand initiatives.
• Create efficient workflows to balance PR and marketing deliverables.
• Become a valued, collaborative member of the marketing team.

Qualifications
• Bachelor’s degree in communications, marketing, business, or related field.
• 5+ years in communications, public relations, or marketing (financial services preferred).
• Proven experience in media relations and social media management (LinkedIn primary; Facebook, Instagram, YouTube secondary).
• Strong writing and editing skills (press releases, blogs, scripts, etc.).
• Experience supporting C-suite executives.
• Experience working with Canva (or similar graphic design program)
• Video production/editing experience preferred.
• Ability to manage multiple projects, meet deadlines, and work collaboratively and cross-functionally in a fast-paced environment.

Working Conditions
• Primarily office-based with occasional travel (up to 30%).
• Requires typical physical demands of an office environment.

title: Public Relations and Communications Manager
description:
Full-service global law firm is seeking a Public Relations and Communications Manager for their NY office.

7 to 10 years of communications, public relations, marketing or journalism experience.

What You Will Be Doing:

As the Public Relations and Communications Manager, you will be responsible for executing a communications and public relations program that reflects the firm’s initiatives and supports business goals. This includes advancing the firm’s reputation and brand through website marketing strategies, oversee blogs and all associated content, the firm’s awards and surveys program, leveraging social media and other tools to effectively promote firm content; and help manage the internal communications and public relations team. You will report to the Director, Communications, Marketing and Client Engagement.

Contributes to the Firm's Service Matters initiative to consistently improve its image internally and externally. Displays professionalism, quality service and a "can do" attitude to internal members/departments of the Firm as well as external clients and vendors via electronic and print correspondence, over the telephone and in-person.

About This Role:
• A self-motivated individual of integrity who respects the confidentiality and sensitivity of the firm’s work. Collaborates closely with marketing and business development leads to ensure news and feature stories are current and appealing to target markets.
• Oversees and produces, from concept to completion, a broad array of digital and/or print promotional and communication materials. Ensures all materials present a clear, unified, and positive image for the firm and/or brand.
• Identifies opportunities for promotion of firm and lawyer news for internal and external utilization. Creates meaningful communications programs that engage and inspire all levels of employees and is grounded in diversity, equity and inclusion.
• Supervises the firm’s responses to editorial-based surveys and awards.
• Successfully performs multiple tasks simultaneously as well as short cycle and long cycle projects, with strong attention to detail, while working alongside team members in a fast-paced, demanding team environment.
• Works closely across teams in the department. Contributes to managing the selected external agencies and consultants.
• Displays professionalism, service-oriented, "can do" attitude to the firm’s lawyers and support services members, and the firm’s clients and vendors.

Required Skills
• Demonstrated ability to lead and develop a team and staff members.
• Ability to handle sensitive and confidential matters with discretion.
• Proven ability to identify and create proactive media opportunities.
• Strong interpersonal skills and professionalism. Willingness to work on other marketing projects, as needed.
• Excellent oral and written communication skills.
• Precise attention to detail, with extraordinary organizational skills and the ability to work effectively under multiple supervisors.
• Excellent business writing skills, including knowledge of business English, vocabulary, punctuation, grammar, and spelling.
• Working knowledge of work practices, policies, and procedures as they relate to function and operations.
• Flexibility and ability to travel to other firm locations when necessary.

Required Experience

Education:
• Bachelor’s degree required.

Experience:
• 7 to 10 years of communications, public relations, marketing or journalism experience.
• Law Firm or Professional Services experience strongly preferred.
• Previous experience successfully managing direct reports preferred.

title: Public Relations (PR) Director
description:
The Public Relations Director will lead all strategic communications, stakeholder engagement, and multinational public relations initiatives for major construction projects. This role requires unique cross-sector experience in construction and international hospitality, proven leadership in press relations, and demonstrated ability to manage multi-country community and media campaigns.

Key Responsibilities

- Design and implement public relations strategies for high-value, cross-border construction projects involving international stakeholders, clients, and government agencies.

- Cultivate and maintain key partnerships with global media outlets, international industry associations, and cross-cultural public sector organizations to promote company activities.

- Spearhead multi-lingual press conferences, crisis management protocols, and reputation management campaigns for large-scale infrastructure development.

- Lead cross-jurisdictional teams on stakeholder consultation processes for overseas developments, utilizing advanced cultural, political, and language expertise.

- Develop and oversee ESG (Environmental, Social, Governance) communication frameworks tailored for international construction markets and sustainability standards.

- Advise senior management on sensitive geopolitical issues impacting construction operations, including F&B sector partnerships and government relations in ASEAN and APAC contexts.

- Mentor and upskill local communication teams, introducing global best practices and ensuring alignment with international regulatory requirements.

Requirements

- Minimum 10 years’ executive leadership in both construction and international hospitality sectors, with direct experience managing PR for multi-million dollar cross-border projects.

- Track record of orchestrating large-scale public engagement initiatives in diverse cultural environments (ASEAN, Middle East, North America).

- Proficiency in multiple Asian and Western languages (spoken and written); proven history as lead spokesperson with major international media.

- Evidence of published work in top-tier international press or industry journals on construction or hospitality topics.

title: Public Relations
description:
Job Description

We are seeking a highly motivated and dynamic Junior Public Relations (PR) Executive to join our growing team at Insider Communications Pte Ltd , a boutique PR and brand consultancy specialising in lifestyle, fashion, beauty, F&B, luxury, and travel clients.

The ideal candidate is passionate about communications, media engagement, and storytelling, with a strong understanding of Singapore’s media and influencer landscape. You will play an integral role in supporting strategic PR campaigns and driving brand visibility for our clients across traditional and digital platforms.

Responsibilities:
• Assist in the conceptualisation and execution of integrated PR and brand communication strategies.
• Develop and distribute press releases, media kits, and brand materials to key media outlets.
• Cultivate and maintain strong relationships with journalists, influencers, and media partners.
• Coordinate and manage client events, media previews, and brand activations.
• Monitor media coverage and prepare post-campaign reports and insights.
• Support senior team members in client servicing, campaign planning, and strategiccommunication initiatives.
• Contribute creative ideas and stay ahead of industry trends, emerging media platforms, and consumer engagement strategies.

Job Requirements
• Bachelor’s Degree in Mass Communications, Public Relations, Marketing, or related field.
• 1–3 years of relevant experience in PR, communications, or marketing (agency experience preferred).
• Strong writing, editing, and storytelling skills with attention to detail.
• Excellent communication and interpersonal skills, with a flair for client and media relations.
• Resourceful, proactive, and able to work independently in a fast-paced, dynamic environment.
• Proficiency in digital and social media platforms is an advantage.
• A passion for lifestyle, fashion, and luxury industries is a plus.

title: Senior Executive - Communications & Public Relations
description:
Employment Type: 2-Year Contract

Job Description:

As a Communications Senior Executive, you will play a strategic role in shaping SINDA’s voice, brand presence, and outreach. This position requires strong analytical abilities, excellent writing skills, media management experience, and project leadership capabilities. You will conceptualise and oversee impactful communication strategies that resonate with diverse audiences, in support of organisational goals.

Responsibilities:

Shape Strategic Communications and Media Relations:
• Craft impactful speeches, articles, and media releases to position the organisation as a thought leader
• Conceptualise newsworthy story angles and collaborate with media professionals to maximise positive media coverage
• Track and analyse media mentions to evaluate communications impact and inform future strategies

Drive Brand Storytelling and Campaigns:
• Lead the development of integrated communications and marketing campaigns, aligned with organisational goals
• Develop compelling brand narratives that highlight stakeholder voices and community impact
• Identify key channels and platforms to strengthen outreach and engagement with target audiences

Oversee Publications and Collateral Development:
• Manage the end-to-end production of flagship publications such as annual reports and newsletters
• Undertake editorial process, including proofreading and fact-checking to ensure content accuracy
• Provide editorial direction to maintain, clarity, consistency, and brand voice
• Coordinate with internal divisions to gather information and align messaging.

Strengthen Brand Identity and Outreach:
• Oversee the use of visual branding materials and ensure compliance with brand guidelines
• Craft department-level SOPs to maintain brand consistency across all communications
• Guide team members in producing content that aligns with organisational identity.
• Recommend improvements and initiatives to enhance brand recognition and visibility across platforms.

Requirements:
• Diploma/Degree in mass communications/journalism/media communications or related fields
• At least 3–5 years of relevant experience in communications, PR, or media management
• Strong knowledge of local media industry, with an established media network
• Excellent written and verbal communication skills
• Effectively bilingual in English and Tamil
• Proficient in media monitoring software
• Good aesthetic sense and ability to produce content on demand
• Familiarity with design tools (Canva/Adobe Suite) and publication production is beneficial
• Intermediate understanding of SEO and SEM
• Resilience and commitment to manage long-term projects
• Willingness to work on weekday evenings, weekends and in outdoor settings, when required (will be compensated with time off)
• Able to participate in SINDA-wide events, when required (will be compensated with time off/Off-in-Lieu).

This is a 2-year contract position, convertible to a permanent role subject to performance and divisional requirements.

Our Welfare:

We aim to take care of your well-being.

We provide:
• Career development opportunities
• Flexible working hours
• AWS/ Bonuses
• Health insurance
• Wellness programmes
• Interested candidates are invited to send their resumes with current and expected salary information.

Only shortlisted candidates will be notified. We thank all applicants for their interest.

Please note that your response to this advertisement and communications with us pursuant to this advertisement will constitute informed consent to the collection, use and/or disclosure of personal data by SINDA to carry out its business in compliance with the relevant provisions of the Personal Data Protection Act 2012. To learn more about SINDA’s Data Policy, please visit SINDA’s Data Privacy Policy.

title: Director, Public Relations & Communications
description:
Director, Public Relations & Communications
(17848)

Atlantis Dubai is part of Kerzner International, and home to two extraordinary resorts: the world-renowned Atlantis, The Palm and the ultra-luxury Atlantis The Royal. Together, they represent world-class service, bold innovation, and unforgettable experiences brought to life.

With over 6,000 colleagues from 129 nationalities, Atlantis Dubai operates as one team, with many departments and back-of-house functions seamlessly supporting both resorts. Across every role and department, our shared purpose is the same: to create amazing experiences and everlasting memories - not only for our guests, but for our colleagues too.

About The Role

Director, Public Relations & Communications is a vital part of Atlantis Dubai’s commercial team in driving the brand’s overall awareness through public relations and communications initiatives, while working to protect and enhance the reputation of Atlantis Dubai globally and regionally.

This is a senior leadership role within the Atlantis organisation with full accountability for developing and overseeing the multimarket strategic PR and Communications planning and execution for the Atlantis brand. This includes two resorts (2,344 rooms), 51 restaurants and bars, including 13 celebrity chef restaurants, the marine & waterpark operation, Atlantis Atlas Project, and spa and wellness facilities

The role will be based in Dubai working across Atlantis, The Palm and Atlantis The Royal. The role will report to the Vice President, Marketing & Public Relations.

Key Duties and responsibilities

Team and leadership
• Oversee and lead a team of four PR Managers, four Assistant Managers, and one Team Admin.
• Oversee and lead a network of 14 agencies across the MENA, APAC, and EMEA regions. Primary markets include the UK, USA, Australia, India, , UAE, KSA, Russia/CIS, Germany, and France. Secondary focus areas include Eastern Europe, South America, and China. Activity includes the creation of international toolkits, global PR campaigns, and market-specific communications strategies and tactics.
• Strong alliance and collaboration with marketing, sales, revenue, digital, and loyalty to achieve strategic and commercial objectives.
• Develop and manage complex annual departmental budgets and responsible for ROI optimisation.
• Delivery of annual KPIs/company objectives and the compilation of reporting needs. Monitor EMV and key metrics, collaborating with cross-functional teams on integrated post-event/campaign/annual reports.

International and regional brand PR
• Develop and implement communications strategies aligned with global brand vision and guidelines for all facets of the destinations’ operation (Rooms, F&B, Marine & Waterpark, Spa & Wellness, Kid’s Club, and Atlantis Atlas Project.
• Drive strategic partnerships and innovations with major global brands and stakeholders to maximize brand PR value and exposure ROI.
• Partner with key stakeholders (Marketing, social media, sales, operations, Kerzner global comms team, RSO’s, DET) to develop and implement integrated 360 go-to-market plans, maximize earned exposure in own channels, and develop regional directives to guide execution to brand standards.
• Lead on securing impactful brand integration and content partnerships across the globe, including movies and TV as well as large-scale stunts, brand partnerships, and activations.
• Lead on securing and managing all tier-one in-resort celebrity visits.
• PR and comms lead on large-scale events including major concerts, seasonal initiatives, and in-resort activations.
• Oversee all global editorial coverage and press relationships for all markets.
• Development and creation of complex asset libraries including all written collateral, image library, and BROLL- defining and delivering the brand and operational narratives.
• Crisis communications, reputation management, and CEO/C-suite communications including speech writing/profiling.
• Lead on the brand’s global award strategy (Michelin, World’s 50 Best, Forbes).

Aquaventure
• Lead on the regional and international PR and comms strategy for the world’s largest waterpark, Atlantis Aquaventure.

Food & Beverage
• Working with global partners and leading the PR and Communications strategy for 51 restaurants and bars, including 11 globally renowned and celebrity chef restaurants including Hakkasan and Ling Ling, Nobu and Nobu by the Beach, Milos by Costas Spiliadis, La Mar by Gastón Acurio, Jaleo by José Andrés, Dinner by Heston Blumenthal, Bread Street Kitchen by Gordon Ramsay, Studio, Frantzén/FZN by Björn Frantzén and Carbone (Major Food Group). Including communications strategies, grand opening events, brand content, and ongoing PR tactics.
• Working alongside chefs/operations to achieve accolades including Gault & Millau Toques, The Best Chef Awards, Michelin stars, and The World’s 50 Best restaurants.

Atlantis Atlas Project
• Lead on the regional and international PR and comms strategy for the Atlantis brand’s sustainability initiative, Atlas Project.

About You

We are looking for an experienced PR & Communications professional with minimum 10 years experience within a large and complex consumer-facing organization or agency. To succeed in this role you should be able to demonstarte the below skills and competencies:

Qualifications and experience
• Excellent contacts in media, entertainment, and influencers and the demonstrated ability to interface effectively with them.
• An exceptional record of achievement as a senior communications professional.
• Demonstrated negotiation and talent relations management skills.
• Experience in managing a team/agencies, and complex workstreams with quality control.
• Experience in budget management.
• Experience delivering crisis and issue management within a regulated and complex operating environment.
• Can deliver campaigns including activations and PR initiatives to drive brand health and growth for the business within narrow timeframes.
• Understand or have worked in or with Travel/Tourism/Aviation/Food & Beverage (desirable)

Skills
• Have exceptional media relations and spokesperson capability.
• Are a natural at building positive relationships and cross-functional teamwork to develop win-win partnerships.
• Have a strong commercial mindset with the ability to balance strategic and tactical initiatives.
• Have the confidence, credibility, and personal presence sufficient to establish and maintain working relationships with senior executive leaders.
• Possess outstanding communication skills with the ability to influence at a senior level, drive engagement, articulate complex concepts, and present compelling arguments.
• Are a demonstrated People Leader.
• Excellent verbal and written communication, interpersonal skills, and presentation.
• Be meticulous, and able to handle multiple tasks efficiently and in an organized way.
• Work in a fast-paced environment.
• Passion for innovation and a relentless pursuit of excellence, coupled with a keen eye for detail and a commitment to delivering world-class experiences.
• Have a well-groomed, professional appearance.

We offer a competitive, tax-free salary paid in UAE Dirhams (AED), alongside a wealth of benefits. These include generous food and beverage privileges, exclusive discounted rates at all Kerzner properties worldwide, comprehensive health insurance (with dental coverage), annual flights home, life insurance, an incentive programme, and a variety of colleague wellness and social initiatives.

With a strong emphasis on learning and development, colleagues at Atlantis enjoy access to world-class training, career mobility, and internal growth opportunities across the Kerzner portfolio - making this an ideal environment for ambitious individuals seeking a long-term, fulfilling career in luxury hospitality. Join the A-Team and discover the extraordinary.

title: Global Director of Communications & Public Relations
description:
Rotana is one of the leading hospitality brands in the region, with a growing international presence and a portfolio of world-class hotels and resorts. We are now seeking a Global Director of Communications & PR to join our executive leadership team and shape the global narrative of our brand.

As the Global Director of Communications & PR, you will define and lead Rotana’s global communications strategy, ensuring consistent and impactful messaging across all markets. This pivotal role requires a strategic, results-driven leader with a strong track record in corporate communications, media relations, crisis management, and brand reputation building. You will oversee all external communications, media relations, PR campaigns, and thought leadership initiatives.

This is a rare opportunity to elevate the global profile of a leading hospitality brand while shaping the way Rotana is perceived by guests, partners, and the media worldwide.

Key Responsibilities
• Develop and implement a unified global communications and PR strategy aligned with Rotana’s business objectives.
• Oversee all media relations, press releases, corporate statements, and proactive storytelling initiatives.
• Strengthen Rotana’s brand reputation through impactful PR campaigns, thought leadership, and digital communications.
• Lead crisis communication management, ensuring timely, accurate, and consistent responses.
• Guide internal communications to align employees, stakeholders, and partners with the brand vision and initiatives.
• Build strong relationships with international media, industry influencers, and strategic partners.
• Champion content creation and messaging that reflects Rotana’s brand ethos across channels.
• Inspire, mentor, and lead a high-performing global communications team while fostering a culture of creativity, accountability, and collaboration.
• Monitor and analyze media coverage, PR impact, and communications KPIs to optimize strategy.

title: Global PR & Communications Director - Luxury Hospitality
description: A prestigious hospitality group is seeking a Director of Public Relations & Communications to lead essential strategies for brand awareness and reputation management at Atlantis Dubai. This senior role involves overseeing a team and collaborating with multiple departments to enhance the brand's global presence. Candidates should have over 10 years of experience in a complex consumer-facing environment and possess strong leadership and communication skills. A competitive, tax-free salary and comprehensive benefits package is offered.

title: Remote Event Logistics Assistant – Vendor & Schedule Coordination
description:
Job Summary

Houston Skilled Consultancy is seeking a proactive and detail-oriented Remote Event Logistics Assistant to support the planning and execution of virtual and hybrid events. This role is essential in ensuring the smooth coordination of vendors, event scheduling, and backend logistics. You will work closely with the event planning team to manage timelines, liaise with service providers, and ensure all logistics run efficiently. If you enjoy working behind the scenes to make things happen and thrive in a fast-paced environment, we want to hear from you.
Key Responsibilities
• Coordinate schedules and availability for vendors, speakers, and event participants.
• Maintain accurate and up-to-date event calendars, timelines, and task trackers.
• Liaise with third-party service providers including technical support, catering (for hybrid events), and event platforms.
• Handle logistics related to digital tools, virtual venues, time zone planning, and resource distribution.
• Track vendor agreements, monitor deliverables, and ensure compliance with deadlines.
• Assist with setup and testing of event platforms such as Zoom, Microsoft Teams, or WebEx.
• Manage incoming communications from vendors and partners and provide timely updates to internal stakeholders.
• Troubleshoot scheduling conflicts and resolve logistical issues prior to and during events.
• Support the post-event reporting process, gathering feedback and data from vendors and team members.
Required Skills and Qualifications
• Strong organizational and time-management skills.
• Proficient in using Google Workspace or Microsoft Office (Excel, Docs, Calendar, etc.).
• Familiarity with online meeting tools and event platforms (e.g., Zoom, Eventbrite, Hopin).
• Excellent written and verbal communication skills.
• Ability to work independently, take initiative, and multitask effectively.
• Comfortable working in a remote, collaborative environment.
Experience
• 1–3 years of experience in event planning, vendor coordination, project management, or administrative support.
• Experience in a remote work setting is highly desirable.
• Prior experience in supporting virtual events is a plus.
Working Hours
• Flexible working hours with the ability to accommodate different time zones.
• Must be available during key event hours and for team check-ins.
• Part-time and full-time options available (minimum 20 hours per week).
Knowledge, Skills, and Abilities
• Strong attention to detail with a logistical mindset.
• Ability to prioritize and adapt quickly to changing timelines.
• Collaborative attitude and willingness to assist where needed.
• High level of professionalism when dealing with external vendors and internal teams.
• Problem-solving abilities in high-pressure situations (e.g., live event support).
Benefits
• Competitive hourly or monthly compensation based on experience.
• Flexible, remote-first work culture.
• Professional development opportunities and training support.
• Exposure to international clients and global event formats.
• Work-life balance and wellness-focused team environment.
• Performance-based bonuses for event success and feedback.
Why Join Houston Skilled Consultancy?

At Houston Skilled Consultancy, we believe in delivering exceptional virtual experiences and events that bring people together, no matter where they are. Join a growing, dynamic team that values collaboration, accountability, and innovation. This role is perfect for individuals who enjoy the behind-the-scenes hustle and have a passion for making things run like clockwork.
How to Apply

Please send your updated resume along with a brief cover letter explaining your interest in the role and relevant experience to us.
Subject Line: Application – Remote Event Logistics Assistant

Only shortlisted candidates will be contacted for a virtual interview. Early applications are encouraged.

title: Assistant Event Coordinator
description:
Role Overview:
As an Events Coordinator, you will play a crucial role in ensuring the success and growth of the organization through effective stakeholder communication, operational support, client coordination, and data analysis. You will have the opportunity to engage with schools, corporate clients, and facilitators to coordinate events and programs seamlessly. Your responsibilities will include planning and managing logistics for in-person and online engagements, distributing relevant materials, scheduling meetings, and gathering key data points for reporting purposes. Additionally, you will serve as a liaison between clients and internal teams to ensure smooth workflow and alignment of expectations.

Key Responsibilities:
- Coordinate events and programs by engaging with schools, corporate clients, and facilitators.
- Plan and manage logistics for in-person and online engagements.
- Distribute relevant materials, schedule meetings, and gather key data points for reporting purposes.
- Serve as a liaison between clients and internal teams to ensure smooth workflow and alignment of expectations.

Qualifications Required:

- Comfortable with MS Office, problem-solving approach, and willingness to travel as required throughout India.
- Background in event coordination and at least 2 years of experience in a similar role preferred.
• Note: This company is dedicated to solving critical problems and making a positive impact on the future. The office in Indiranagar offers proximity to various amenities and public transit options. You will be part of a team of curious, smart, fun, and driven individuals who are passionate about the mission.*

The work schedule may include day shifts, rotational shifts, and weekend availability. Fluency in English, Tamil, and Hindi is preferred, and the willingness to travel up to 50% of the time is desirable. The work location is primarily in person, and the expected start date is 21/07/2025.*
